story:
Help End the Pain…

Lichen Sclerosus Hurts in Many Ways

Announcing a formal study of new method to treat Lichen Sclerosus.

Hello,

If a woman breaks her arm, then her friends come visit and offer comfort. 

If a woman suffers with painful sex, then she does not talk to her friends--often she does not even talk with her lover or physician!  Unfortunately, if she suffers with pain because of lichen sclerosus, even if she talks with her physician, she may not find healing.  

So, if she suffers with painful sex from Lichen Sclerosus, she suffers alone...often for years with often permanent unwanted changes to her vagina.

The pain from both physical dis-ease and from social problems can cause her so much "severe distress" that it can seriously interfere with her life (JAMA 1999).

As the inventor of the O-Shot (R) procedure, I've talked with over 4,000 women about their sexual problems...and unfortunately, this is an area of research that has been underfunded for many reasons.  

We just published this research about ways to use the woman's own blood-derived growth factors to heal sexual pain (click here).  That project (which cost about $50,000) was completely funded out of the pockets of the authors because not one company would help fund the research--even the companies that make the lab equipment we used to do the procedure.  

There' so much stigma around sexual medicine that companies fear it will hurt their reputation to be involved.

Thankfully, the preliminary results done by us and others shows that the same technology we've used for the O-Shot (R) procedure can be used to treat lichen sclerosus in women who have been resistant to treatment and so have suffered for years.

Unfortunately, since there is no drug involved (we use platelets centrifuged from the woman's own blood), there is no huge budget from a drug company to fund our research.

Dr. Andrew Goldstein will be leading a research project to find a better treatment for resistant lichen sclerosus.  The following links explain the research project. Please consider helping fund the project.  No drug company will help, and there is no government funding.  

Please help Dr. Goldstein find the answer.

Andrew Goldstein, MD
Dr. Goldstein's  text book about sexual pain...

Women who wish to be considered for treatment can go here to apply for free treatment as part of the research.

Physicians supplying the treatment (not as part of the research) can be found here.

Relevant Links

Protocol  for this Research

Consent Form for the Research

Budget for Lichen Sclerosus Research

Dr. Goldstein’s Office

What We Need 

We still need a few more subjects for the research.  The women who participate will be treated for free.  The form to apply for participation can be found by clicking here.

We need $96,000 total to complete the research.

The first $20,000 was put in by the O-Shot doctors & the ACCMA.  We need another $76,000.  Every dime is used for this research except for the percentages taken out by this funding website

The World-Wide Impact

Dr. Goldstein has successfully completed multiple studies in the area of vulvodynia. We will get this research done to the benefit of millions of women worldwide and to the benefit of their families.

    Risks & Challenges

    Though the preliminary evidence shows this could be a cure for many women for whom there is no cure (and some of them go on to develop squamous cell carcinoma as part of the disease), we have no guarantee that the treatment will cure all women.  

    Still, even if it cures 30-50 percent of women who previously had no way to find relief, that would be a huge breakthrough.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you're not able to contribute money, would you consider posting on your Facebook page (or on your blog) a link to www.LichenSclerosusTreatment.com ? 

    The more awareness we have about the research, the more likely we are to find a cure.

    Peace & health,

    Charles Runels, MD
    Inventor of the O-Shot (R) procedure

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

Our plan is for every donation we raise, we will reward with a 10ml tin of Coco-Vanilla Dayton Axe Moustache Wax.

Dayton Axe - is a handmade moustache wax, created using a traditional bee's wax formula.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise £1000 for Prostate Cancer UK, there are a number of donation choices starting at just £5. All funding will be donated to the charity and P&P prices will be fair just to cover costs of getting your 10ml tin to you.

The Impact

To learn more about the work Prostate Cancer UK does please visit http://prostatecanceruk.org/information

story:
About Our Mission

Today, many people cannot receive essential medical care because distance, time, or money are insurmountable obstacles.
  • Patients cannot participate in, or complete clinical trials and research therapies for the same reasons.
  • Primary care physicians frequently offer referrals instead of treatment, and travel to distant facilities is now a commonplace occurrence.
  • For those without the appropriate resources this can be a tremendous burden.

We are "Volunteers Pilots Lending a Hand."

CAIR Flight is The Solution

CAIR Flight is the solution! We are a charitable Florida corporation offering a unique community service. Utilizing the tremendous flexibility of general aviation aircraft, we are able to reach 90% of the population by flying in and out of communities, whose airports have no airline services..

The Impact

CAIR Flight flies approximately 23,000 miles a year. That is almost 1 trip around the world at the equator!  Every trip is a mission of mercy making it possible for these critically ill patients to get the treatment they need to stay alive. Here is what patients have to say:

  • "Dear Rick, Everything has gone according to plan.. The best news is, that I actually feel the tumor on my neck getting smaller!!!! I want you to know Rick how much it means to me to be blessed with such a generous man like yourself… You donated your time, fuel, and expenses to do this."
  • "Hi Rick, Thank you for making my life so much easier and Relieving so much stress while going through cancer. You and your organization CAIR Flight have truly helped me go into remission. I have had to go back and forth to the Moffit Center for Surgery and Chemo treatments around 12 times so far."

The Challenge

CAIR Flight pilots volunteer their time and aircraft but the cost of aviation fuel is constantly going up. Your help is needed to ensure these flights continue.

  • Every dollar goes toward helping someone afflicted with cancer or other deadly disease get to where they can receive treatment
  • The money raised will go a long way toward funding operations

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can help.

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about CAIR Flight
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My name is Carla. I am 42 years old and live in Ohio and I am asking for donations so I can purchase a power wheelchair for myself.

 

  I have a degenerative disease in my back called Lumbar Stenosis, also called Lumbosacral Spondylosis, along with Lumbar Radiculitis, Facet Syndrome, Neuropathic Pain Syndrome and Diabetic Neuropathy that make it very difficult and painful to walk. I have had two spinal fusions S1- L5, and more disc disease is apparent leading into the cervical part of my spine. This has left severe nerve damage in my left foot and there is no cure once the nerves have died. Four years of physical and aqua therapy have failed to improve my condition. My neurosurgeon has stated that my back will only continue to deteriorate and I will be forced into a wheelchair.

 

  With the funds I can generate, I will use them to purchase a power wheelchair so I can regain some of my mobility again. I go to college and use the hanicap scooters they have available but they only help me get around at school as I can not take them home with me.  I also would like to put a ramp up to the entryway of the house.

 

I would greatly appriciate help in spreading the word about my need. Please use the donating tools available to help me reach my goal.

Thank you so very much!

story:
My name is Douglas Nery, I'm 29 years old and I came to Canada from Brazil, on July 20 of 2012 to visit my boyfriend. I got a visitor visa allowing me to stay for 6 months.

Our relationship started through a Facebook poke in February of 2012 and we finally met in Brazil in April and, as he lives in Toronto and we didn't want to be apart I came to visit him, but we didn't have the means to buy health travel insurance for this period and also as I have always been in excellent health, I didn't expect anything to happen in such a short time.

On December 15 of 2012, we got married at City Hall in Toronto and started organizing ourselves for the application to change my status in Canada before January 20, when my current visit permission expires and, be able to continue our lives together and happy.

To our surprise, on January 1, 2013 at 1:30pm I started feeling a strong pain in my lower abdominal area. I thought it was from bad food, but after two hours in huge pain and almost losing consciousness, I perceived there was something more serious. We tried to use Aspirin to kill the pain but that didn't work. I started to vomit and pass out. As the health is most important I went to the Emergency Ward of Toronto General Hospital. There they told me about how much it would cost for me for not having health insurance.

After my assessment and some additional testing I was informed I would need emergency surgery to take out my appendix and that I had only a few hours to do it before it would explode and become a much worse situation. That meant I couldn't go to Brazil to do the surgery there for free as a Brazilian.

Then, considering I wanted to live, we did the surgery. The procedure went without complication and my recovery is going very well and quickly.

If I had access to the health Insurance of Ontario, all the procedures would have been covered at no extra cost, including the days at the hospital. But, in my case, I was charged for each day ($3500/day) plus cost of all the exams and also the surgical procedure itself (Doctors fees, anesthesia, etc.).

I arrived at the hospital on Tuesday in the afternoon and left on Thursday in the afternoon.

My visa doesn't allow me to work, then, my husband, who is a freelance musician, is the only responsible for the expenses and, now we don't have any possibility to pay this entire bill.

We have yet to receive the bills from the hospital and separate bills from the doctors. We expect the total medical bill to be about CA$ 25.000,00, money I have never seen in front of me.

That's why I'm here asking for help. I'm shy and sorry but I don't know what to do to help my husband and continue being happy with him here.

Thank you very much to all of you for reading my story and special thanks and profound gratitude for those of you who have extended your generosity to help relieve the burden of my medical expenses!


Any amount of donation helps a lot!

And if you can’t help donating, I ask you to please, share this campaign with your friends and contacts through social media and Indiegogo share tools! I’m sure it will make the difference and we will be eternally grateful!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Rhonda. Life can change in the blink of an eye as was proved to me a few weeks ago when my daddy, my hero, was diagnosed with Congestive Heart Failure.  I am starting this campaign in an effort to help my daddy raise money to help cover the medical expenses he has incurred and will incur as part of his treatment for Congestive Heart Failure (CHF). My dad is only 46 so if he gets the care he needs chances are in his favor for making a great comeback. Unfortunatly daddy has no insurance and with only 20% of his heart working, he is unable to work. He cannot get medical assistance unless he receives his disability which will likely take months and purchasing insurance is highly expensive. Your dontations will help my daddy relieve some of the stress these medical expenses are causing and also will help him be able to continue to receive the care he needs for a full recovery. Doctors expect he will need heart surgery and a pacemaker by Februray if his heart is strong enough for him to undergo the surgery at that time. He will continue to need medications to build up his heart, control his blood pressure, and keep fluid retention at bay until he is able to receive the surgery he needs.

What We Need & What You Get

Though we hope to surpass our $500 goal we wanted to ensure that we were being realistic in setting it. All funds collected will be used to cover medical expenses so the pressures from these debts are relieved and so that daddy can continue to receive the care needed for his recovery. I am faithful the good Lord brought us to this, it is our path to navigate, but that he will see us through it successfully.

The Impact

Your contribution to this campaign may not change the world. It may not make a medical break through for people suffering from Congestive Heart Failure. What your contribution can do is make a huge difference in the life of my daddy and our family. Through your help my daddy can continue to receive top medical care and not be burdened with a pile of medical bills the rest of his life. My daddy can recover and beat this condition while watching his grandson grow into a young man. You may not be able to change the world through this campaign, but you can change the world for one man and those who love him. Please, if at all possible, consider making a contribution, no matter how small, every little bit helps and adds up, whether you are dontating 1 dollar or 50 each makes a difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to personally contribute you can still help with this campaign. Pass the word along to your family, friends, and acquaintances by using the share tools available on the campaign page. Help us reach a Nationwide if not Worldwide audience.

story:
Short Summary

Imagine waking up one day and suddenly you can't say more than 1-2 words to speak. You can think in sentences, but when you speak--only "um" or "I" comes out. Maybe nothing comes out. Maybe you speak normally--at least you think you do--what other people hear is gibberish. Maybe you keep repeating the same thing over and over again, such as "deedle deedle" with different intonation, thinking you are communicating. What is wrong with everyone else that they can't understand you?
 
You can no longer read books or magazine. You can't read your email. You may find that you can recognize that there are written words there, you may recognize a few of them, but you have no idea what it says. You can't use the computer. The keyboard looks very strange to you.
 
One side of your body may not work now. You can feel sensation, but you can't move your leg or your arm. One side of your face may droop, making it harder to eat and to speak clearly. You can't balance, hold a pen in your hand, or dress yourself. You can't balance to go to the bathroom by yourself.
 
You realize people are talking to you--asking you questions or telling you to do things--but why can you only understand a few words of it? How are you supposed to respond? The whole word suddenly speaks a language you don't understand. They speak it quickly and without gestures, so it's confusing and upsetting. 
 

What is going on? 

You have aphasia.
 
Aphasia is a disorder that can occur when someone has a stroke or head injury. Aphasia can happen to any age, race, nationality, or socioeconomic class, and it has devastating effects on those it touches. The person can no longer read, write, speak effectively or understand everything said to them. 
 
But you can get better. There are intensive aphasia programs that can help you and your loved ones learn to communicate better. Too bad insurance doesn't cover it and you can't afford it.

The Aphasia Center provides intensive treatment to persons affected by aphasia. We are a small company doing big things, and it's expensive to provide this service. We want to help each family that comes here as much as we can in the time given, but we don't have backing from any hospital or university to help offset costs. For 25 hours each week, we provide hope, encouragement, support, education, and major changes to persons with aphasia. We want to make an impact on each life here, but we can't afford to give away the treatment. 

By contirbuting to our campaign today,  you will help to provide scholarships to people who have no funds for treatment. Insurance doesn't cover this treatment, even though there are over 25 years of research supporting it. These are people who may be able to return to work with a little help and training, or people who are retired but can't talk on the phone, email, write, read, or speak well enough to socialize in the community or with their friends.
 
Someone told me a long time ago that trying to raise money for aphasia would be a waste of time. The idea was that "no one cares about old people with aphasia". I know that this isn't true, and aphasia doesn't just happen to "old people". I know that lots of people care.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need contributions to pay for scholarships for people with aphasia who need intensive treatment. Once you've lost your job, you dont have insurance--you don't have income. Eventually you end up with Medicare, but it doesn't cover much treatment. Unless you have a large savings account, you're just watching TV for the rest of your life.

What if you just needed a little boost to get back to work and to your life? How do you find the money? What if your child has aphasia?

We plan to use this money to help us provide scholarships and to spread it around to families with aphasia as much as possible. What that means is that instead of ten families getting full scholarships, our goal is to use these funds to give as many people as possible some support. While families will still have to commit to funding some portion of their treatment, we can provide that crucial funding to get them treatment.

We have a big committment to what we're doing and how we're doing it. 

We are working for the families who need intensive treatment and who desperately need our help. 


The Impact

Your gift makes a tremendous impact on the people you'll help.

Your gift may help a person with aphasia learn:

  • to order a meal at a restaurant
  • to communicate with their family better
  • ways to compensate for decreased reading or writing skills
  • to return to work or volunteering
  • coping skills for themselves and their families
  • ways to participate in pre-aphasia hobbies and activities
  • to speak in sentences
  • to watch and understand the news or programs on TV
  • to use the computer to keep in touch with friends
  • a plan to continue their therapy when they return home

Your gift will also provide support, education, and counseling for the caregivers. Families are generally not educated or are mislead about aphasia prognoses, and we help them find hope again.

Want to see results from people we've helped so far, see our case studies page. Only a few of our friends are on here, but they represent a positive change in everyone we help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Anyting you can give counts. Even if you can't give directly, spread the word about aphasia and how devasting it is to lose your communication with the world. It means just as much to us that you pass the message along.

Please ask your friends, co-workers, family and anyone else you know to help out by using your Indiegogo sharing tools. We appreciate your time and generosity in this--it's not easy to make big changes, but few easy things are ever worthwhile.

Welcome to our family! Thank you so much for your support!

What is wrong with everyone else that they can't understand you?
 
You can no longer read books or magazine. You can't read your email. You may find that you can recognize that there are written words there, you may recognize a few of them, but you have no idea what it says. You can't use the computer. The keyboard looks very strange to you.
 
One side of your body may not work now. You can feel sensation, but you can't move your leg or your arm. One side of your face may droop, making it harder to eat and to speak clearly. You can't balance, hold a pen in your hand, or dress yourself. You can't balance to go to the bathroom by yourself.
 
You realize people are talking to you--asking you questions or telling you to do things--but why can you only understand a few words of it? How are you supposed to respond? The whole word suddenly speaks a language you don't understand. They speak it quickly and without gestures, so it's confusing and upsetting. 
 

What is going on? 
You have aphasia.
 

Aphasia is a disorder that can occur when someone has a stroke or head injury. Aphasia can happen to any age, race, nationality, or socioeconomic class, and it has devastating effects on those it touches. The person can no longer read, write, speak effectively or understand everything said to them. 
 
But you can get better. There are intensive aphasia programs that can help you and your loved ones learn to communicate better. Too bad insurance doesn't cover it and you can't afford it.

The Aphasia Center provides intensive treatment to persons affected by aphasia. We are a small company doing big things, and it's expensive to provide this service. We want to help each family that comes here as much as we can in the time given, but we don't have backing from any hospital or university to help offset costs. For 25 hours each week, we provide hope, encouragement, support, education, and major changes to persons with aphasia. We want to make an impact on each life here, but we can't afford to give away the treatment. 
By contirbuting to our campaign today,  you will help to provide scholarships to people who have no funds for treatment. Insurance doesn't cover this treatment, even though there are over 25 years of research supporting it. These are people who may be able to return to work with a little help and training, or people who are retired but can't talk on the phone, email, write, read, or speak well enough to socialize in the community or with their friends.
 
Someone told me a long time ago that trying to raise money for aphasia would be a waste of time. The idea was that "no one cares about old people with aphasia". I know that this isn't true, and aphasia doesn't just happen to "old people". I know that lots of people care.
 



What We Need & What You Get
We need contributions to pay for scholarships for people with aphasia who need intensive treatment. Once you've lost your job, you dont have insurance--you don't have income. Eventually you end up with Medicare, but it doesn't cover much treatment. Unless you have a large savings account, you're just watching TV for the rest of your life.
What if you just needed a little boost to get back to work and to your life? How do you find the money? What if your child has aphasia?
We plan to use this money to help us provide scholarships and to spread it around to families with aphasia as much as possible. What that means is that instead of ten families getting full scholarships, our goal is to use these funds to give as many people as possible some support. While families will still have to commit to funding some portion of their treatment, we can provide that crucial funding to get them treatment.
We have a big committment to what we're doing and how we're doing it. 
We are working for the families who need intensive treatment and who desperately need our help. 
The Impact


Your gift makes a tremendous impact on the people you'll help.
Your gift may help a person with aphasia learn:

to order a meal at a restaurant
to communicate with their family better
ways to compensate for decreased reading or writing skills
to return to work or volunteering
coping skills for themselves and their families
ways to participate in pre-aphasia hobbies and activities
to speak in sentences
to watch and understand the news or programs on TV
to use the computer to keep in touch with friends
a plan to continue their therapy when they return home

Your gift will also provide support, education, and counseling for the caregivers. Families are generally not educated or are mislead about aphasia prognoses, and we help them find hope again.
Want to see results from people we've helped so far, see our case studies page. Only a few of our friends are on here, but they represent a positive change in everyone we help. 
Other Ways You Can Help


Anyting you can give counts. Even if you can't give directly, spread the word about aphasia and how devasting it is to lose your communication with the world. It means just as much to us that you pass the message along.
Please ask your friends, co-workers, family and anyone else you know to help out by using your Indiegogo sharing tools. We appreciate your time and generosity in this--it's not easy to make big changes, but few easy things are ever worthwhile.
Welcome to our family! Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Unfortunately Indiegogo does not respond to customer service inquires in a timely manner, and they tickers and counters never seem to work. Although I am still struggling to raise awareness for Vaper Awareness, I will not be working with Indiegogo in the future. IF YOU HAVE ALSO HAD THE SAME PROBLEMS WITH INDIEGOGO, I urge you to reach out to me, as I will be releasing a press release after this campaign has concluded and the funds have been dispersed to me. Thank you, Kristen 


____________________________________________________________________

Smell smoke? Who's fighting for your quality of life? Doing nothing? May as well strike the match. Join Vape Response

This is a top down approach to get people to "let smoking cigarettes go." Targeting the oldest cigarette smokers, so that as they quit, they will show, by example, how easy it is to be responsible and fight against Second Hand Smoke. We must protect the right to Vape.

Meet Liz:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BfdOkrYNotM

My Story

Less than two years ago, I lost my father to lung cancer. It was a five year long battle, that we never thought would happen to us. The series of doctors, running to and from appointments, to exams and treatments left all of us physically exhausted for years. The random hospital stays, when a cold, turned into pneumonia, meant another several weeks of overdrive. We pitched in, and we juggled the best we could, trying to keep everything else non-cancer related running smoothly. The emotional toll, filled with misguided hope that radiation, chemotherapy, or a lobectomy (a surgical procedure performed to remove one of the lobes of the lungs),  would save my dad, changed all who loved him. Lung cancer is a disgusting and degrading disease, that stole pieces of my dad every day, little by little, until there was nothing left. I do not wish this on anyone. Possibly if Vapor was available, my father may have been able to quit smoking as easily as I did. 

The Problem

I am not alone in this, according to the World Health Organization July 2013:

  • Tobacco kills up to half of its users.
  • Tobacco kills nearly 6 million people each year. More than five million of those deaths are the result of direct tobacco use while more than 600 000 are the result of non-smokers being exposed to second-hand smoke. Unless urgent action is taken, the annual death toll could rise to more than eight million by 2030.
  • Nearly 80% of the world's one billion smokers live in low- and middle-income countries.
  • Consumption of tobacco products is increasing globally, though it is decreasing in some high-income and upper middle-income countries.


The Solution

A Vapor Store that promotes Vapor as a Smoke Cessation Aid. I believe that Vapor Stores provide a real solution to cigarette smokers. I personally have struggled with cigarettes since I was in middle school. Over 25 years of cigarette smoking, trying various cessation aids, which resulted in many failed attempts to quit. Vapor was the easiest cessation aid to use, and made quitting cigarette smoking as easy as changing from regular soda to diet soda. 

Currently Vapor products are being sold alongside tobacco products, or in head shops, next to adult movies and drug paraphernalia. A place my dad would have never stepped foot inside. I want a Vapor Store that promotes Vapor as a Smoke Cessation Aid. I want to be a socially responsible Vapor retailer, targeting people who struggle with tobacco addiction.  A clean safe place, where my father would have been proud to be associated with and the place he would have been able to win his battle with cigarette addiction.   

How You Can Help 

I want to save lives by creating a vapor store in the NYC/Long Island metropolitan area, please contribute to this campaign today to make it a reality.

1. Tell everyone you know about Vapor and this campaign http://igg.me/at/k10earth. Use Google+, Facebook and Twitter to share this campaign. Ask your friends and family join the fight. 

2. Contribute support this campaign. 

DETAILS

Grandpa's Vapor Store

My immediate dream is to open the first Grandpa’s Vapor Store in the NYC/Long Island Region. Once Grandpa’s Vapor Store is the shinning example of a Senior Vapor Education Center, we will coordinate with the 501c3 Vapor Council, to provide recommendations and designations to other retailers who also share our commitment to Seniors.

Grandpa's Vapor Store:

  • Specializing in Teaching Seniors How to Use Vapor Devices
  • Special Senior Line Addressing Unique Concerns Like Button Sizes and Ease of Use, and senior pricing.
  • Senior Vaping Club – A support group for seniors by seniors. The store will give them a place to meet.
  • Family Support Group – A support group for those who love cigarette smokers.
  • Free Workshops in Assisted Living Facilities to Teach Cigarette Smokers About Vapor
  • Device and Equipment Repair Services
  • Full Line of Vapor Equipment
  • Patient Courteous Staff
  • House Calls
The K10 Vapor Council

Future . . . Charitable Organization 501c3

I am calling on other concerned people in the Vaping Community to join me in the formation of The K10 Vapor Council.

For those of you who have never started a 501c3 I will briefly outline the process. First we must establish a group of volunteers who want to aid in the establishment of this council. We will use Google Hangouts to have a monthly video meeting. 1) Create Constitution and By Laws 2) Incorporate 3) One year of Meeting Minutes (annual, monthly, weekly, we decide) 4) Apply for 501c3 status 5) Celebrate the new 501c3 Charitable Organization 

(I have done this before. The process is easy when you know the steps.)

The Board Of Directors

7 officers & voting members, plus 3 alternates, for a total of 10 people.

Board Member Officers

President, Vice President, Treasurer (Corporate), Treasurer (Membership), Secretary (Corresponding), Secretary (Recording), Parliamentarian, Board Member 1 Retailer, Board Member 2 Supplier Manufacturer or Distributor, Board Member 3 Community Member  

This group will create the Constitution and By Laws for this corporation, and are signing on for a two year commitment to work with The Vapor Council from Constitution & Incorporation until 501c3 designation.

Mission Statement: The Vapor Council is an independent organization of people, committed to fighting for fair Vapor regulations and legislation. We agree in a cooperative approach between, manufacturers, distributors, retailers and users, to create a safe and respectful vaping community.  

5% of All Sales from Grandpa's Vapor Store will directly support the Vapor Council.

The Vapor Council, like all good organizations, will be a place to grow and evolve with its members. Please message me for details if you are interested in taking on a major role in this process.

story:
TreeTaggr™ – Mobile Forest Health Tool

Turn your smartphone into a tool that tracks tree disease outbreaks and deliver forest health data to scientists and forest managers around the world.

Why TreeTaggr

Forests cover one-third of the total land area on our planet. Yet millions of hectares of native forests are under threat each year by a host of new stresses induced by climate change, including a growing number of pests, diseases, pollutants. Certain species such as the once-dominant chestnut and elm have been virtually wiped out by invasive disease.

So the fight is on to save the eastern hemlock, ash, and the suddenly vulnerable conifer stands from both native and non-native pests and diseases. And with the TreeTaggr app you can join the fight!

“There is no more pressing need than the need to preserve our trees, for our earth, and ourselves.  Any way we can help gather information on the health of trees must be embraced. TreeTaggr is a much needed tool for researchers and citizens who, together, are fighting to save our forest trees.” – Lori Knowles, Health Law Institute, Canada

Developed by the Institute of Forest Biotechnology, the TreeTaggr app uses the camera and geolocation functions on a smartphone to ‘tag’ unhealthy trees in a healthy forest, or, alternatively, healthy trees in an unhealthy stand.  This app is the first tool that would leverage the availability and connectivity of smartphones for forest health data collection. It would allow a user to walk into a forest, photograph a tree, add details about the tree, and send the information to a geographic database.  The user can then note the tree type, if the tree appears diseased or healthy, and add other observations.

The app would incorporate a game aspect to further encourage people to explore forests and notice tree health. Points will be given to the user as he or she identifies and explores more forests. (Points for exploring – how great is that!)

Our goals for this phone app are two-fold: 1) to get the public interested and engaged in gathering forest health information for analysis, and 2) generate forest health trend information that can help curtail disease spread in forests. Anyone interested in promoting healthy forests – such as foresters, hikers, conservationists, citizen scientists, educators, and anyone else with a smartphone who cares about trees are all potential users.

The TreeTaggr App:

  • Automatic detection of the user’s location when making a report.
  • Ability for the user to enter information about the tree affected by disease or a parasite.
  • Attach photographs that will help the scientists evaluate the tree’s health.
  • Upload the collected information to a geolocation database.
  • Display leaderboard information so users can play while making reports.

 “From a certain perspective TreeTaggr is simple. It is basically a ‘crowd sourced’ data collection tool for tracking the spread of tree disease within and across forests.  But TreeTaggr is also a harbinger for something much bigger. TreeTaggr portends a new way of thinking about scientific research and a new way of thinking about volunteerism.” – Neil Hepburn, PwC, Canada

We want to raise $20,000 to get the Android phone application code written.

Work completed:

  • Framework for the app developed
  • Database designed and built – Microsoft Azure with Geolocation
  • Web-driven API – Communication conduit between database, website, and phone
  • Android phone application scoped in detail

We have a fully scoped software development proposal that includes all the details and features we have spent the last year brainstorming. This will give us a full-featured beta version of TreeTaggr in hand. We have been fortunate to have some really amazing pro-bono help to get us to this point (We know a guy). With the beta version complete, we will have a product ready to be used, tested and expanded to other smartphone platforms. We can begin gathering ‘tags,’ get feedback from beta-testers, and add finishing touches to the app. Any funds raised beyond the $20,000 goal will be used to develop the user interface for the website, and expand the app to additional phone platforms such as iOS and Windows.

Because The Institute of Forest Biotechnology is a non-profit 501-c-3 organization, the majority of your donation (89% in fact) is tax-deductible.

The Impact

Your smartphone has all the tools necessary to help improve forest health. The TreeTaggr platform has been built from the ground up to give you, your friends, family, colleagues, and anyone else with a smartphone and a passion for forests the ability to create robust, actionable, scientific research.

 “Treetaggr is a great way to engage not only citizen scientists, but everyone else who uses our forests and wants to keep them healthy for generations to come. This tool will help people understand the threats to our forests on a real-time and local scale, while at the same time getting better regional scale information to forest managers.” – Michael Rodemeyer, University of Virginia, USA

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about our campaign and get the word out about TreeTaggr. Visit TreeTaggr.org and hit the support button. Give us a shout out on Facebook or Twitter.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Contact Information
Adam Costanza, President                                  Susan McCord, Executive Director
Institute of Forest Biotechnology                         Institute of Forest Biotechnology
adam.costanza@forestbiotech.org                      susan.mccord@forestbiotech.org

forestbiotech.org
The Institute of Forest Biotechnology works for societal, environmental, and economic benefits from appropriate uses of biotechnology in forests worldwide through science, dialogue, and stewardship.

story:
Short Summary

In 2009 I had never heard of the Medical Biomagnetic Pair Therapy, but it came into my life and literally CURED me of a chronic digestive problem overnight that had been bothering me for years. I immediately knew I had found my mission in life!

This year in October I celebrated my 7th year as a Biomagnetic Specialist helping thousands of people overcome pain and suffering. This great healing journey pushed me to write books, and I just finalized my 6th and most revolutionary book which teaches people like you how to use magnets at home, because the fact is that the world needs it, and gaining access to a therapist like me is virtually impossible for the billions of people on earth. 

The wonderful people currently using my system are reporting more mental clarity, easier time solving problems, overall sense of optimism, energized, pain relief and more. One gentleman even told me he avoided an Emergency Room visit when after a 10 minute magnet application the abdominal pain disappeared; all of this without harmful side effects or risk of injury.

What We Need & What You Get

We are at the production stage and making the minimum order to get magnets delivered costs $4,753 due to the engineering of special molds

Our perks allow you to also get access to the great benefits of our Biomagnetic System

Every little bit of your donations go into the development and marketing of our system.

The Impact

When you contribute on our Election Day Magnetic Blitz day, you are also voting for Biomagnetism, and helping to make our world a better place:

We are providing safe and natural pain relief solutions that can't possibly harm you or poison you

Many testimonials are pouring in, but I'm greatly impressed that someone was able to avoid an emergency room visit using this system

We miss 100% of the shots we don't take, so why not give these magnets a try?

Risks & Challenges

There are zero risks and challenges.  Pioneering Biomagnetism is my life and every moment of my life is dedicated to making sure everybody on earth experiences this science. 

Since 2009 I have helped thousands overcome pain and suffering and have written several books 

This system is the most revolutionary of them all because it teaches, in layman's terms, a very simple and effective approach

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help right now with a donation:

Please help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

Use Indiegogo's share tools!

And that's all there is to it.  Best wishes to you all!

story:
BENEFITS

 

 

 

 

HIGH LEVEL OF PROTECTION

95+ Protective non-sterile respiratory masks provide effective filtration of most bacteria and gas solid particles.

 

UP TO 10 TIMES OR 40 HOURS OF USAGE

These masks have up to 40 hours of lifespan, can be used up to 10 times and can be hand-washed with hot water.

 

COMPLIANT WITH STANDARDS AND GUIDELINES

Designed and manufactured according to KN95 China standard. Mask filter efficiency compliant with FDA, NIOSH N95 and KN95 guidelines.

 

99% OF PM2.5 FILTRATION EFFICIENCY

Tests have indicated filtration efficiency of more than 99% of PM2.5 particles and
more than 95% of PM0.3 particles. Mask filter efficiency is designed using NIOSH N95 guidelines.

 

ONE SIZE FITS MOST

Our 95+ masks have standard medical size and are suitable for adults.

 

 

NO VELCRO OR STICKY GLUE

Face masks utilize premium hypoallergenic and latex-free breathable material. Inner layer is unique with its soft facial tissue and is gentle to the skin.

 

MINIMAL STORAGE SPACE REQUIRED

The masks are easy to store and reuse.

 

ECONOMICAL SIMPLE DESIGN

Best to keep your wallet in check.

 

LIGHTWEIGHT & MAXIMUM COMFORT

The masks are lightweight and are comfortable to wear.

 

WORLDWIDE SHIPPING

Delivered quickly to your doorstep.

 

 

 

 

 

95 Plus masks use professional melt-blown material with static-electret technology to trap air pollution particles at efficiencies of:

Protection is recommended for AQI* Levels over 100.

95 plus masks are designed to safeguard public health against particulate air pollution in areas impacted by poor air quality.

 

COMPARISON CHART

 

 

CERTIFICATES AND
STANDARDS COMPLIANCE

 

REWARDS

 

 

TIMELINE

 

MEET THE TEAM

 

 

WE STARTED OUR CAMPAIGN WITH THE AIM TO FIGHT THE MASK SHORTAGE WORLDWIDE -
THE #1 SURVIVAL GEAR.

Ever since the beginning of this year, we've been following The Crisis. We are working overtime to keep up with demand.

We have worked fast to get in touch with manufacturers in Asia, Europe and US - now we've reached our peak productivity - 100,000 masks per week.

 

 

Our goal is to deliver 2400+ face masks with 6000 EUR of funding.
This is a donation and direct offer endeavour.

We are concerned about the wellbeing of front line medical and healthcare personnel having insufficient supplies and are in close cooperation with the WHO. If we exceed our goal, we will be donating masks, face shields and one time gloves to hospitals and service providers.

 

JOIN US, WE'VE ADDED A DONATE OPTION TO OUR CAMPAIGN AS WELL!!

We hope to give the best benefits to our backers as well.

As our backer, you will get your order shipped and delivered quickly to your doorstep, wherever you are.

 

 

FAQ

 

Can I use this mask for 40 hours?It mainly depends on the environment where you are going to wear the mask. If the environment is generally clean with no air pollution, you may use the mask for up to 40 hours or up to 10 times. If the environment is dirty with a lot of dust, the efficiency of the mask might be reduced.

 

Where will the donations go?All masks produced with the funds raised from the campaign will be donated and delivered directly to the medical centres in the USA, Canada, UK, Germany, Netherlands, France, Portugal, Singapore, Australia, New Zealand and Malaysia. To save time and cost, donations will be delivered by international couriers or local services to medical centres that have stated needs on the US PPE registry (https://getusppe.org/). For other countries, contact us directly.

 

Are ordinary medical masks a viable defense against droplet transmission of viruses?Conventional medical masks help prevent the spread of droplets. Their bacteria filtration efficiency of reaches over 95% (i.e. the BFE95 / BFE99 standard). They can filter 95% of direct 2.5 micron particles. The particle diameter of the foam is relatively large, so they can filter out viruses. However, ordinary masks are relatively thin, and they are worn over the mouth and nose for several hours and become moist which reduces their efficiency. So, if you wear one you'll need to change it often.

 

Why are you doing fundraising on Indiegogo?We would like to raise €6,000 via this campaign which will cover cost of materials and overheads (production, transportation, export and import duties) associated with producing the 2400+ face masks that we would like to donate.

story:
We are a team of cross-cultural people who have responded to the basic need of having to ingeniously provide comfort and safety to people in public  and private spaces when people cough or sneeze and may potentially spread germs or infections that cause diseases and various sicknesses when the respiratory outputs from them coughing or sneezing suspends in the air for people to inhale or when it drops on surfaces that that further transmit diseases.

 

The prevalence of diseases in time past through respiratory infections have accounted for epidemics and pandemics that have caused losses of loved ones and incapacitation of many with huge lost resources and economic disability for people globally.

A review of an MIT research

 

Preliminary data of respiratory diseases that the implementation of the SneezeBox can prevent is revealed below :

Our campaign is one for which we seek your participation on the global front so that we can habitually prevent the spread of sicknesses through the use of the SneezeBox in a way that reduces the incidences of infections that cost people lives and resources.

 

SneezeBox structural features :

As a game changer...

 

 We understand that there are other seeming materials that people  use but these are very ineffective.

 

 

 

 

 

  

                                                 

 

 

 

                                                   

 

 

This campaign is very important to us because it will give us the required resources to get our product to where it can be seen and more orders can be made by most groups of people who want to prevent prevalence of Pandemics/Epidemics or Sicknesses that make family members feel unwell or loose their lives.

 

Our solution is cheap effective, Eco-friendly, Foldable, portable and fashionable

 

 

            

       

 

                                   

 

 

Contributions will first help us get you to use our product for which we know you will be delighted to make direct orders afterwards. The will then translate to our product being able to make it to very important markets and regions where the Winter season may bring sicknesses.

These regions will find the SneezeBox useful as the prevalence of hospital visits will be prevented and loss of lives will be averted, especially with speculations that the COVID-19 pandemic may return. Your contributions will ensure the product is available for us to respond accordingly to respiratory infections in a way that we are not held down any longer again and people will never have to deal with the loss of their loved ones to diseases that the SneezeBox can prevent. 

 

 

The Team

 

The SneezeBox Team comprises 

Deji Olarinre
Lead Innovation Developer
(12 years Hands-on Development Expertise)

 

Jenifer Price
PR Advisory

Alex Johnson
Business development
(10 years Industry Experience)

 

Daniel Israel
Products Engineering
Modeling and prototyping expert

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need to raise quite a lot of money to be able to achieve a  minimum order quantity at our initial SneezeBox commercial production. We are optimistic about getting Millions of Orders so we can thereby make a sustainable ground to global health organizations to frontline our solution as the most appropriate life saving respiratory disease prevention devices as opposed to the W.H.O. recommendation of people to sneeze into the inner cup of their elbows. your support by way of massive orders will help us prove that point and leapfrog accordingly. We will be able to initiate a great chain or economic value derivatives that provide employment for people, provide healthy alternatives to the world of a solution that reduces carbon foot print and improves health safety while eventually settling as a round pole in a round hole solution for combating the spread & transmission of infectious respiratory droplets that can cause diseases or death.

The SneezeBox pack cost £0.099 per unit at retail  and we are batching same to be sold in groups of 10 pieces - (£0.91),  50 pieces - (£5.00), 100 pieces will sell for (£10.00).

  • Our minimum order will be for people to buy 10 pieces @£0.91
  • There is a flat Shipping fee of £4.00 for orders of of 1 - 500 pieces
  • A flat rate shipping fee of £8.00 will be required for orders of 501 - 999 Pieces (10 SneezeBox packs)
  • A flat rate Shipping fee of £20.00 will be added for orders of 1000 Pieces and above

  • People who buy 5 Packs (500 SneezeBox pieces) will get 50 additional SneezeBox pieces Free
  • People who buy 10 Packs (1000 SneezeBox pieces) will get additional 100 Pieces free with a minimum 16% Discount  
  • Our Jumbo Offer is for people who will order 50 Packs.  They will get a discount of about 20% ,Enjoy a flat rate shipping fee and be named in a charity donation to a public health care advocacy organization in Africa.

 

If we are unable to reach our desired goal of being able to put out 1,000,000 SneezeBox units in the hands of users by the end of this campaign, funds will be returned to backers and in the instances where we exceed our targets on some perks, we will make donations on behalf of backers to a public health Non- Governmental Organizations in Africa.

 

The Impact

 

Your contribution helps get a product to the market where it can help people protect their loved ones and stay alive. The SneezeBox prides itself in being a simple 21st century solution that supports health and wellness globally. 

 

Risks & Challenges

We have a commitment to deliver the products to all who pre-order in the face of delayed fulfillment time that may be as a result of shipping / logistics challenges that arise from the shipping pressures associated with the end of the year/ the beginning of another year.

 

We have made arrangements with multiple providers to forestall any disappointments

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We will appreciate you kindly share our campaign with people who may be interested in doing something different and meaningful for others. The Indiegogo share tools as well as your social media platforms can get word out about our product to your sphere of influence and we seek your support in this way.

story:
Kelsen's Story

The first 8 months of life have not been easy for little Kelsen J Wood.  He has been in and out of the hospital, undergone surgery in both eyes, and is currently confined to a hospital bed in the ICU at Primary Children’s Hospital in Salt Lake City, UT.  He is relying on the Berlin Heart that he is connected to in order to keep him alive while he waits patiently for a heart transplant.  This could take weeks, this could take years...

What We Need & What You Get 

The last thing any parent wants to worry about when their child is sick is money.  Our goal is simple: help them in any way possible with their overwhelming medical expenses.  The costs associated with an extended hospital stay alone are immense, not to mention the added costs of multiple surgeries, the heart transplant they are desperately waiting for and the medication Kelsen will need after the transplant.

Every little bit helps and lots of little bits can add up to something pretty substantial.  Please consider donating.  Kelsen and his family will be forever grateful.

Currently, anyone who makes a $5 donation will receive a blue silicone "Stay Strong Kelsen" wristband

 For $20 donation you will recieve a "I heart Kelsen" T-shirt.

For $50 you get a customized hand-painted snapback hat by local Utah artist  

Casey Chohachi Kawaguchi

 

 

All donations are welcome. You can donate any amount of money that you are able to.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help this cause but are unable to contribute financially please consider the following options:

  • Donate blood
  • Become an organ donor
  • Volunteer your time at local hospitals

story:
** UPDATE 04MAY 10:20pm**

Thank you for your continued support, everybody. Mom, dad and Gideon spent the night in the hospital with Gideon receiving his phototherapy, slowly bringing down his bilirubin levels. They were able to go home the following day. Mom is feeling worlds better about feeding as Gideon continues to discover never to look a gift boob in the mouth. Both mom and dad took to Facebook to thank everyone for their support:

"I just wanted to say I am so filled with gratitude with all of the love and support we have received through so many family, friends and people we barely know. I am doing great and don't know what to do with myself as the receiver of so much. Words of thanks are not enough. I haven't been on Facebook because there is just so much to do all the time right now. I'm so enjoying my new role and new life with Thomie and Gideon! Thank you all from the bottom of my heart." - Liz

"I feel like I can't say "Thank You!" enough. We are overflowing with gratitude to all of our friends and family. Thank you for the Meal Train! Thank You to all who contributed to Boobs for Gideon! Thank you to every text message asking how we were or if we needed something. Thanks for my in-laws who's support through the hardest moments meant more than you will ever know. Thank you to my brother for making such a long trip just hold my son. Thank You to our amazing birth team, who made the best possible experience we could have, and in our home. Thank You all, We love you all!!!" - Thomie

** UPDATE 02MAY 6:26pm**

As it turns out, the drama concerning little Gideon isn't over. Gideon had his first doctor appointment today and his bilirubin levels are too high (in other words, he has jaundice). Many newborns have minor jaundice, but because Gideon was born almost a month early and all he wants to do is sleep he isn't feeding enough to bring the bilirubin levels down. 

Mom, dad and Gideon are on their way to Beaumont Hospital to treat Gideon with phototherapy (light therapy). Interesting info from the Mayo Clinic: 

"Your baby may be placed under special lighting that emits light in the blue-green spectrum. The light changes the shape and structure of bilirubin molecules in such a way that they can be excreted in the urine and stool. The light isn't an ultraviolet light, and a protective plastic shield filters out any ultraviolet light that may be emitted.

During treatment, your baby will wear only a diaper and protective eye patches. The light therapy may be supplemented with the use of a light-emitting pad or mattress."

Liz is feeling better, and is taking it easy as she heals. Her midwife assessed her to be in good enough shape to leave the house today for Gideon's first doctor appointment - for which I'm sure Liz felt thankful to be able to get out of the house for a bit.

The support for Boobs for Gideon has been overwhelming, and we met our goal in a ridiculously short amount of time. Gideon had his first session with the lactation consultant today, and he is already improving leaps and bounds over how he was a couple days ago. If Gideon keeps improving at this rate he may not need all four sessions we raised money for, but that money will be a huge help when mom and dad have to pay the $3,000 insurance deductible their policy carries.

Also, if you didn't have time to contribute before we reached the goal your contribution would still be very much appreciated so we can help reduce the burden of that deductible as much as possible - the campaign will remain open until May 16th.


** UPDATE 02MAY 1:30pm**

In only slightly more than 24 hours we have exceeded our $600 goal. When I created this campaign, I wasn't sure if we were going to even reach the goal over the entire 16-day campaign! I want to thank you all for contributing to little Gideon's boobie education - the support has been seriously overwhelming. 

Apparently, Indiegogo doesn't let you end your campaign early if you reach the goal, so this campaign will still be online until May 16th. If you had been planning to contribute but the goal was reached before you had the chance, rest assured there are uncountable things that your money could go towards assisting mom and dad with their first-time parenting endeavor. 

Thank you all once again for your support,

Mom, Dad, Aunt Erica & Uncle Andy

-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-


A Lifelong Pursuit

For many men, the crisis of not ever having enough boobs begins at puberty and continues for as long as they can remember what a boob is. Unfortunately for Gideon, his mammaries of pursuing boobs began when he was one day old.

A Breasttaking Entry

Due to his eagerness to join the world, Gideon literally assumed a superman pose while traveling down the birth canal. Unfortunately, he wasn't quite self aware enough at this point to realize that his fingernails were literal daggers and he scratched mom on his way out.

The First 36

As it turns out, snitches aren't the only ones who get stitches; mom had to go to the hospital and get some stitches as well. During the time that mom was in the hospital, Gideon couldn't be with her because the sickly environment of the hospital made it too risky for his newborn immune system. Because of this, Gideon is not latching onto mom's boob to feed and instead prefers dad's finger and a syringe.

Nipple the Problem in the Bud

Here are the udderly titillating details:

  • My name is Andy, and I'm Gideon's uncle. As an uncle, I have certain God-ordained duties. Near the top of that list is to make sure that when Gideon is presented with a boob staring him in the face, he knows what to do with it.
  • I'd like to use this campaign to (1.) make you laugh at all the boob puns and (2.) raise money for mom and Gideon to see a lactation consultant.
  • Yes, that's a real thing.
  • The lactation consultant will help to pair Gideon's mouth to mom's boob once and for all - for a fee, of course.
  • At $130 a session, I am trying to raise enough money for 4 consultant sessions. If Gideon catches on quicker than that, let me assure you there is no shortage of things that mom and dad could use the extra money for as first-time parents.
  • If you're paying attention, you must have realized that $130 * 4 is not equal to $600. You sir, are correct. Indiegogo takes between 4%-9% and credit card transactions tack on an additional 3%, so I figured those fees into the fundraising goal.

You Can Help

This isn't one of those KickStarter campaigns that asks for $20,000 and then ends up raising $100,000. Boobs for Gideon might not even make it's $520 goal - but don't let that stop you from giving! Unlike KickStarter, any and all money given towards Boos for Gideon will go directly to mom and dad - even if the goal isn't met.

My goal is to raise enough money for mom and Gideon to be able to have 4 sessions with the lactation specialist at $130 a pop. $5, $10, $20, $500, $2,000 - whatever you have in your heart and/or wallet and/or bra and/or socks and/or mattress will be much appreciated!

Do it for Gideon.

Do it for the sweater puppies.

Interesting info from the Mayo Clinic: 
"Your baby may be placed under special lighting that emits light in the blue-green spectrum. The light changes the shape and structure of bilirubin molecules in such a way that they can be excreted in the urine and stool. The light isn't an ultraviolet light, and a protective plastic shield filters out any ultraviolet light that may be emitted.
During treatment, your baby will wear only a diaper and protective eye patches. The light therapy may be supplemented with the use of a light-emitting pad or mattress."
 Liz is feeling better, and is taking it easy as she heals. Her midwife assessed her to be in good enough shape to leave the house today for Gideon's first doctor appointment - for which I'm sure Liz felt thankful to be able to get out of the house for a bit.The support for Boobs for Gideon has been overwhelming, and we met our goal in a ridiculously short amount of time. Gideon had his first session with the lactation consultant today, and he is already improving leaps and bounds over how he was a couple days ago. If Gideon keeps improving at this rate he may not need all four sessions we raised money for, but that money will be a huge help when mom and dad have to pay the $3,000 insurance deductible their policy carries.Also, if you didn't have time to contribute before we reached the goal your contribution would still be very much appreciated so we can help reduce the burden of that deductible as much as possible - the campaign will remain open until May 16th.** UPDATE 02MAY 1:30pm**In only slightly more than 24 hours we have exceeded our $600 goal. When I created this campaign, I wasn't sure if we were going to even reach the goal over the entire 16-day campaign! I want to thank you all for contributing to little Gideon's boobie education - the support has been seriously overwhelming. Apparently, Indiegogo doesn't let you end your campaign early if you reach the goal, so this campaign will still be online until May 16th. If you had been planning to contribute but the goal was reached before you had the chance, rest assured there are uncountable things that your money could go towards assisting mom and dad with their first-time parenting endeavor. Thank you all once again for your support,Mom, Dad, Aunt Erica & Uncle Andy-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-A Lifelong Pursuit
For many men, the crisis of not ever having enough boobs begins at puberty and continues for as long as they can remember what a boob is. Unfortunately for Gideon, his mammaries of pursuing boobs began when he was one day old.

A Breasttaking Entry
Due to his eagerness to join the world, Gideon literally assumed a superman pose while traveling down the birth canal. Unfortunately, he wasn't quite self aware enough at this point to realize that his fingernails were literal daggers and he scratched mom on his way out.

The First 36
As it turns out, snitches aren't the only ones who get stitches; mom had to go to the hospital and get some stitches as well. During the time that mom was in the hospital, Gideon couldn't be with her because the sickly environment of the hospital made it too risky for his newborn immune system. Because of this, Gideon is not latching onto mom's boob to feed and instead prefers dad's finger and a syringe.

Nipple the Problem in the Bud
Here are the udderly titillating details:



My name is Andy, and I'm Gideon's uncle. As an uncle, I have certain God-ordained duties. Near the top of that list is to make sure that when Gideon is presented with a boob staring him in the face, he knows what to do with it.


I'd like to use this campaign to (1.) make you laugh at all the boob puns and (2.) raise money for mom and Gideon to see a lactation consultant.


Yes, that's a real thing.


The lactation consultant will help to pair Gideon's mouth to mom's boob once and for all - for a fee, of course.


At $130 a session, I am trying to raise enough money for 4 consultant sessions. If Gideon catches on quicker than that, let me assure you there is no shortage of things that mom and dad could use the extra money for as first-time parents.

If you're paying attention, you must have realized that $130 * 4 is not equal to $600. You sir, are correct. Indiegogo takes between 4%-9% and credit card transactions tack on an additional 3%, so I figured those fees into the fundraising goal.

You Can Help
This isn't one of those KickStarter campaigns that asks for $20,000 and then ends up raising $100,000. Boobs for Gideon might not even make it's $520 goal - but don't let that stop you from giving! Unlike KickStarter, any and all money given towards Boos for Gideon will go directly to mom and dad - even if the goal isn't met.

My goal is to raise enough money for mom and Gideon to be able to have 4 sessions with the lactation specialist at $130 a pop. $5, $10, $20, $500, $2,000 - whatever you have in your heart and/or wallet and/or bra and/or socks and/or mattress will be much appreciated!

Do it for Gideon.
Do it for the sweater puppies.

story:
Nilda is a single mother from the Shipibo Community of San Francisco we meet...

Nilda needs surgery as her vesicula is inflamed and can burst at any time, bringing serious life threatening consequences. Her gallbladder is again swollen and she is in bed feeling extreme pain.

Last year she has been treated for Hepatitis B through donations of opened hearted people. The money we collected was well spent on the pre-ops exams, treatment of the Hepatitis and on her diet (fruit and healthy food). She is now well cleansed so the surgery would be LESS RISKY NOW! . This year due to lack of funds, me and two friends found ourselves in the position of donating from our own pockets to support her and her kids... but this can't PAY HER SURGERY!

WE INVITE YOU and ASK YOU FOR SUPPORT! PLEASE SEND ANY SMALL DONATIONS YOU CAN! TOGETHER WE CAN HELP HER & SAVE HER LIFE!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROSITY and KINDNESS...

Now she is back on the line for the surgery, she has a reincidence on her hepatitis B and the doctor says that even thou it is risky to operate, she has more CHANCES TO MAKE IT THROUGH as the operation will be MADE WITH LASER.

Unfortunately this IS NOT CHEAP in Peru!

The surgery costs 5000 soles, or £1,140, or € 1351, or U$ 1780 or BR$4250.

I HOPE I HAVE STRESSED ENOUGH HOW URGENT THIS IS!

PLEASE HELP US RAISE FUNDS!

SHARE AS MUCH AS YOU CAN!

DONATE AS MUCH AS YOU CAN...

WE ARE ENORMOUSLY GRATEFUL FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

THANK YOU!!!

I hope that with a little help of all my friends we end up saving her life and helping more people with food, house and treatment.

THANK YOU!

YOUR DONATION CAN BE MADE VIA PAYPAL PayPal shipibo1love@yahoo.com

https://www.facebook.com/HelpShipiboWorld?ref=hl

THANK YOU FOR CARING DONATING and SHARING with YOUR FRIENDS, FAMILY AND COMMUNITY!

story:
Less really IS more!

 

Fully equipped

Turn the unit over and easily unscrew the protective lid to access a neat collection of gym equipment. Packed inside are 10 KGs worth of dumbbells (2x 2.5kg/5.5lbs, 2x 1.5kg/3.3lbs, 2x 1kg/2,2lbs),  3 sets of different strength resistance bands (5kg/11lbs, 10kg/22lbs, 15kg/33lbs) , 1 set of ankle straps, 1 set of resistance band handles, as well as a door anchor.

Do it ALL with the W8 GYM...

 

Make the unit lighter by removing dumbbells or make it heavier by leaving it all in. The interchangeable dumbbells allow you to customise your workout according to your fitness level with a total of 19 different weight variations of the unit!  

 

...get creative with your workout

 

 

FULL BODY WORKOUT

Work on your biceps, triceps, lats and traps with the resistance band handles. Feel the burn in your legs, thighs and glutes by incorporating the ankle straps. Take your workout to the next level by using the doorstop for added security. There are over 200 possibilities neatly packed into one unit, allowing you to create your own workout. 
 
 
 

Sleek, simple and practical  

 The best things come in small packages

Stylish - Multifunctional - Robust

 
You can perform exercises with the unit, clip on the resistance bands or workout with the dumbbells. You can change the exercise, change the workout and change the weight without having to change the equipment- less really IS more! 
 

  

 

 

 

Train any way you like... 

 

Any time, Anywhere, Any fitness level 

 

 

   

 

 

THE W8 GYM APP

The W8 GYM is just the beginning. With your support and backing, we will be able to build the W8 GYM app, which will allow each member of our community to follow exercises and meal plans. After purchasing and receiving your W8 GYM, we will be right there with you, giving you the guidance, motivation and knowledge you need to achieve realistic goals. 

Call the app your personal life coach. We supply you with the tools to work every area of your body, designed by our certified personal training team and coupled with nutritional guidance from a recognised world renowned nutritional expert. 

 

PEACE OF MIND

We work closely with qualified experts in the fitness and nutrition sectors, allowing us to provide you with sound advice across the board.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We have assured that we are a step ahead by already selecting our shipping and fulfilment specialist. After studying so many campaigns, one of the biggest common obstacles we found was that no one had produced prototypes or gone into production yet. In conjunction with Virgin Start up, we have taken the leap of faith by going into production and the moulds are being manufactured as you read this! Update: Nick has been to China and approved the moulds so we are now officially in production. The tests are grey but the unit will be black. Next trip is 4th of Feb for quality control and oversee loading and shipping; scheduled for the 8th of Feb.

Production is scheduled to take 40 days which takes us to mid- end of January 2018. However, our goal is to have everything in a container and shipped by February 8th 2018 to beat Chinese New Year which is the 15th of February when production halts and China shuts down. 

We have taken Chinese New Year into consideration to ensure we deliver to you as soon as possible. By ordering and producing our moulds ahead of our campaign closing date, we have minimised risk of delayed fulfilment and saved time, allowing us to go straight into manufacturing when our campaign ends. By visiting the factory in December and then again 4th of February we can administer a quality control check prior to the manufacturing process. 

MEET THE FAMILY

 

 

 

THANK YOU

 

Thank you for supporting our vision to make the W8 GYM dream a reality. We are all in this together and will be here to answer any questions you may have.

Send us an email at: ask@w8gym.com 

For any press enquiries please email: Press@w8gym.com

You can support us by pledging and/or sharing our campaign with friends and family by clicking on the "share" button. Thank you for being a part of our journey! We are looking forward to seeing our product in your homes and helping so many people achieve life changing results. We can assure you, it'll be worth the W8. 

 

 

 

 

 

FAQs

 

  1. What is the retail price for the W8 GYM? The R.R.P is £169 for the standard version and £199 for the Gold Edition. 
  2. How heavy is the W8 GYM? The unit weighs 3.5kg without the equipment inside. Fully loaded, it weighs a total of 14.5kg. You can adjust the weight of the unit, by taking out dumbbells or leaving them in. 
  3. What's inside the W8 GYM? The unit is packed with 3 strengths of resistance bands, 3 sets of dumbbells, 1 set of resistance band handles, 1 set of padded ankle/wrist straps and a door anchor.
  4. What exercises can I do with it? There are over 200 PT certified exercises you can do with the W8 GYM. Including; Push ups, Triceps dips, Kettle bell swings, Burpees, Weighted squats, Chest press, Step exercises, Biceps curls, Medicine ball twists and many more. There are so many variations you can add to your workout. Take a look at our videos to see examples: https://vimeo.com/w8gym
  5. How far are you into the app development? While manufacturing and shipping is taking place over the next few months, we are creating guides and workouts to be ready for the first deliveries. We will keep all of our backers up to date on how the app development is coming along. 
  6. How much does shipping cost?  The W8 GYM packaged and boxed weighs 15kg. We have chosen a world renowned reliable fulfilment company to get you the lowest possible shipping prices tracked from China to your door. All shipping prices include duty and taxes, except for Canada, (sorry Canada it's the way your system works) so you don't need to worry.
  7. After I receive my W8 GYM, how will I be able to follow workouts? While manufacturing and shipping is taking place over the next few months, we are creating guides and workouts to be ready for the first deliveries. We are in the process of developing our app which will provide free workouts and meal plans to guide you on your fitness journey. We will keep all of our backers up to date with the app development and workout plans. 
  8. After I pledge, when will I receive my W8 GYM?  We have already gone into production for the moulds, which has allowed us to go straight into production of the W8 GYM orders when our campaign ends (End November 2017). In January, we will fly to China to oversee shipping and for quality control. Shipping will take place during February/March 2018, which means you will receive your W8 GYM at the start of April 2018 at the very latest. We have taken into account Chinese New Year (Feb 2018) which delays production and we are making sure we will have already shipped our orders before then. Our timeline is realistic and we have accounted for delays beforehand so that we do not over promise and under fulfil.

story:
About Phoenix Freerunning

Phoenix Freerunning started out as a professional parkour and freerunning team for Freedom Freerunning Academy, the first and only parkour gym in Michigan. Being on Team Freedom provided us with professional opportunities such as stunt work for movies, commercials and live performances, as well as teaching classes, workshops and holding jams (giant training sessions) with the local parkour community.

Unfortunately, the gym closed because of a leasing issue, leaving the community damaged and without a home to unite all of the Michigan parkour/freerunning communities. We received many emails and phone calls from people wanting to visit our facility even months after the gym had already closed! There are still many people interested in learning parkour. The demand is there but most people shied away when they finally heard the news about our gym. Many people feel uncomfortable trying to learn in an outdoor environment. 

We have followed the fiery passion that is inside of us all and our team has risen from the ashes of our old gym to feed the flame that is burning deep in our hearts. We have never given up on each other. Our goals have never been set aside. Teaching outdoor classes can be dangerous in certain conditions, such as rain, extreme heat or in the winter cold.  Regardless of all the things we have had to overcome, we kept our promise to provide the public with the most professional parkour and freerunning training in Michigan. We experienced a REBIRTH and became PHOENIX! All that is left is to provide our Phoenix Phans with a new nest!

OUR MISSION 

Our mission is to provide the general public with the tools and knowledge to become a part of our ever-growing Michigan parkour community. Our instructors create a friendly and comfortable environment to people who practice all different arts of movement such as freerunning/parkour, tricking, martial arts, rock climbing, break dancing, gymnastics and many more! Members that want to train for American Ninja Warrior can expect even more built-to-scale obstacles in our new gym!

What We Will Build & Buy

Over the last year we have saved what we can to help build our gym. But at the rate we are saving it will take a couple of years before we can open a new facility, which is too long to supply the necessary instruction for the existing demand to learn parkour.

*Horse stall mats to cover the entire floor

*Building materials for vault boxes, walls and other parkour structures

*Special mats for added safety

* A rail set or two

*A foam pit to safely progress certain movements

*Ninja Warrior obstacles

*An office for the management

*Plumbing, drinking fountains, fridges, cash register, etc.

The Impact

Through having a set curriculum, professional instructors and a shared love for our discipline, we have left a positive impact on many people's lives. Our students, both new and/or experienced, leave each session STRONGER than before, both physically and mentally. PARKOUR IS FOR EVERYONE! Parkour builds confidence, coordination and discipline. Parkour promotes safety through gradual progression, traceurs (parkour practitioners) develop what we call "Parkour Sense" being able to tell both physically and mentally what we are capable of.

As a team we have trained people of all ages, all body types and all skill levels. This is why we need your help to open a bigger and better facility to continue teaching, training and inspiring all year round!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot buy perks or donate you can share our video on your facebook, twitter, and tell family or friends! If you have any other ideas we are open to suggestions!

Questions?

Send us an email at Team@phoenixfreerunning.com

Thank you for your support!

Team Phoenix is grateful for all of our loving phans! To our members, parents and staff, we thank you! We love teaching, learning and training with all of you! Without your support none of this would be possible!
