story:
Make Your Family, Friends, Their Children and  Local Kids Going to School MORE VISIBLE AND SAFER  on Bikes, Scooters, Strollers, Wheelchairs and Walkers with EYE-CATCHING


                                 The Preteen/Teen/Adult Flecto Spinner
                                                         for street use    
 
                                            The Child Flecto Spinner
                                            for sidewalk/crosswalk useThe Difference Between The Two Models

The street model for preteens, teens and adults has thicker petals to handle more speed, wear and tear -- and in place of the rainbow swirls, it has more fluorescence for enhanced visibility.

Both will become even more eye-catching as, with your help, we're going to upgrade the blue base to fluorescent orange to vividly contrast with the fluorescent yellow petals, like on safety vests!                                    

Flecto Spinners are made in the USA




Because they attach with zip ties (included), they can go on Bike Handlebars as shown above, and on Front Forks as shown below




  ...and not only on bikes, but also on...

* Trikes
* Regular strollers
* Jogger stroller
* Child trailers
* Cargo trailers
* Helmets
* Toy cars & trucks
* Wagons
* Wheelchairs



Plus...

*  Scooters
*  Walkers
*  Segways
*  Dune Buggies
*  Boat rails
*  Hospital beds
*  Fences
*  Kites
 ...and who knows where else?  Indeed you may come up with your own favorite places and uses for them!
                

The Flecto Spinner is also designed for flexibility!

*  Its C-shaped base is flexible, opening wider or narrower. It can also be trimmed with scissors to make it fit narrow-gauge tubing like the back bike forks.

*  It attaches to normal bike tubing with 2 zip ties. For bike tubing much wider than normal, longer zip ties are available in hardware stores.

*  The distance between the pinwheel and the base is adjustable.The pinwheel can be pulled out even more from its barrel, say on the handlebar, to make more room underneath for the rider's hand.

*  On the front and back forks, the pinwheel can also be pulled out so it sticks out farther into traffic for better visibility.

*  The petals can be swiveled in any direction. They can also be positioned at any angle relative to the wind as shown below in a cool, swept-back formation on the back forks. Note how they're high off the ground, easily seen by motorists, especially from behind, and are away from riders' legs!


                                               We Call This "The Flying V"
                                                               Front-View




                                                           "The Flying V" 
                                                              Rear-View





Note how the diamond-pattern "circles" glow! This is the same expensive retroreflective material used for traffic signs, engineered with tiny beads to catch motorists' eyes whenever they have their headlights on, whether at night or in low-light conditions. You can also have "The Flying V" on your front forks.


Flecto Spinners Are Not Easily Stolen

*  When the post is pulled out of its barrel, glued and reinserted, it's impossible even with pliers to just pull it out and walk away. This suggestion is in the instructions.

*  Once Flecto Spinners are zip-tied down, to cut and steal them requires wire-cutters. Even then, it's still difficult to get in there and cut the ties, especially quickly.

*  Not 100% theft-proof but not easily swiped either.

                                                    

Environmental Benefits & Impact


*  Flecto Spinners will hopefully encourage more folks to do more biking -- to school, work, shopping and everyday use. This benefits them, us, our environment.

*  Because they're powered by clean wind energy and people power, the toxic environmental impact of batteries is eliminated -- nor do folks have to remember to turn them on or off, replace them or safely dispose of them.

*  We make the Flecto Spinners in Southern California using many SoCal suppliers, so neither Flecto Spinners nor all their parts travel far, further reducing impact.

* The logo above on the back of our packaging asks Flecto Fans to reduce, reuse and recycle their Flecto Spinners.

*  To do our part in reducing environmental impact, we use minimal packaging:.


*  It's also easy to reuse Flecto Spinners, as not only are zip ties available in every hardware store, but there's so many places Flecto Spinners can be reused -- such as first going on baby’s stroller, then being reused on their toy car, then trike, then scooter, then training bike, then graduating to the preteen model!

*  Flecto Spinners are recyclable.

*  We've worked hard at sourcing fluorescent polyethylene and polycarbonate for the petals and base as they're less toxic and easier to recycle than the more readily available fluorescent vinyl.

* In fact, we’ll be taking this entire issue of environmental impact literally to the next level, global, when once Flecto Spinners have taken off with your help, we launch Mama Earth's Global Goodies. These Goodies include mini Earth Flags, T-shirts in infant-to-adult sizes, caps, and car and bike stickers. Some will have an inspiring global/eco/grandchildren-friendly message like "True Homeland Security Is A Sustainable World", "Global Warming Isn't Cool", "Please Protect My Other Mommy", "We're All In This Together" etc. Others will have a global/bike-friendly message like "Biking For A Better World", "Have Solution, Will Bike", "Good Clean Fun Approved By Mom", "Mom & The Law Say Share The Road" etc.

 
Creating Jobs Here at Home for All Sorts of Folks!

Since we’re in Northern California, need we say how much easier it is to go to Southern California rather than China to make sure the quality is there? We also feel very good that with your help we’re going to be creating jobs here in the States for average folks and for disabled folks. That’s because the same non-profit doing our shipping is also a sheltered workshop where disabled people will be doing the light assembling and packaging.


Funding

The Flecto Spinner has been a work in progress but we’re now very close to where we need to be. We have orders from bike, toy, kite and party stores. We just need your help to produce a first batch to fill those orders and your perks. We're ready to roll once we have the money for a mold for the newly fluorescent orange base, for dies for cutting the petals, and to meet various supplier minimums. Our goal of $25,000 should enable us to make mass production happen, making affordable pricing feasible. And dare we dream...well, yes we do!...any donations over that goal make it far easier to take off and to do so more securely.  A successful campaign will also help us get our follow-up line out there more quickly into the world, where we'll be helping grow the consciousness we, our children and our planet need!

If we don't receive enough to make mass production possible, we want to give you two options. We'll either divide your contribution by $20, and send you that number of Mama Earth's Tee-Shirts with "We're All In This Together", in organic cotton and your size(s) or we'll reimburse you! If we get a lot of support but still not enough, we'll add other messages. We want your trust and support!


Projected Timeline

FEBRUARY & MARCH: Indiegogo campaign successfully funded. Mold-making for the base begins as soon as $5000 is contributed and die-making for the petals at $7,000.

APRIL: Dies finished. Production samples completed and approved.

MAY: Mold finally finished in National Bike Month. We get busy making your Flecto Spinners!

JUNE: You, our dear Indiegogo Flecto Fans and Families receive your Flecto Spinners and many take up our invitation to meet other local Flecto Fans. (See Perks)

Visit www.FlectoSpinner.com for more information...


THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

ENJOY YOUR FLECTOS!


*************************************************************************************************

           TOM'S STORY OF THE EVOLUTION OF THE FLECTO SPINNER 

                                                 Continued from video

After I flashed on how eye-catching pinwheels could make cyclists safer, I set about making a prototype. First, I wanted the attachment device to go anywhere on a bike’s tubing, so I came up with a very rough, ridiculously (some would say elegantly) simple, multi-gauge design made from flexible rubber with a barrel for the pinwheel’s post -- all of it attaching with zip ties through a couple of holes.

The Evolution of the Base

 
This attachment device then evolved from rough to finished, from holes to slots for the zip ties, from deep to shallow slots to minimize tearing, and from lower-quality to higher- quality rubber. We also embossed our website on it so folks could see one on the street and then go online to order some for themselves.

Your pledge will help upgrade the most recent blue-rubber version on the right to a flexible, fluorescent orange polyethylene so it’ll vividly contrast, like safety vests, with the newly fluorescent yellow petals. (See below on right.) This will increase visibility even more, especially in shady, overcast or rainy conditions. 

The Evolution of the Child Model's Petals

In terms of the petals, I lucked out in the beginning by finding the best holographic material to give the brightest iridescence on small, curved petals. I soon added colorful swirls since most every child (and adult) likes rainbow colors. More recently, petal width was reduced for lower wind resistance, less noise and more stability at higher speeds, and fluorescent yellow was added for enhanced visibility. The diamond-patterned “circle” at the tips changed to fluorescent yellow retroreflective, like traffic signs, to reflect motorists’ headlights and harmonize with the overall newly fluorescent design.

Tom's First Patent!

By the way, I received a nice bonus on the attachment device -- U.S. utility patent, # 7,278,616. For those who have an idea for an invention and need a little visualization to inspire them, here's how one looks starting with the cover.

How's This for an Official Looking Document?


The Important Part Begins Inside Though...


So go for it...and Good Luck!



 Futur Tek: A Visionary Re-Startup

Our tagline -- Helping to make a better world -- is our vision and mission and our product lines are the visions and inventions of the founder, Tom Kahan.

Futur-Tek aims to advance our mission...

*  By marketing unique and patented product lines that for the most part help make a safer, healthier, better world and future for our children and all the world’s children

*  By the socially and environmentally responsible way it conducts business

*  By giving back to the community, starting with donating 10% of profits to children's charities. That percentage should grow to 75% within three years while the types of groups we're donating to expands as well.

*  By helping to grow global consciousness, social justice and pricing that tells the  ecological truth  -- all key to the sustainability of our democracy, economy and civilization. For more on this visit:  TimeToGetSmarter.org.

We say "re-startup" because in 2006 we sold out in several San Francisco Bay Area bike and toy stores. Communication and quality then broke down between us and the Chinese factory; we walked away, losing thousands in the process. We’re back in the ring this time and finalizing arrangements with domestic suppliers to now make Flecto Spinners in the USA!

www.Futur-Tek.com

story: We are raising money to help pay for cancer treatments that are not covered by OHIP. Costs for care are more than this family can afford; they need support to endure and thrive. This money will help pay for Kate's treatments while allowing Joe and Julia to continue to attend programs they love and need, such as summer camp and music classes. For those of you who know Kate and admire, as we do, her fierce and magnificent spirit, please contribute as much as you can to help Kate and her family!
story_txt: We are raising money to help pay for cancer treatments that are not covered by OHIP. Costs for care are more than this family can afford; they need support to endure and thrive. This money will help pay for Kate's treatments while allowing Joe and Julia to continue to attend programs they love and need, such as summer camp and music classes. For those of you who know Kate and admire, as we do, her fierce and magnificent spirit, please contribute as much as you can to help Kate and her family!

story:
UPDATE  7/25/12:

Good news: the treatments are working! I'm not nearly so nauseous anymore, and my doctors and I have developed a REALLY solid treatment plan.

Bad news: they cost over $700, and I'll probably need them once every three weeks over a period of 6 months. That's over $4200 out of pocket. We've made $1640 so far - let's call $4200 an unofficial goal for the 5 remaining days. Please help spread the word - every cent helps so much!

What's this all about?

Angela, 24, has been volunteering with kids with disabilities literally since she was born; Angela has a passion for advocacy, improving the societal implications for anyone who is other than "normal". She went to college early and graduated from the University of Pittsburgh in 2009. Angela plans to get a graduate degree in sociology, establish a community theatre accessible to people with disabilites, and adopt a child with a disability.

The only obstacle to Angela's plans is her health. In the summer of 2007, at the age of 19, Angela began suffering from a difficult-to-treat digestive disorder. Dealing with this has derailed her life, putting her future on hold as she struggles to cope with the ever increasing costs of health care. 

If you were nauseous all the time, how much could you accomplish?

If you know Angela, then you know at least a bit about her experiences with her health, and health care, over the past five years.  If you don't know Angela, read on for a taste of her journey.

Angela started having digestive problems in the summer of 2007. A few months later she had symptoms every time she ate, and quickly lost a third of her body weight.  She was terrified of food and of how her body felt, and there didn't seem to be any end in sight. Angela had to quit her job and take a leave of absence from college. She planned her days around walking up her stairs once, but quite often she couldn't even get out of bed.

UPMC doctors performed extensive bloodwork and invasive tests, but couldn't diagnose Angela's problem. We finally found a doctor near Pittsburgh who knew what was wrong, but he couldn't fix her. We widened our search, finally finding a great doctor in Delaware. After Angela's health improved enough for her to graduate we moved across Pennsylvania to Philadelphia, uprooting our lives, changing career paths and putting off grad school, so that Angela's health could keep improving.

Having found effective treatments to manage her symptoms, life became more stable, and Angela felt great on our wedding day. Unfortunately, this was short-lived.  The doctor helping Angela was denied malpractice insurance...for NEVER being sued.  (Don't worry, it doesn't make sense to anyone else either.) Her next doctor helped Angela resume an active lifestyle for the first time in years. She works from home so she can worry less about unexpected symptom flares.

In the past few months, Angela's most recent doctors schedule prevented her receiving regular treatments, so her health suffered. The doctor then started his own practice that does not accept insurance. At this point, NO doctors near us that can help Angela accept insurance. On our healthcare plan, we must pay $5,000  per year on out-of-network treatment, after which we'll be partially reimbursed. Due to this, combined with a recent cut to Zac's pay, we cannot afford the treatment Angela needs to be healthy.

We're now treating Angela's healthcare as an investment. Angela just started seeing a doctor who, rather than continually masking her symptoms, may be able to cure her permanently. However, Angela needs regular treatment, and we flat-out cannot afford it. We're trying to work additional hours, pursuing additional jobs and cutting all possible expenses, but we're still several hundred dollars in the red.

We've been independent and self-sufficient for years, so it takes a lot for us to ask for help. This was not undertaken on a whim. We talked at length about our options, and decided that this was what made the most sense.

 

The Impact

We can't adequately describe the impact that this would have on Angela's life.  To be truly healthy, for the first time in years...  That would be incredible.  As many of you know, you don't feel like yourself when you're sick - let alone when you're sick for 5+ years.  Thank you for even considering helping us, your support, your thoughts, and for reading this far!

 

What We Need & What You Get

All money raised will go directly to funding Angela's healthcare. $500 will fund for Angela's healthcare costs for one month - she needs testing, treatment, and supplements. If more is raised, Angela can be treated more regularly, and will achieve health even more quickly.

UPDATE 7/11/12: WE HIT OUR GOAL!!
Angela needs sustained treatment, so additional funds will go towards her medical expenses in the future. Thanks so much for your overwhelming support so far! We have until July 30 - let's see how much of her treatment we can fund!!

 

The fun for you is in the perks!


For all donors:

  • Any amount - We will send you a thank-you note!
  • $30 - Angela will send you 4 handmade cloth napkins
  • $75 - Angela will send you a handmade medium-sized reversible tote bag
  • $150 - Angela will send you two handmade reversible tote bags
  • $150 - Angela will send you a hand-knit afghan
  • $300 - Angela will send you two handmade piped throw pillows

For Philadelphia-area donors ONLY, within 10 miles of Center City:

  • $30 - One dozen homemade chocolate chip cookies, delivered to you!
  • $75 - A hand-decorated 8" cake, delivered to you!
  • $200 - A hand-decorated 10" square cake, delivered to you!
  • $200 - A tray of five dozen homemade cookies, delivered to you!

(Lucky for Philadelphians, Angela used to be a professional baker!)

 

If none of the perks are quite up your alley but you'd still like to contribute, please use the "Contribute Now" button (located above the perks)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This request is in no way an expectation. We know that many of you are in the same boat we are financially. Here's how you CAN help:

Spread the word! if you know Angela and could include a little blurb about her when you share this, all the better. Check out indiegogo's sharing tools. And, more important than anything else, make some noise about helping fix Angela!

Donate a perk! If you have a trade, skill or product that you would like to donate as a perk for this campaign, we would be happy to accept any such offer.

story:
Back story...

This weekend I attended my 10 year high school reunion. It was great to see everyone, but one person specifically... Kelly. I had just recently heard of her 10 year battle against her tumors. Although in extreme pain, she never stop smiling and being very sweet. 

She hasn't let her tumors get her down, she writes a blog in hopes to inspire others going through the same struggle. She's been a part of exclusive trials to find a cure. She's an amazing person and it'd be wonderful to help her will medical bills, things she needs, maybe even a trip somewhere...

Please visit Kelly's website to learn more: http://www.tumorhater.blogspot.com

story:
Short Summary

My mom is a wonderful lady, 17 years ago when my father passed away he left no insurance and she's been working hard ever since, 6 years after my dad passed to take care of me,until I was an adult and now I want to help return the favor.

Last February her retina detached, and she had to have surgery, she had the surgery, and went to work less than a week later when doctors told her she needed to take 2 weeks off (she said she couldn't afford to take off). My sister and I did what we could to help, and she got through it. 

In September It happened again, this time she took a month off, and I took 2 weeks off to travel to Michigan to Visit and Help where I could. I just recieved a phone call this morning that on Monday morning, she will have to have a third surgery because it detached again.

This means another month off from a job that already works her very little and changes her schedule daily, some days she gets called in the morning to tell her she isn't needed after all.

I know this third time will be a big struggle for her to pay her bills and for the medications and other things she will need paid after surgery, especially since she has already missed a month in September and was trying to play catch up still. I would do anything for my mom, unfortunately I can't afford to give her all the help she needs, anything would be much appreciated, and will go for bills and everyday needs as well as any costs she incurs above (ie: medications, extra bandages etc) that insurance doesn't cover.

What We Need :

I am trying to reach a minimum of 5,000. This would help her get caught up from the previous month she had to take off as well as help pay for anything she might need along the way in her recovery (ie: medications, extra bandages etc)

 

The Impact

It would help this wonderful woman I am proud to call my mother through this difficult time. She could relax and recover knowing that she didn't have to worry about anything until she was able to go back to work again. In September she was so stressed about missing work that she couldn't focus on just relaxing and healing.I don't want her to go through that again.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let other people know about my campaign! We Appreciate each and every one of you and can't thank you enough for your support!

story:
I've started this fundraising site for a married mother of twins from the Chili area. Our goal is $10,000 so we can help out with health bills,mortgage,taxes so they don't lose their home & if we go over 10,000 even better! HERE IS HER STORY LISTED BELOW IN HER OWN WORDS!

Cancer Changed My Life…

By Leisha Davison-Yasol / July 24, 2012

Just after my 34th birthday, the words, "You have Cancer," shook my foundation. My thoughts turned first to my twin kindergarten sons. I was heartbroken when I pictured them reaching milestones with no Mom to share in their special moments.

This vision of leaving my children behind has moved me many times in the two years since my diagnosis of Stage 3C breast cancer--through lots of chemo, a bilateral mastectomy, lymph node surgeries, radiation, Herceptin, lymphedema, an oopherectomy, a hysterectomy, multiple infections and so much more...

But this is not my only motivator. What I thought would be an isolating experience has been exactly the opposite. We are fortunate to have caring family and friends, but the kindness has stretched further. From the beginning, my children's elementary school, the school district, and the community have rallied around our family with more love and support than I ever could have imagined possible.

While I despise Cancer, the kindness that has surrounded me because of it has moved me beyond measure.

*I should say that winning $10,000 would be AMAZING. Diagnosed after we lost our health insurance when my husband was laid off, we began this Cancer battle in the red. Our finances continue to be a huge source of stress for me. This money would help us pay our property and school taxes and a couple of mortgage payments to keep us from losing our home. Thank you!*

 

 

 

This is a essay written from Leishas Aunt.

Written by:  Jillian K. Welch
In April  of 2010, my niece, Leisha, was diagnosed with Stage 3C breast cancer at 34 years  old.
In the summer of 2010, I visited Leisha and her husband, Deo, at the  Pluta Cancer Center when she was in the early days of receiving  chemotherapy.  I had an appointment with an acupuncturist at the time on  the second floor.  I had asked Leisha ahead of time if it was okay to stop  by since I would be in the building.  I never want to intrude on anyone's  privacy unless I am given the go-ahead.
I had not seen Leisha for a  while.  I was nervous about seeing her, but I checked in at the desk on the  first floor, and walked into a bright, window-filled room, with nicely painted  walls and pictures, and proceeded to look for her and Deo.  And then I saw  her sitting in a comfy chair hooked up to an IV, and she and Deo were quietly  playing cards on one of those handy hospital tables that can be raised up and  down, and moved around easily because of the wheels on the bottom.  Other  patients sat nearby as each underwent their own treatments.  People were  quietly talking with nurses and doctors.  Leisha wore a pink head  wrap.  Her flowing light brown hair had been donated to "Locks of Love,"  before the chemo started.  Her sea-blue eyes looked more beautiful than  ever, and the familiar dimples in her cheeks formed as she smiled when she saw  me.  It was still Leisha.  It was Leisha battling cancer.  But it  was still Leisha, who smiles when the whole world is collapsing around her, who  smiles when she is being wronged or bullied.  It was still Leisha.  I  fought back the tears as I sat down to join them in a game of cards.  "I  don't know how to play this game," I announced.  "Don't worry, we'll teach  you," she said reassuringly.
And here we are two years later.  It  has been a continuous battle with very little rest.  Several surgeries,  infections, ED visits,  hospitalizations, treatments, a daily regimen of  medications, and numerous follow-up appointments have been part of the job she  took on to be here for her twin boys.  Leisha's family, friends, and  community, and people she doesn't know have rallied around her.  And  recently there was a Nationwide Contest through ReMax Realty where she came in  second place to win $10,000.  Not only has she been dealing with the  medical issues from breast cancer, but the financial burden of trying to keep  their home, and the cost of daily living expenses.  But from losing this  Contest, two fundraising sites have been established on "Indiegogo". To the two  women who set up the sites, and who don't personally know Leisha, I want to tell  them thank you so much.  They have chosen a worthy cause.  The pain  and suffering Leisha has undergone, and the mental anguish of not knowing how  long she would be here for her family cannot be measured by a test or a  questionnaire.  But her gratitude can be seen in her actions and from her  heart.  The outpouring of support she has received from the community has been steady and loyal.  Since the Contest her community has grown to  include people from all over the world.
And even though I have forgotten  the name of that new card game you taught me and how to play it, I have learned  something far more important from the past two years.  Goodness and  generosity can be found in the most difficult of times.
With love and  support from your family.  Your Nanna would be so very proud of  you.
Auntie Jillian

story:
This campaign is made to help raise the money needed by Octavian to a very important heart surgery which is scheduled on 22 of October at  MediClin Heart Center Lahr/Baden clinic in Germany.

Octavian is 14 years old, he is a Math Olympic, a kid with a big dream: A HEALTHY HEART.

He underwent a heart surgery in May 2015 in Constanta, Romania but to fully solve his heart problem  is required a secondary surgery in Germany. ( attached are the papers from Constanta Hospital received after the surgery )


The amount of money that we want to collect is to pay for the clinic in Germany and for renting a room for 1 week, so his parents can be there with him.

This campaign is sponsored by Phidias Tavern from Paphos, Cyprus where Sorin ( Octavian`s father) is working.

We hope that we can raise the money for Octavian, if you are able to donate, please do it, if not at least please share this campaign, I am sure that somewhere around the world someone will find a few euro to donate to save a heart, a life, to make a dream come true.

Thank you for all your donations and shares.

A life can be saved, you can make the difference, you can save it.

This campaign was made from Cyprus for Nicoara Octavian Marian ( Constanta Romania ) by Iannis Phidias ( owner at Phidias Tavern www.phidiastavern.com ) and Aurelian Sonea

save it.This campaign was made from Cyprus for Nicoara Octavian
Marian ( Constanta Romania ) by Iannis Phidias ( owner at Phidias Tavern www.phidiastavern.com ) and Aurelian
Sonea

story:
Your health is invaluable. Scientists have been saying for years that Omega-3 is essential for you to maintain optimum health. 

Omega-3 EPA and DHA are clinically proven (1, 2, 3) to

  • Improve and maintain a healthy heart, brain and vision.
  • Reduce pain, swelling and inflammation.
  • Improve pregnant women’s health, as well as the baby’s development

Traditionally, fish and fish oil have been our main source.

1. Exposed to Environmental Toxins

Fish oil supplements are produced mainly from oily fish such as salmon, mackerel and sardines from the ocean. Ocean fishes are typically exposed to the environmental toxins, such as mercury and PCBs, which tend to accumulate in the oil of the fish.

2. Highly Processed

To extract the oil from the fish and to purify the oil from the unwanted toxins, the fish oil has to go through numerous industrial processes which may damage the quality of the product and introduce unwanted chemicals into the product.

These toxins and chemicals if consumed can do more harm than good. Health issues aside, sustainability presents an additional challenge.     

3. Sustainability

In order to meet the vast global demand for fish oil, companies are ignoring calls for sustainable fishing practices, continuing to overfish in oceans at an alarming rate. 

Marine scientists have warned us that if nothing is done soon, our oceans could be completely without any fish by as soon as 2050! (4, 5, 6). 

Not all Omega-3s are created equal. Chia and Flax seeds are known to be good sources of plant-based Omega-3s. However, the Omega-3s found in Chia and Flax seeds are known as ALA. Your body can convert ALA partially into EPA and DHA, however, scientific studies indicate that your body is not particularly skilled at performing this task (7, 8, 9).

If you are on a vegan or vegetarian diet, chances are you may have lower-than-normal EPA and DHA levels in your body (10), and you should consider taking EPA and DHA fortified foods or supplements (11).

Algae are the primary producers of Omega-3 EPA & DHA in nature. In fact, algae are the reason why fish oil is rich in Omega-3s. By going straight to the algae, we can now bypass the fish as the middleman between us and the valuable Omega-3 EPA and DHA.

We have dedicated much care and attention to creating a 100% plant-based and sustainable Omega-3 EPA and DHA product – just for you.

The EPA and DHA rich algae oil is encapsulated in a vegetarian softgel. Each softgel has a rich yellow color, emanating the fresh scent of the ocean. 

Each bottle of Migae Omega-3 Algae Oil comes with 60 softgels (30-day supply) containing 500mg of Algae Oil with minimum 15% of EPA and 30% of DHA. 

You can be confident that Migae Omega-3 Algae Oil can deliver the same health benefits as fish oil; minus the concern of potentially consuming environmental toxins, or indirectly contributing to ocean and marine-life harm.

Our product’s journey began in November, 2013, when the breakthrough EPA and DHA algae oil was first made available in the USA. 

For the past 3 years, we have been working closely with manufacturers in the USA, in order to obtain regulatory approvals both in the USA and Malaysia. 

We couldn’t be more thrilled to share that we have successfully met all standards required, obtaining all necessary approvals to finally bring the product to market; and to your household.

We are now ready for production and we have readied $60,000 to meet the minimum order quantity. 

With your support, we hope to receive minimum $5,000 in pre-orders to help us kickstart the launch of the product.    

The more we are able to exceed the minimum order quantity, the more affordable the product will become. In other words, the more people will be able to use our product and reduce our potentially harmful dependency on fish oil. 

Want to be one of the first to own a Migae Omega-3 Algae Oil product? Please join us today, and become part of the green and sustainable lifestyle. Your only task is to select one of our pre-order offers now.

You are free to return any unopened bottles to us at any point in the next 2 years after you receive it, in order to receive a prompt refund should you decide that the product is not for you (as long as you return the products prior to their expiration date)

With your support, along with the anticipated closing of this campaign, we expect the products to be ready for shipping to you by early of Q4, 2017. 

Migae is proudly brought to you by passionate husband and wife team; Amanda and Marcus Fei.

 MARCUS FEI

Marcus is trained in finance, possessing more than 10 years of experience in the natural products industry. His experience involves working in various aspects of sourcing, formulation, operations, marketing and business development.

 

AMANDA TEH

Amanda received her training as a Naturopath in Australia, and is a licensed natural health practitioner specializing in nutrition, herbal medicine and flower remedies. Amanda is a regular guest health expert on Malaysia's TV, radio and print media.

Together, this dedicated team complement each other’s strengths flawlessly; running a natural health products company based in Kuala Lumpur. The company has been distributing to health food stores, traditional medicine halls and retail pharmacies across Malaysia since 2012. 

As parents of two, Amanda and Marcus firmly believe in the power of living harmoniously with the Nature. We need to be grateful for what the Nature provides, respecting and adhering to our duties to care and protect Nature for generations to come.

Q: How is Migae Omega-3 Algae Oil produced?

A: The algae oil is extracted from an extensively researched and carefully selected algae strain, that can be grown in a controlled environment to produce the desired EPA and DHA rich oil. The algae farm, oil extraction and soft-gel encapsulation facilities are all licensed and GMP-certified supplements manufacturers based in the USA. Finally, in order to make the product more affordable, the soft-gels will be imported in bulk to the Malaysian market. Here, a GMP-certified pharmaceutical-grade contract packer will bottle the soft-gels into the final packaging.

Q: Where will the product be shipped from?

A: The final product will be shipped from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

Q: How much product is there in each bottle?

A: Each standard bottle of Migae Omega-3 Algae Oil comes with 60 softgels, which is good for a 30-day supply of 2 softgels per day.  

Q: How much should I take each day?

A: Take 2 softgels a day as a dietary supplement.    

Q: How much Omega-3s are there in each softgel?

A: Each softgel contains 500mg of Algae oil that provides 250mg of omega-3 EPA and DHA. 

Q: Is the product 100% vegan/vegetarian friendly?

A: Yes! We have spent a considerable time identifying the appropriate manufacturing partner, who possesses the capacity to produce algae-based vegetarian soft-gels on a regular basis.

Q: Is the product Halal?

A: The product is produced with only plant-based ingredients and contains no animal parts. We will be applying for the halal certification once we have our first batch of product. 

Q: Are there any allergic concerns and contraindications?

A: There is no known contraindication for the product, which is recognized to be generally safe. However, please check with your physician should you have any concerns.

Q: What is the shelf life?

A: 2 years.

Q: How much does shipping cost?

A: Free shipping in Malaysia.  International shipping rates apply, depending on your location. 

Q: I live in Malaysia, can I pick it up myself?

A: Unfortunately, not. Our warehouse is not setup for walk-ins or local pickups. All products will be shipped out to the address we have on file.

SHIPPING NOTE

Please note that shipping to any country may be delayed depending on local import regulations. This is a global campaign, and we will ship according to the agreement made here on Indiegogo. However, there may be additional import documentation, duties, fees or taxes raised by the authorities in your country. You will need to take care of them yourself when receiving the shipment.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

P.S. Please share this campaign with your family and friends. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

After was diagnosed at age 35, i dedicated my life to this project and now I need you. I had a fairly large invasive breast cancer, and it made me realize how little support is actually offered to people once they are diagnosed with cancer, and how lucky I was to be healthy again. A year later I started You Can Thrive!

I'm sure you realize that from reading the stories here everyone needs money for more medical costs.. how about some RELIEF from the side effects?

Almost all money raised for cancer goes to fund medical costs, medical testing or drug testing. Almost NONE of it goes to help PEOPLE with CANCER.

So I started working in 2005 to create real integrative resources for the women who come behind me to prevent and alleviate suffering. 

I need your help. 10% of our clients are stage 4, and many others at earlier stages of this disease who need your assistance.  Your money will not help ONE person but MANY people with cancer. We have worked with hundreds of women in NYC to support them through treatment with access to free integrative services like Acupuncture, massage, reflexology, aromatherapy, nutritional counseling, patient advocacy and exercise/meditation. Please know that when you give every single dollar helps them directly to gain access to RELIEF. We are a volunteer grassroots effort and so I ask you to join me. Your money will not go to the medical system, it will support a person with cancer. Are you Pink for People? We are!!

I have recruited a community that gives their time and talents to help people with cancer through providing services that give relief from syptoms from cancer and it's related treatments. Through telling my story have opened a new HUGE center and we need support from YOU. Would you help me continue to make it happen for others?

This is true care, by and for the people. 

Myself and many others here in NYC have dedicated their lives and hearts to helping those women going through breast cancer with direct services when they need it most and can afford it least. Things that help them get through treatment and Thrive!

The entire community donates towards this cause, (manhours, donated space, etc), because the ENTIRE COMMUNITY gives of themselves, we are able to keep the doors open for the cost of just 20,000 per year!!! Your gift will help a person with cancer immediately. Big or small just be a part of this. 

Help us and our committed volunteers to make a PERMANENT change in the face of aftercare for those diagnosed with cancer.

A new movement in charity: $$ directly effects someone going through cancer every dollar!! PERIOD. 

Our little service dog Fonzie works so hard, and he wants to thank you too!

See our website at http://youcanthrive.org

What We Need & What You Get

  • For $1 you know that you helped you DID, and pass it on!
  • For $5 you provided a box of acupuncture needles or massage oil
  • For $10 you sponsor to give one survivor one  (massage/acupuncture/nutritional) session
  • For $20 you sponsor and are responsible for one survivor receiving a full day of treatments, which bring a week of relief or more.
  • For $100 you sponsor a woman surviving for a month with wellness services and nutritional counseling
  • For $500 you are responsible for opening the doors for ONE WEEK for 30 women
  • For $1000 you have just opened our doors for TWO WEEKS for 30 women
  • For $5,000 you are responsible for keeping our doors open for THREE MONTHS
  • For $20,000 you are a national hero and help TRANSFORM the lives of 100's of people suffering from cancer for an ENTIRE YEAR

How could you get more bang for your charity buck? ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE UNDER NON PROFIT LAWS

The Impact:

You Can Thrive! has served 100's of women in the Tri-State area with help to alleviate preventable suffering after a cancer diagnosis, help us make that into 1000's of units of relief for ALL people with cancer. Help found and sustain the utopian model that helps people Thrive! and not just survive.

You Can Thrive! is a top rated charity on GreatNonProfits.org and other charity review sites.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Share this campaign with all your friends, via email and on facebook http://indiegogo.com/cancerrelief

Like us on facebook http://facebook.com/YouCanThrive.org <-share

Volunteer some of your time and see first-hand the faces of the people we help, and the volunteers who give their time in service for relief!

story:
Suzan faces eviction if she can't pay $1,000 in back rent IMMEDIATELY. She has nowhere to go. Since she suffers from fibromyalgia, a debilitating condition that is made worse by stress, I want to help her catch up on her rent and have enough to live on as she continues to look for work.

Suzan is good people. She has worked hard all her life, but her illness wiped out her savings. She’s a little too young to draw Social Security. 
She has had a rough life in many ways, but she is deeply spiritual, and usually cheerful.

She’s a wonderful neighbor, kind, funny, and generous; the local kids flock to her for art lessons, and the local cats for pinches of catnip and ear skritches. Unfortunately, being a wonderful neighbor doesn’t pay the bills, even for a frugal, responsible, resourceful woman. 
Suzan can no longer do the heavy physical work she managed until a few years ago. She’s bravely and creatively looking for other ways to use her skills and talents to pay her way, but that takes time.

Being evicted would be a disaster for Suzan and her cats. The best possibility for less expensive housing for her is still weeks away. If we can get her through the summer with enough money to live on, and maybe a little bit extra, I am certain that her fortunes will improve.

Suzan proposes some original gifts for everyone who is kind enough to help her: handmade cards, a “signed” photo of her beautiful cats, and large or small custom-made shadowboxes for those who are extra generous. She is a skilled craftswoman whose work will make you smile. You will also earn Suzan’s eternal gratitude, and mine.

Suzan is also creating a blog where people with fibromyalgia can talk together, exchange tips, referrals, and recommendations, and find the solace of one another’s company. We’ll provide a link as soon as it’s ready to roll!

If you’re not able to donate, please help us spread the word! That would be wonderful, and we will be grateful.
If you can donate, well, the quicker the better, please! Every dollar will help keep Suzan and her cats safe and well.

 Thank you! Bless you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Elliott Johnson. I am a 5’11”, 128lb 15yr old sophmore who loves to play golf. I work hard everyday trying to improve my game and win more tournaments. I am a scratch golfer and I intend to play collegiate golf after high school.

I recently won a junior golf tournament and have been offered and accepted a $20,000 partial (50%) scholarship to attend the Hank Haney International Junior Golf Academy (IJGA) here in Hilton Head, SC. That leaves $20,000 remaining that must be paid. The academy believes that I have a lot of talent and potential as a golfer. My parents told me that one of the IJGA coach’s commented that “Once Elliott realizes how good he is, he will be unstoppable!” This scholarship is a chance of a lifetime for me.

Here are some facts about my golfing and schooling:

  • I took all honors classes in the 9th grade and earned a 4.0 GPA (on a 5.0 GPA scale).
  • I played in 6 major tournaments (IJGT, Hurricane, & PJGT) since Dec 2011 with the following 1st round positions:
    • Three times I led the tournament after day 1.
    • One time I was tied for the lead after day 1.
    • And, once I was only one stroke behind the lead.
  • Of these 6 major tournaments, I had a 2nd place finish and a first place finish.
  • My current USGA Handicap Index = 0.7 (based on 19 recent rounds)
  • My parents and teachers tell me that I am intelligent, respectful, and a well mannered kid.


The academy’s motto is “Champions are trained, not born”. With your help, I will be able to take advantage of this opportunity to receive world class training that will aid me in reaching my highest potential.  

My parents have paid the $2,500 down payment to get me into the academy; however, we need to raise the remaining funds so that I can complete the entire 2012-13 year. My mom & dad are both taking on extra part time work, but we still need your help...

My goal during this golf season is to show the academy that I am worthy of a full scholarship for my Junior year. With a few more wins under my belt this coming year, I believe I can prove myself worthy of that full scholarship. I intend to train hard, stay focused, and never give up until I reach my goal.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is how much my 2012 - 2013 training will cost:

We are trying to raise $15,000 in this campaign to help offset the costs below:

$20,000 = My part of the the 2012 - 2013 school year (total cost is $40,000)
$3,500 = Entry fees for 8 golf tournaments
$2,200 = Travel/lodging for 3 away tournaments (3 days lodging/tournament)

$25,700 = Total cost

What will you get for helping me?

$20 - A personal “Thank You” postcard from me
$50 - A Logo Golf Ball with my picture on it + a Thank You postcard
$100 - A Restaurant.com gift card + logo golf ball
$250 - A Restaurant.com gift card (x 4) plus logo golf ball
$500 - A Hilton Head T Shirt + logo golf & “Thank You” postcard
$1000 - A personalized Thank You Video + Logo Golf Ball

The Impact

In order for me to be the best, I have to train with the best. And, I'm honored that the IJGA has chosen me to be one of their students...to train to be a champion. This is your opportunity to play an important role in forever changing my destiny; and, who knows, one day you may be able to say you had a hand in helping me become the No.1 golfer in the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, here are some other ways you can help:

  • Share my story with your family & friends.
  • Use the share tools (above) for Facebook, Twitter & email


The more people that visit my site, the better chance I have to reach my goal. Thank you in advance for all your support!


More info on the Hank Haney International Golf Academy:

“Located on the golf hotbed of Hilton Head Island, S.C., Hank Haney IJGA is a full-time golf school (grades 5-12) featuring players of all abilities from 27 countries around the world, and 45 U.S. states.

Students receive daily instruction in full swing, short game, course management, college placement, mental preparation and fitness training. Half the day is spent on golf and the other half in the classroom at Heritage Academy, a leading academic institution for students highly dedicated to both school and an extracurricular activity like golf, tennis or equestrian.”
- Examiner.com
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello, my name is Elliott Johnson. I am a 5’11”, 128lb 15yr old sophmore who loves to play golf. I work hard everyday trying to improve my game and win more tournaments. I am a scratch golfer and I intend to play collegiate golf after high school.I recently won a junior golf tournament and have been offered and accepted a $20,000 partial (50%) scholarship to attend the Hank Haney International Junior Golf Academy (IJGA) here in Hilton Head, SC. That leaves $20,000 remaining that must be paid. The academy believes that I have a lot of talent and potential as a golfer. My parents told me that one of the IJGA coach’s commented that “Once Elliott realizes how good he is, he will be unstoppable!” This scholarship is a chance of a lifetime for me.Here are some facts about my golfing and schooling:

I took all honors classes in the 9th grade and earned a 4.0 GPA (on a 5.0 GPA scale).
I played in 6 major tournaments (IJGT, Hurricane, & PJGT) since Dec 2011 with the following 1st round positions:

Three times I led the tournament after day 1.
One time I was tied for the lead after day 1.
And, once I was only one stroke behind the lead.

Of these 6 major tournaments, I had a 2nd place finish and a first place finish. 
My current USGA Handicap Index = 0.7 (based on 19 recent rounds)
My parents and teachers tell me that I am intelligent, respectful, and a well mannered kid.

The academy’s motto is “Champions are trained, not born”. With your help, I will be able to take advantage of this opportunity to receive world class training that will aid me in reaching my highest potential.  My parents have paid the $2,500 down payment to get me into the academy; however, we need to raise the remaining funds so that I can complete the entire 2012-13 year. My mom & dad are both taking on extra part time work, but we still need your help...My goal during this golf season is to show the academy that I am worthy of a full scholarship for my Junior year. With a few more wins under my belt this coming year, I believe I can prove myself worthy of that full scholarship. I intend to train hard, stay focused, and never give up until I reach my goal.


What We Need & What You Get
Here is how much my 2012 - 2013 training will cost:We are trying to raise $15,000 in this campaign to help offset the costs below:$20,000 = My part of the the 2012 - 2013 school year (total cost is $40,000)$3,500 = Entry fees for 8 golf tournaments$2,200 = Travel/lodging for 3 away tournaments (3 days lodging/tournament)
$25,700 = Total cost
What will you get for helping me?
$20 - A personal “Thank You” postcard from me$50 - A Logo Golf Ball with my picture on it + a Thank You postcard$100 - A Restaurant.com gift card + logo golf ball$250 - A Restaurant.com gift card (x 4) plus logo golf ball$500 - A Hilton Head T Shirt + logo golf & “Thank You” postcard$1000 - A personalized Thank You Video + Logo Golf Ball 


The Impact
In order for me to be the best, I have to train with the best. And, I'm honored that the IJGA has chosen me to be one of their students...to train to be a champion. This is your opportunity to play an important role in forever changing my destiny; and, who knows, one day you may be able to say you had a hand in helping me become the No.1 golfer in the world!


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute financially, here are some other ways you can help:

Share my story with your family & friends.
Use the share tools (above) for Facebook, Twitter & email

The more people that visit my site, the better chance I have to reach my goal. Thank you in advance for all your support!
More info on the Hank Haney International Golf Academy:
“Located on the golf hotbed of Hilton Head Island, S.C., Hank Haney IJGA is a full-time golf school (grades 5-12) featuring players of all abilities from 27 countries around the world, and 45 U.S. states.
Students receive daily instruction in full swing, short game, course management, college placement, mental preparation and fitness training. Half the day is spent on golf and the other half in the classroom at Heritage Academy, a leading academic institution for students highly dedicated to both school and an extracurricular activity like golf, tennis or equestrian.”- Examiner.com

story:
The Basics.

The teacher program is the KRI Level One Certification program in Kundalini Yoga. Graduates become instructors and learn the fundamental principles & practices of Kundalini yoga. This specific form of yoga strengthens the sympathetic nervous system providing recovery from addiction and assists in psychological regeneration from trauma. It is a wonderful addition to the community as a preventive health practice because each pose targets specific organs, helps prevent osteoporosis, among other diseases associated with ageing and stress.

I am a 9 year student of advanced yoga and former performing acrobat. I have had the privilege to study privately with a former student, Salvador Broch, of the original Kundalini Yoga teacher in America, Yogi Bajan who introduced it in LA in 1986. After practicing all different types of yoga, I have found Kundalini supersedes the rest and it is becoming a big hit in studios nationwide. My dream is to be able to share the wonderful health benefits of this specific type of yoga as therapy for the community. Yoga teachers and fellow students have all encouraged me to pursue a teacher certification as my dedication has brought my practice level to a point where I can really benefit others. I have taught yoga privately to friends and they are always asking for more! I have taught gymnastics and stand up paddling boarding and my years of waitressing has given me the ability to engage all walks of life with a great positive enthusiastic attitude. I have read countless books on health and nutrition and sold it for a living. What can I say? I’m a flower child .

Yoga benefits all ages. It helps lower stress, prevents illnesses, and permeates beyond the studio to create a more harmonious community as people are more calm and positive in their day to day interactions. The benefits of yoga are exponential including a more graceful ageing, less injuries from increased flexibility, as well as improved circulation and nervous system functioning from the breathing exercises. For me this is a no-brainer! People of all ages benefit from yoga, it increases the ability to focus and cognition.

 Your small contribution will not only allow me to fulfill my dream, it will benefit the overall health of the community in a major way. Those that I teach will be inspired to tell their friends and families and so on…the snowball benefit will ensue!

What I Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for you in detail I need $3,500 for the Kundalini Teacher training certification from 7th Chakra Yoga in Huntington Beach, CA that starts September 14 and finishes June 9. It’s a 220 hour including additional yoga classes, practicum, and evaluation. One year membership in IKYTA and website listing is included in the course fee. I will become a certified instructor of Kundalini Yoga and be able to instruct students in yoga and meditation.  

  • I appreciate your contribution! Here is what you get!

I will give all contributors of $25 a free hour long in home yoga session if they live within driving distance. Everyone else will be emailed a video link to a full length yoga class taught by me they can practice at home and share with friends and family.

I will also provide 4 free yoga classes valid for one year for contributors of $100 in person or video format.

For all of you who can donate $5 you will be mailed a handwritten postcard with my deepest heartfelt gratitude!

  • If I do not reach my entire goal, I will postpone the teacher training until 2013 and use the put the funds raised towards the certification.

The Impact

  • This project is valuable to me because as a yoga teacher I will be able to supplement my income with something beneficial to the community and myself instead of waitressing working in restaurants which I have been doing since I was 15 years old. I currently work 75 hours a week! Those of you who know me can attest to my knowledge of health and passion for yoga as a contagious benefit for those struggling with their physical or spiritual progress. Beyond my personal goals, this project benefits the community by providing preventive health, promoting a healthy lifestyle, and more holistic habits.
  • I have worked for famous Health Guru Dr. Andrew Weil’s skyrocketing health food restaurant chain as well as two organic food stores where my passion and knowledge helped many people gain knowledge that dramatically changed their lives for the better. Whether it be a relationship that improved because they we able to reckognize and deal with their stress or an injury prevented because they are not stiff, there are so many positive applications to yoga.
  • I am dedicated to yoga and teaching people how much better they feel by keeping mobile and flexible. I have so much positive energy to give people, I just need you to help me help others.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • If you can’t contribute please, tell your friends on facebook or email! Every small contribution will help!
  • Share the link!

I have worked for famous Health Guru Dr. Andrew Weil’s skyrocketing health food restaurant chain as well as two organic food stores where my passion and knowledge helped many people gain knowledge that dramatically changed their lives for the better. Whether it be a relationship that improved because they we able to reckognize and deal with their stress or an injury prevented because they are not stiff, there are so many positive applications to yoga.
I am dedicated to yoga and teaching people how much better they feel by keeping mobile and flexible. I have so much positive energy to give people, I just need you to help me help others.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

If you can’t contribute please, tell your friends on facebook or email! Every small contribution will help!
Share the link!

story:
Hello my name is Marina Delgado 35 years old. I was born in Caja Marca, Peru. In 2003 I had the opportunity of coming to the US. All my life I have being a very hard worker and independent. Before coming to FL, I owned a restaurant in Lima Peru witc

h I sold to come here. I am a mother of 3 beautiful boys Raul (8), Angelo (6), and Alexander (4) all 3 born in FL.

 I am raising money for my eye surgery, 10 years ago I was diagnosed with Retinitis Pigmentosa, it’s a genetic disease that prevents me from having peripheral vision and must of my night vision making it almost imposable for me to see at night, unless there’s light. I also have a very advance cataract on my left eye that in combination with my disease makes the risk of blindness a very possible, if problem is not resolve. I’m all ready blind on my left eye and with no peripheral vision is hard to see like a normal person. With a cataract surgery I can improve mi vision dramatically and reduce the danger of becoming blind. I can’t work do to my condition every job I’m hire for always get laid of do to my blindness witch is very noticeable since I don’t see much, specially things around me. I have a very low income and have no family in the US to help me. I can’t drive a car so I walk my kids to school and try to make a living selling AVON but its just pennies compare to what I need for my living expenses and surgery.

 

 With your contributions all be able to have a full evaluation pre surgery, have my surgery completed, and purchase glasses. All be able to give a better quality of living to my sons take them to parks and other activities by my self. My life will change completely I can get a job and performed like every one ells. I will have no more fear of being in public places, places were I am always crashing with people. I will have a more normal life thanks to all of you that can Help!

 Other ways to HELP!

 I totally understand that not eveyone has even $1 to spare but we will gladly take your help in other ways! PLEASE send this link to other people who may be able to donate or share the story on your Facebook.

________________________________________

ESPAÑOL

Hola mi nombre es Marina Delgado de 35 años de edad. Nací en Caja Marca, Perú. En el 2003 tuve la oportunidad de venir a los estados Unidos. Toda mi vida he sido una persona muy trabajadora e independiente. Antes de llegar a Florida, tenía un restaurante en Lima, Perú el cual vendí para venir a Florida.  Soy madre de tres hermosos niños Raúl (8), Angelo (6) y Alexander (4) todos los tres nacidos en la Florida.


 Estoy recaudando dinero para una cirugía del ojo izquierdo, hace 10 años fui diagnosticada con Retinosis Pigmentaria, es una enfermedad genética que me impide la visión periférica y parte de mi visión nocturna la cual hace casi imposible ver en la noche, a menos que haya luz. También tengo una catarata muy avanzada en mi ojo izquierdo, que en combinación con mi enfermedad hace el riesgo de ceguera muy posible, si el problema no se resuelve. En este momento me encuentro ciega en mi ojo izquierdo debido a la catarata y sin la visión periférica es difícil ver como una persona normal. Con una cirugía de cataratas puede mejorar mi visión de manera espectacular y reducir el peligro de quedarme ciega.

No puedo trabajar debido a mi condición la cual me impide hacer los trabajos normalmente, pues no veo claramente, sobre todo las cosas que me rodean. Tengo un ingreso muy bajo y no tengo familia en Florida para que me ayuden. No puedo conducir un coche, así que camino a mis hijos a la escuela y vendo Avon para tener un ingreso aunque solo son centavos comparado a los gastos del hogar.

 
 Con sus aportaciones podré pagar mi evaluación completa previa a la cirugía, cirugía completa, y comprar espejuelos. Serré capaz de dar una mejor calidad de vida a mis hijos, llevarlos a parques y otras actividades. Mi vida va a cambiar por completo podré conseguir un trabajo estable. No tendré más miedo de estar en lugares públicos, lugares donde siempre estoy chocando con la gente. Voy a tener una vida más normal, gracias a todos ustedes que pueden ayudar.


 Otras formas de ayudar.


 Entiendo perfectamente que no todo el mundo tiene tan siquiera un dólar de sobra, pero pueden ayudar corriendo la voz. Favor enviar este enlace a otras personas que pueden ser capaces de donar o compartir la historia en su Facebook.

story:
NOGGIN SPORT

                                                   www.nogginsport.com

A personal note from Noggin Sport:

 Over the past few days and weeks we have come to get to know a young man named Damon Janes and his family and friends.  It’s amazing to me, what started out as a simple gesture of kindness has now turned into a full-blown passion to pay it forward.

 After speaking to Damons family and friends, I have come to know that Damon is someone who lived life to the fullest and always gave  110% to the fullest meaning of the expression

 

As the saying goes, the apple doesn’t fall far from the tree, I have found this to be very true in this case from speaking with his parents and friends. They have a passion for Damon and a drive that is also 110%

 

From riding to football, to helping friends and making them smile and laugh. It seems to me that Damon did it to the fullest and from the footage and messages I have seen and read its clear his friends held him in highest regard. He was truly loved by the people around him.

 110% is not just a number it’s a commitment, a passion inside you that is contiguous. It seems that Damon was that for sure.  In reading all of the letters of support its clear to me that Damon was and will be remembered for being a go getter and person of respect and a passion for life.  This is true of his parents, the apple they raised was a golden one for sure.

 On a personal note this passed week has inspired us to try and achieve more in life by contributing to try and make a difference in young mans and his families life so that he not be forgotten.

 To his parents Dean and Penny my thoughts are with you, to Mark who seems to be to be the rock and foundation that is in place and the shoulder to lean on and ear to listen when times are tough.  I have heard you say to me several times now, “we thank you for trying to make a difference”, but I can honestly say it is you that I thank. This story of your son has touched us. I have not met you or your son and though we are in different countries I can tell you for sure, 110% that Damon will with out a doubt have a long and lasting effect on those he touched and knew him, and those like me, who wish I had the chance to.

 Thank you for allowing us to take part in this small way to try and make the world we live in and the sports we love to partake in, safer and better for everyone.

 

We are there for you 110%

 Never forgotten and always remembered DJ 25

..............................................................................................................................................

Noggin Sport is a company in Ontario Canada that is looking to make a difference in sports and safety, in regards to concussion awareness and CTE. The Noggin is a fully tested piece of protective garment. Everyone knows someone who has had some form of a concussion either from sports, a slip or a fall. They know firsthand the devastating effects it can have on your body and mind.


 

Every year millions of head injuries happen in sports. Millions of dollars are lost in pro athletics salaries, regular salaries, as well as medical expenses.


 

More importantly the youth of today are at risk for more head trauma. Games are faster, athletes are bigger and equipment needs to catch up.

 

The Noggin`s goal is to make the Noggin a mandatory piece of safety equipment in all contact sports that require helmets.

 

With your contribution, we can help provide an athlete with more safety and awareness and help minimize the risk of concussions and long term CTE.

 

Millions of athletes today play contact sports and think, "I will never get hurt", and have a, "I will live forever" mentality. The fact is concussions and CTE’s are becoming a major concern in the sporting world and medical community.

 

What Noggin requires and what you get in return.

 

Noggin is seeking to raise $80,000 dollars to provide noggins to players in minor sports, globally. This money raised will help us provide players with better head protection and additional research and development to find new and better ways to try and prevent concussion related injuries 

 

No donation is too small or too large. The plan is to make sure that for every $40.00 generated Noggin will donate $5 directly to the Damon Janes Foundation and will either send you 1 Noggin skull cap  or donate it to a minor sports team of your choice. Most importantly we will be creating awareness for CTE and concussions.

 

The money generated from this drive will go to the Damon Janes Foundation and  back into noggin for more research and development. It will also go into creating a partnership with much needed groups that are in support of concussion research and CTE.

 

Many levels of donations are accepted. You also have the ability to be able to help provide a full team or league with a minimum order of 600 Noggins. The Noggin company will put your company logo and branding on each noggin bands for all players to see and use for the entire year.

 

THE IMPACT

 

Noggin is fully aware that the prevention of concussions is an on going fight. But we firmly believe this product will help with the long term fight against head trauma and the long term effect of CTE.  Many souls have been lost to the fight of CTE.  Some famous athletes have lost battles with CTE.  Being able to provide the youth of today and the future stars with better safety equipment should be the goal of every sporting good manufacturer.

 

With your donation and passing on this site information  to your friends, family, neighbours and co-workers,  we can easily obtain the goal we set.  Please also remember it does not have to be just $ 80,000 raised.  The goal is to try and provide as many noggins as possible to as many kids in the next 60 days. So please pass this on.

 

Together we can make a difference.  Change is hard, but those with vision can accept and promote safety in sports. Lets join together to make a difference, no donation is too small, no email will go unanswered.  Pass this on, let’s lead the fight to protect and preserve the sports and athletes we love.

looking to make a difference in sports and safety, in regards to concussion
awareness and CTE. The Noggin is a fully
tested piece of protective garment. Everyone knows someone who has had some form
of a concussion either from sports, a slip or a fall. They know firsthand the devastating effects
it can have on your body and mind.




 Every year millions of head injuries happen in sports. Millions of dollars are lost in pro athletics
salaries, regular salaries, as well as
medical expenses.





 More importantly the youth of today are at risk for more
head trauma. Games are faster, athletes
are bigger and equipment needs to catch up.



 
The Noggin`s goal is to make the Noggin a mandatory piece of
safety equipment in all contact sports that require helmets.



 
With your contribution, we can help provide an athlete with
more safety and awareness and help minimize the risk of concussions and long
term CTE.



 
Millions of athletes today play contact sports and think, "I
will never get hurt", and have a, "I will live forever" mentality. The fact is concussions and CTE’s are
becoming a major concern in the sporting world and medical community.



 
What Noggin requires and what you get in
return.
 
Noggin is seeking to raise $80,000 dollars to provide noggins to players in minor sports, globally. This money raised will help us provide players with better head
protection and additional research and development to find new and better ways to try and prevent concussion related injuries 

 
No donation is too small or too large. The plan is to make sure that for every
$40.00 generated Noggin will donate $5 directly to the Damon Janes Foundation and will either send you 1 Noggin skull cap  or donate it to a minor sports team of your choice. Most importantly we will be creating
awareness for CTE and concussions.


 
The money generated from this drive will go to the Damon Janes Foundation and  back into noggin
for more research and development. It
will also go into creating a partnership with much needed groups that are in
support of concussion research and CTE.


 
Many levels of donations are accepted. You also have the ability to be able to help
provide a full team or league with a minimum order of 600 Noggins. The Noggin company will put your company logo
and branding on each noggin bands for all players to see and use for the entire
year.


 
THE IMPACT
 
Noggin is fully aware that the prevention of concussions is
an on going fight. But we firmly believe
this product will help with the long term fight against head trauma and the
long term effect of CTE.  Many souls have
been lost to the fight of CTE.  Some
famous athletes have lost battles with CTE. 
Being able to provide the youth of today and the future stars with better
safety equipment should be the goal of every sporting good manufacturer.


 
With your donation and passing on this site information  to your friends, family, neighbours and co-workers,
 we can easily obtain the goal we
set.  Please also remember it does not
have to be just $ 80,000 raised.  The
goal is to try and provide as many noggins as possible to as many kids in the next 60 days. So please pass this on.



 
Together we can make a difference.  Change is hard, but those with vision can
accept and promote safety in sports. Lets join together to make a difference, no donation is too small, no
email will go unanswered.  Pass this on,
let’s lead the fight to protect and preserve the sports and athletes we love.

story:
About Alfie's Life

Alfie was born with several health problems including autistic characteristics, adrenogenital syndrome, borderline echolalia, and neurological impairment. He never let these hold him back, though. With the love and support of his mom, Cheryl, he grew to be a man who loved and cared for people like no other. His love for God was evident in everything he did in life. On March 22, 2013, at the age of 38, Alfie went into cardiac arrest and woke up in a world where he now has a brand new, perfect body.

Cheryl has been an amazing mother, pushing Alfie to be better and better, advocating for him in every area of his life, and making sure all of his medical needs were met even when health insurance wouldn't cover expenses. As a single mom, Cheryl has struggled for years to provide for Alfie and all of his needs. Cheryl is left with medical bills and now  funeral expenses.

Contributing to this campaign will help relieve Cheryl of a financial burden, enabling her to grieve for her son. Any money raised above Alfie's funeral expenses will go toward medical bills that have added up over the years. Please give to Alfie as he gave to us all through out his short, yet full life.

 

Our Goal

As Cheryl is left with immense grief, we want to help alleviate a small piece of her financial burdens. The goal was set low, but we would LOVE to see Cheryl's thousands of dollars of debt eliminated. This would help give her some peace as she grieves. 

 

The Impact

Alfie's biggest concern was always his mom. He wanted to make sure she was well provided for. We can now step in and make sure Cheryl is taken care of.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out! Post this campaign on your Facebook page, email the link to friends, etc. Let's blow Cheryl away with our generosity!!!
