story:
Thaiboxing Night - Pumpanmuang Gala

Thaiboxing Night on kansainvälinen kamppailu-urheilutapahtuma, joka järjestetään 27.4.2013 Helsingissä Töölön Kisahallissa. Suomen thainyrkkeilyn huiput kohtaavat kovia vastuksia mm. Thaimaasta, Venäjältä ja Tanskasta. Otteluparien valinnassa tärkeintä on ollut, että matseista saadaan mahdollisimman tiukkoja ja viihdyttäviä. Ottelut käydään ammattilaissäännöin. 

Tapahtuma järjestetään yhteistyössä Thaimaan arvostetuimman thainyrkkeilyareenaan Lumpinee stadionin promoottorin Mr. Pumpanmuang kanssa (kuvassa oikealla). 

Tapahtuman verkkosivut: www.thaiboxingnight.fi

Thainyrkkeily takaisin Stadiin

Thainyrkkeily on nykyään kovassa nosteessa maailmalla. Suomalaisyleisöllä ei kuitenkaan ole pitkään aikaan ollut mahdollisuutta nähdä tasokasta ammattilaisthainyrkkeilyä Helsingissä. Suomalainen thainyrkkeily-yleisö ansaitsee kovatasoisen tapahtuman pääkaupunkiseudulla. Me King of the Ring -seurassa haluamme järjestää thainyrkkeilylle arvoisensa tapahtuman Helsinkiin!

Rakkaudesta lajiin 

Tapahtuman avulla haluamme tuoda Suomalaista thainyrkkeilyä esiin ja tarjota kasvualustan tulevaisuuden lupauksille. Uskomme, että thainyrkkeilyllä on annettavaa kaikille. Haluamme saada kisahallin täyteen yleisöä. Tämän vuoksi olemme pitäneet lippujen hinnat normaalia alhaisempina. Tarkoituksena ei ole tuottaa mahdollisimman paljon voittoa vaan tarjota mahdollisimman monelle mahdollisuus tutustua lajiin. Me teemme tätä rakkaudesta thainyrkkeilyä kohtaan.

Ottelukortti

Kehässä nähdään mestareita Thaimaan stadioneilta aina Pietarin, Pohjoismaiden ja Suomen mestareihin. Mukana ovat mm. Suomen kokenein ottelija Antero Hynynen ja Suomessa asuva Thaimaalaissyntyinen Rajadamnern stadionin mestari Deo "Check Bin". Muita Suomalaisnimiä ovat mm. veijarimainen "Pok" Jääskeläinen, Turkulainen voimapesä Daniel Forsberg, Porvoon monitaituri Jaakko Dahlbacka, Jyväskylän vauhtimiehet Jarkko Kekarainen ja Minh "Joji" Le.

Alla tapahtumaan kiinnitetyt ottelut ja alustava ottelujärjestys. Tarkemmat ottelijaesittelyt löydät täältä.

Aikataulu

klo 16.00 lipunmyynti ovella alkaa 

klo 16.30 ovet halliin aukeavat

klo 17.00 ottelut alkavat

klo 21.00 tapahtuma päättyy

klo 22.00 jatkot Tivolissa: https://www.facebook.com/FredanTivoli

Huom! Tapahtumarannekkeilla ilmaiseksi sisään Tivoliin klo 22-23.00 Välisenä aikana. 

Liput

Liput voit ostaa ennakkoon tämän sivun kautta, joko PayPal-tiliä, Visa -electronia tai luottokorttia käyttäen. ei tarvitse olla PayPal-tili maksaaksesi kortilla PayPallin kautta. Tässä ohjeet kuinka maksaa ilman PayPal-tiliä (avautuu uuteen ikkunaan).

Lisäksi myynnissä on myös VIP-pöytiä. Tarkemmat tiedot löydät sivun oikeasta reunasta. Lippuja on tarjolla rajallinen määrä!

istumakatsomo   20€ (ennakkoon) / 25€ (ovella)

Ring Side           30€ (ennakkoon) / 35€ (ovella)

VIP-pöytä          600€ (ainoastaan ennakkoon) 6-8 henkilö, sisältää bufeeruokailun

Tapahtumassa ei ole numeroituja istumapaikkoja. Ringside- ja VIP-paikoiksi varataan kehän lähellä olevat alueet. Seisomapaikkoja myydään mikäli istumapaikat loppuvat kesken. Ostaessasi liput ovelta maksutapana käy vain käteinen, varaathan mukaan tasarahan. Kiitos.

Ennakkolippujen lunastus

IndieGogon kautta ennakkolipun ostaneet voivat lunastaa tapahtumarannekkeensa viikolla 25.

-Ma-to Helsingin Ju-jutsuklubin toimistolta Kaapelitehtaalta klo 16-20, Tallberginkatu 1 D, 4. krs.
-Kisapäivänä klo 14 alkaen Kisahallilta

Lippua lunastaessasi tarvitset joko IndieGogolta saamasi sähköpostivahvistuksen tai PayPal-maksutositteen. Pidäthän hyvää huolta rannekkeestasi, sillä se on pääsylippusi tapahtumaan. Lisäksi pääset rannekkeella klo 22-23 ilmaiseksi sisään Thaiboxing Nightin virallisille jatkoille Tivoliin!

Tarvitsemme sinun apuasi

Kansainvälisten tapahtumien järjestäminen on kallista puuhaa. Erityisesti ulkomaalaiste huippuottelijoiden Suomeen tuominen on iso menoerä tapahtumalle. Tämän kampanjan tarkoitus on minimoida taloudellista painetta tapahtuman järjestämisen suhteen. Tavoitteena on kerätä vähintään 10000 euroa, saadaksemme katettua suurin osan ottelijakuluista. Tämä ei kata koko illan kuluja mutta se riittää takeeksi siitä, että seuramme ei joudu konkurssiin. Samalla kampanja toimii hyvänä mittarina sille, onko tällaisille tapahtumille tilausta.

Mitä paremmin kampanja onnistuu, sitä enemmän meidän on mahdollista panostaa puitteisiin ja tehdä tapahtumasta vieläkin viihdyttävämpi. Osallistumalla tähän kamppanjaan annat äänesi tapahtuman ja Suomalaisen thainyrkkeilyn kehityksen puolesta. Ja vaikka kamppanja ei saavuttaisikaan tavoitettaan niin se järjestetään joka tapauksessa.

Miten voit auttaa

Helpoin tapaa tukea tapahtumaa on ostaa lippu joko itsellesi tai kaverillesi tämän kampanjan kautta. Rahansiirto tapahtuu luotettavasti PayPal-palvelun kautta. Sinulla ei tarvitse olla olemassa PayPal-tiliä voidaksesi maksaa. Riittää, että sinulla on luottokortti tai verkkomaksuominaisuudella varustettu Debit kortti kuten Visa-electron. Erilaiset vaihtoehdot osallistumiseen löytyvät sivun oikeasta reunasta. Kun tilaat jonkun tarjotuista vaihtoehdoista saat sähköpostitse tiedot tilauksen lunastamisesta. Kiitos!

Mikäli haluat tukea tapahtumaa mutta et pääse paikan päälle niin voit myös osallistua ostamalla tapahtuman erikoisjulisteen (julisteen esiversio kuvassa oikealla). Erikoisjulisteen hinta on 6 euroa ja sisältää postituskulut Suomeen. Julisteeseen tulee erottuva teksti "Minä tuen thainyrkkeilyä". Erikoisjulisteen saa tilattua vain tämän kamppanjan kautta.

Lisäksi voit auttaa jakamalla tietoa tästä kampanjasta eteenpäin! Facebook, Twitter, Google+, blogi tai vaikka omat kotisivusi ovat kaikki kelpo paikkoja tähän tarkoitukseen.

Treenamalla thainyrkkeilyä tuet Suomalaista thainyrkkeilyä ja pidät itsesi kunnossa. Suomen Thainyrkkeilyliiton sivuilta löydät itsellesi parhaiten sopivan seuran, jotka järjestävät thainyrkkeilyn peruskursseja ympäri vuoden.

Mitä jos?

Mitä jos suosikkiottelijasi ottelu peruuntuu vaikka loukkaantumisen takia? Entä jos ottelulistalla tulee muutoksia? Kamppailu-urheilussa sattuu ja tapahtuu emmekä voi taata, että ottelukortti pysyy muuttumattomana. Voimme kuitenkin vakuuttaa, että muutosten sattuessa teemme parhaamme pitääksemme ottelijaparit mielenkiintoisina. Se on meille elinehto koska haluamme järjestää vastaavia tapahtumia myös jatkossa!

Mikä ihmeen King of the Ring?

King of the Ring on Helsinkiläinen thainyrkkeilyseura joka toimii Kaapelitehtaalla Ruoholahdessa. Seura on voittoa tavoittelematon yhdistys. Seuran tehtävänä on opettaa thainyrkkeilyä ja tehdä lajia tunnetuksi Suomessa. 

King of the Ring perustettiin vuonna 2000 elävän thainyrkkeilylegendan ja moninkertaisen ammattilaisten maailmanmestarin Mr. Jomhod Kiatadisakin toimesta. Jomhod on kotoisin Thaimaasta ja asui yli 10 vuotta Suomessa opettaen thainyrkkeilyä.

Lisää tietoa seurasta: http://www.kingofthering.fi

Jomhodin kotisivut: http://www.jomhod.com

Tapahtuman historia

King of the Ring järjesti ensimmäisen kansainvälisen thainyrkkeily -tapahtumansa jo vuonna 2001. Tapahtuma oli menestys. Seuraava Thaiboxing Night -tapahtuma järjestettiin heti seuraavana vuonna 2002. Nyt tauon jälkeen olemme valmiit herättämään Thaiboxing Night -thainyrkkeilytapahtumat jälleen henkiin. Ajat ovat muuttuneet mutta rakkaus lajiin on edelleen vahva!

Khop Khun Khrap - Kiitos!

Lisää tietoa Thainyrkkeilystä

  • Englanninkielinen Wikipedia
  • Suomenkielinen Wikipedia
  • Suomen Lajiliitto

story:
Youth Tennis Project

Youth Tennis Project provides custom tennis rackets to kids to use for free in our public courts. Our goal is to get 250,000 tennis rackets to kids. Every accumulation of $100.00 we will give a custom tennis racket to the kids. We will work alongside the USTA partners to distribute these rackets.

Over the past three decades, childhood obeseity rates in America have tripled and today, nearly one in three children in America are overweight or obese. The numbers are even higher in African American and Hispanic communities, where nearly 40% of childeren are overweight or obese.

Even though these numbers are grim, we can start making a change.

I've been involved in tennis for years and it frustrated me that we're not doing more to make tennis fun and attractive for kids.

So I developed a process to custom wrap tennis racket frames using liquid printing. It took trial and error, but when we got it right it was amazing. It looked so cool that I thought this is a chance for all kids to belong to a tennis club... the youth tennis project club!

There are thousands of municipal tennis courts all over the country that aren't being fully utilized. Funding for school sports programs continue to be cut leaving kids inactive.

Kids don't need a fancy tennis club they just need a racket to be part of a global tennis community. Kids just need a chance.

The cool custom rackets give the kids a spark to get them out to our parks and free tennis courts. Playing for free and belonging to a global tennis club.

Next we offer a recycling program on old unwanted rackets that we may refurbish these rackets or work with ITA to recycle your racket ecologically. This will reduce landfill and help our environment.

We have a GREAT team with a ton of talent to get this project accomplished. We are working in a limited space with homemade equipment built by our amazing engineer/artist. Our processing equipment has been constructed from old barrels, rice cookers, and shopping carts. The equipment needed is readily avalible from US companies to streamline the process. As you can see from the video we are able to create an amazing tennis racket, but we need to modernize.

The usage of funds will go to get equipment upgrades, tennis rackets, printable film, painting supplies and pay our talented artist. As you see we have a nominal start up amount but it will allow us to get started.

As you may have noticed kids are getting a raw deal in this country. The funding cuts in schools are running rampide. It is up to more fortunate indidviduals to look outside government and use our create ability to help kids in this country.

Together we can do our part. Thanks for your time. Nate, Trent, Marc, Charlie, Happy and of course the kids.
story_txt:
Youth Tennis Project
Youth Tennis Project provides custom tennis rackets to kids to use for free in our public courts. Our goal is to get 250,000 tennis rackets to kids. Every accumulation of $100.00 we will give a custom tennis racket to the kids. We will work alongside the USTA partners to distribute these rackets.
Over the past three decades, childhood obeseity rates in America have tripled and today, nearly one in three children in America are overweight or obese. The numbers are even higher in African American and Hispanic communities, where nearly 40% of childeren are overweight or obese.
Even though these numbers are grim, we can start making a change.
I've been involved in tennis for years and it frustrated me that we're not doing more to make tennis fun and attractive for kids.
So I developed a process to custom wrap tennis racket frames using liquid printing. It took trial and error, but when we got it right it was amazing. It looked so cool that I thought this is a chance for all kids to belong to a tennis club... the youth tennis project club!

story:
My Life Before

I started experiencing an increasing number of strange symptoms in 1996, while working as an elementary teacher on an Indian reservation in New Mexico.  I mistook the nymphal stage tick that bit me for a mysteriously-disappearing freckle, and the huge expanding rash on my calf for a spider-bite!  I knew nothing of Lyme disease at that time, and neither did the many doctors I saw about the bizarre symptoms that kept developing over the last 15 years. It started with chronic sinus problems and often-painful lymph nodes, then progressed to succumbing to every flu and cold that came along at school, then moved on to fainting, extra heartbeats and palpitations, unexplained "anxiety attacks" with shortness of breath and tightness in the chest, neuropathy, tinnitus, nausea, vertigo, depression, back pain, and dozens more symptoms--three pages of symptoms! 

 

"Miss Diagnosed" or "Ms. Teree Illness" (LOL)

While suspicious that all these crazy symptoms were connected somehow, I could not prove it. I received numerous misdiagnoses and separate explanations for each sudden strange symptom, and many doctors just shrugged their shoulders!  Lyme Disease affects every system, organ, and tissue in the body, so is often misdiagnosed as M.S., ALS, Lupus, Fibromyalgia, Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, Sjogren's Syndrome, and many others illnesses.  Shortly after moving to North Carolina a few years ago the fatigue, pain, and new cardiac symptoms  finally became so disabling that I spent months researching each weird symptom of my "mystery illness" until I found a common denominator--and a photo of a Lyme rash just like my rash from years ago. It was only then that I was able to seek treatment with the appropriate specialist.

 

I Need Your Help

Left unchecked for so long, the bacteria that cause Lyme Disease are now firmly entrenched and in my brain as well, and will require years of treatment to bring under control.   While it is a relief to have a diagnosis at last, I can no longer afford the doctor visits and medicines nor health insurance to treat it; like many Lyme sufferers, I spent over $10,000 seeking diagnosis in the last 4 years, and am now broke, unable to work, and have already sold much of my furniture and belongings.  Without medication, my symptoms have gotten worse, and I am starting to have trouble walking, functioning, and am losing my hearing, in addition to developing more neurological symptoms, frequent migraines, and periods of mental disorganization.  I have had to move in with my parents, which is a burden to their very limited retirement finances, and they cannot afford to pay for my medical needs either.

With the appropriate I.V. antibiotics I may speed recovery by years, but this is very expensive, over $1,000 a month for at least 8 months, plus the $700 cost of setting up the PICC line, monthly doctor visits, and regular monitoring.  If my fundraising goal is not met I can still resume doctor visits and oral antibiotics to halt the proliferation of the bacteria which will improve my symptoms, and in time reverse them.  Your contribution will make the difference between medical treatment and continued decline for me, and any amount will be greatly appreciated! 

 

Dream Catcher Thank-You Perk

I have chosen to make dream catchers as my thank-you gifts because they are meant to encourage the good dreams, much as your help will bring back the hope needed for me to dream realistically of recovery from this horrible and debilitating illness.  The reality of returning to the classroom or to my work with the National Park Service or rejoining the volunteer fire department is not out of the realm of possibility, but the hope is fading with lack of medical treatment.

While dream catchers originally were made by Plains tribes,  I was taught how to make them by an Indian woman from Laguna Pueblo many years ago in New Mexico, and despite inflammation in my fingers I still enjoy the zen of making them.  I make them with metal hoops wrapped in leather strips, with intricate seed beadwork and feathers. 

 

Walk in Beauty

I want so much to be one of those optimistic patients who talk about their hopes and dreams for the future when they are well, and your help will get me onto the path of recovery so I might "Walk in Beauty," a Navajo description of a healthy life. My hope is to force my illness into remission enough to work again.  My dream is to return to New Mexico as that is where home is.  I thank you for considering my cause, and for any contribution you choose to make.

Thank You So Much,

Aleksu Hillerstrom

 

Learn More About Lyme

Lyme Disease is greatly misunderstood by many medical professionals, and diagnosis is hampered by tests that fail 50-70% of the time!  It is found in every state, and on every continent except Antarctica; it is spreading faster than Hepatitis and HIV COMBINED!  So you will know other people with Lyme Disease in your lifetime.  I hope that you will learn more about this under-recognized illness, and I have included some links here to get you started:

Columbia-Lyme.org 

ILADS.org 

underourskin.com  This is the first documentary about Lyme Disease, and may still be available on Netflix.

story:
http://military.blogs.mydesert.com/2012/12/13/marine-cpl-craig-maddy-shot-in-head-in-desert-hot-springs-always-wanted-to-be-a-marine-says-mom/

http://www.mydesert.com/article/20121216/NEWS0801/312160006/Marine-Cpl-Craig-Maddy-doing-great-after-surgery-mom-says

Hello, I am Vandi Frame-Arnold, Craig Maddy's Mom.  Craig is my only child and has been, from the moment he was born six weeks too soon, a handful but the cutest and best son a mother could wish to have.

 

Craig was a great kid growing up.  He really was the all American boy: into sports, bugs, creepy things, exploring swamps, riding his bike around, playing with his dog or collecting sticks to make into a creative variety of spears and swords.  He always had questions and was quite intellectually curious from a young age.  Ethics and being a good citizen were topics of especial interest to Craig, who has always held himself to the highest standards. 

 

An example of Craig's character which sums him up is his volunteering to stay an extra 6 weeks in Afghanistan so that another Marine could rush to his ailing father's side.  When Craig told me the news, he said he just couldn't bear the shame if he didn't stand up when asked.

 

Corporal Craig Scott Maddy, USMC was brutally attacked and shot in the head by persons unknown in the early hours of December 6, 2012 in the small town of Desert Hot Springs CA.  He was stationed in 29 Palms USMC Base after returning in October 2012 from deployment to Afghanistan, where he worked as a machine gunner and went on over 300 combat missions including heavy participation in Operation Jaws.

 

Craig has been described as the "heart and soul" of his company, the Suicide Charley's of the 1/7, and he personifies the term "good Marine." He is selfless, modest, driven and extremely goal oriented.  

 

Craig's Dad (John) and Mom (Vandi) were told he would not survive the day after he was shot, but four weeks later he continues to defy the odds by improving steadily albeit very slowly as is typical with this type of traumatic brain injury.

 

Craig has always been a real go-getter and it was clear to all that he would excel at any path he chose; therefore his parents are determined to gather the funds necessary to ensure Craig receive the best possible recovery care to help him overcome what was termed a "non recoverable wound."  Craig will have many needs, first and foremost being a home to live in.

 

Craig's Mom loves him with all her heart and he is her only child. While she is quite willing, in fact honored, to care for Craig, she also is aging and won't live forever. So Craig will need funds enough to be cared for professionally if need be, for the rest of his life.

 

Everyone who knows Corporal Maddy thinks he will not only survive this horrific attack, but will make a full recovery. But it is always best to only hope for the best, but plan for the worst.  

 

Therefore Craig Maddy's Dad and Mom humbly ask you to contribute financially as much as you can easily afford in order to help a young Marine injured by bad men for no reason.  He needs a home to live in and funds to support him.

 

Thank you so much for your generosity. May God's Blessing be upon you all!

 

How This Campaign Works:

 

Contributions through this website will be used for the following items for Craig Maddy:

 

Building or Remodeling of adaptive housing

Establishment of financial trust account and conservatorship for Craig Maddy 

 

If our goal of $250,000 is met in 120 days, we pay Indiegogo a fee of 4%. If we don't meet our goal, we keep what we earn, but pay a 9% fee.

 

Craig volunteered for the military in a time of war because he thought it was important to be a contributing citizen.  We ask you now to help support this brave young Marine in his struggle to regain the life he deserves to have.

story:
***To support us, click "Contribute now" on the right, or click directly on any of the available rewards.


                    Thanks so much for checking out MUDITA!! 

Our story

We are a yoga wear company founded by two knitwear designers and yoga lovers!! Living in New York City we were surrounded by black yoga pants in our classes (and on the street). We thought why are so many of us (yes we do it too!) wearing all black, petroleum (these things will be around way after we stop wearing them to class) and even see through pants! We realized we needed better options. We wanted colorful fashionable pants that would be great for yoga AND carry us into the rest of our day. We thought wouldn’t it be great to not only make amazing clothes but do it with yogic values to help our community. So we created Mudita Design. We have brought forth a collection that fits great, is made in an environmentally conscious way, gives back to the community, and has a unique flare!

The reception received with our first line of samples has been fantastic.  Women love the fabric and the prints. We think MUDITA is moving in the right direction and are excited to expand into more styles and colors. This is where we need your help!

WHY SUPPORT MUDITA?

We think the reasons are pretty good:

• Our collection is soft & durable. We found women wanted pants that were comfortable, had flattering colors and held their shape after many washes. We made that happen plus threw in some rocking prints!! 

• We have beautiful colors and designs that are contouring and flattering on the body. After developing many print options we conducted market research with a wide range of women listening to their feedback and desires. Creating what we are presenting today and many more to come after this campaign is successful!!

<span class="notranlsate"><span class="notranlsate"><span class="notranlsate"><span class="notranlsate"><span class="notranlsate"><span class="notranlsate"><span class="notranlsate"><span class="notranlsate"><span class="notranlsate"><span class="notranlsate">*For the guys out there who want a reward we DO offer a MENS tshirt*</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><br>

***For international shipping please add an additional $20.***

• We've created our dream fabric in beautiful colors by working closely with a talented mill. This cotton blend, four-way stretch knit, is breathable, not see through and gives amazing support . Even if you don’t have the smoothest thighs in the world...these pants will make you look like you do!

• All our pants feature a dynamite construction that sits securely on the body and does not ride-down when you become active. They have strong, athletic seams and a gusset for extra comfort. We used our fashion design skills to create a perfect fit so you could focus on the job at hand. 

• Giving back to the community is a huge part of our practice. Staying with the essence of Mudita (Def: cultivating joy through other’s well being) we’ve partnered with Yoga Foster, a NYC based non-profit teaching free yoga classes in public schools. Every pant sold directly contributes to a free class for kids. 

  • Mudita is DESIGNED and MANUFACTURED with pride in the USA.It’s been wonderful to work with factories near our design studio, ensuring quality is up to standards and getting to know those who help Mudita come to life.

In the 1960’s, 95% of the clothing we wore was made here in the U.S.A. As of 2011, it is down to a measly 3%. We'd love to see that statistic reversed and experience the good it would do for us as a nation. The more pants we get the  privilege of making the more jobs we create. 

            


• We are offering clothing that reflects yogic ideals. Using natural fiber fabric & water based dyes in our printing. Our seed tags even sprout wildflowers! 

WHY DID WE START MUDITA?

Five years back Rachel left a finance career in New York City to follow a passion that she could not shake, fashion design.She re-enrolled in university, studying in New York City and Milan. It was here the two partners had the pleasure of meeting. Sara came to fashion design from a background of teaching yoga and dance. She was a self taught seamstress and a lover of bright colors. Both shared a combined love for yoga, knitwear design and the dream of starting a business that gave back to the community.

Being business owners had been on both our minds for many years however we had to first grow as designers. After graduation, we both worked in the fast-paced fashion world of New York City, taking in its endless lessons and inspirations from truly talented designers. We both reached a point where we felt confidant in our skills and ready to produce an alternative to the ever-present black yoga pant in a way that was good for the world. And now here we are!

***WHERE WE ARE NOW***

 We have created our first round of production and are receiving raving reviews! Besides a few bumps in the road, we’ve had great success. Securing fabric and a high quality manufacturer is a challenging task! In order to offer a competitive price you need to order in large quantities. We have learned along the way and found a fantastic team to help us produce the high quality garments we were looking for. The sewers and printers are set and our mill is ready to start knitting. Now we need YOUR support to bring MUDITA to life by helping us to secure our bulk order of fabric and production of pants. We want to get these pants in your hands as soon as possible!

CHECK OUT OUR WEBSITE  www.muditadesign.com

LIKE US ON FACEBOOK     www.facebook.com/muditadesign


Risks and challenges?

Trust us, we ran into every road bump possible to make our first round of pants. We learned and made adjustments where needed. The great thing about problems is you get to come up with solutions. Creativity isn't just for designing! One of the biggest challenges for us has been securing our sourcing and being able to meet the fabric minimums. With the money we raise through Indiegogo we will be able to meet these minimums and work with high quality factories creating our garments at affordable prices.

With our factories dialed, the fabric mill ready to start knitting and all the patterns perfected......We are ready to go!

Now we need YOUR support to bring MUDITA to life by helping us to secure our bulk order of fabric and production of pants. We want to get these pants in your hands as soon as possible! CHECK OUT OUR WEBSITE  www.muditadesign.com LIKE US ON FACEBOOK     www.facebook.com/muditadesign Risks and challenges? Trust us, we ran into every road bump possible to make our first round of pants. We learned and made adjustments where needed. The great thing about problems is you get to come up with solutions. Creativity isn't just for designing! One of the biggest challenges for us has been securing our sourcing and being able to meet the fabric minimums. With the money we raise through Indiegogo we will be able to meet these minimums and work with high quality factories creating our garments at affordable prices. With our factories dialed, the fabric mill ready to start knitting and all the patterns perfected......We are ready to go!

story:
Short Summary

Memcine is a small biotech company with a patent-pending technology that will enable patient-specific tumor therapy.  Our technology, known as Immunoplex, can be used to create individualized vaccines that are able to ramp up the immune response against a patient's tumor.  Imagine, a technology that, within hours, can be used to create a vaccine for anyone's tumor!  Our technology truly is personalized medicine.

What We Need & What You Get

Memcine was recently awarded up to $500,000 from the State of Iowa based on our scientific data and commercialization plan; however, we need matching funds to receive the money.  We estimate that a total of $500,000 will be needed to mature our research portfolio, allowing us to bring in strategic funding partners.  That's why our target is $250,000.  We will use this $250,000 and matching state funds for a total of $500K.  This money will allow us to add to our existing data package.  Just think, for every dollar you donate, its like donating 2!  The money will go to additional research and development of the technology.

Sadly we can't offer gadgets for your donations.  We have instead provided non-traditional perks in exchange for your donations.

The Impact

Immunoplex technology is based on decades of research showing the benefits of antibody coated tumor cells in inducing an anti-tumor response.  Our technology was developed to streamline the process and universalize production of the antibody coated tumor cells from any patient.  This therapy has the promise of being effective, with the added bonus of having little to no side-effects.  Just think!  A cancer treatment that doesn't have debilitating side-effects and helps reduce tumor size and metastasis!  Your dollars will go toward non-animal mechanistic studies and stability assays required for new drugs and therapies submitted to the FDA.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't want to or can't donate, pass the word along to others that may have an interest in our technology and the promise of patient-driven personalized tumor therapy.   We don't want to go down the path of tear-jerking... we all know how important this is.

story:
BEYOND “RED CROSS”: Relief efforts for women in disaster areas are a global responsibility for transnational feminists

AF3IRM, Balik sa Dagat Bangka Journey, and NAPIESV have established a partnership to highlight the need for sexual violence prevention steps and services for areas affected by Typhoon Yolanda (or Haiyan) in November and the Bohol earthquake a month earlier in the Philippines.

Women in disaster areas face gendered vulnerabilities. The stress, fear, and sense of helplessness in areas struck by natural hazards increase the risk factors for perpetration of violence against women. (Klein, et al, 2007) Sexual violence is the single-most underreported or unreported crime in the world. Women in disaster areas, including the Philippines, may not have the chance to report at all due to potential disorganization of law enforcement, or even due to mistrust of police and military, who themselves have a history of perpetration. Transnational feminists must create their own infrastructure for relief from sexual violence at this time, taking the lead of Philippine women’s efforts and sharing resources across borders to ensure the most effective support to women and children in a time of loss and chaos.

In a spirit of transnational feminism, AF3IRM, Balik sa Dagat Bangka Journey, and NAPIESV declare their respect for the leadership of Philippine women’s organizations in women-centered relief and seek to include women experts from other relief efforts (e.g., in Indonesia, Haiti, Louisiana) to complement the work by sharing best practices. 

We recognize that AF3IRM, Balik sa Dagat Bangka Journey and NAPIESV function from positions of advantage in the United States, so we aim to be prudent when we offer our skills and resources to the valiant and indefatigable endeavors of Philippine women’s programs and organizations to bring relief to families affected by the recent earthquake and typhoon. We hope to partner with these organizations in the Philippines and agree to act as a bridge to other women and women’s organizations in the United States and abroad to augment the efforts.

Our goals include assisting local programs and organizations in the Philippines by providing services to victims/survivors of sexual violence through sharing expertise and funding; creating “mobile safe centers” for women and children to be able to access services; and organizing missions and exchanges between Philippine women and transnational women who have faced sexual violence in disaster areas.

And this is where you can help ----

Our project is divided into three phases: 1) area exploration and survey to assess needs and logistics; 2) implementation of services based on the needs assessments that will include sharing resources with local organizations and establishment of “mobile safe centers”; and 3) evaluation of the project and arrangement of missions and exchanges between Philippine women and transnational women who have faced sexual violence in disaster areas. 

We are currently in Phase 1, which is aided by NAPIESV’s unrestricted funds.  The discretionary money is being used to assist two AF3IRM members who will perform the needs assessment. 

But we need your support in funding Phase 2!

For Phase 2 to take off, we expect our cost to be $5,000 to help provide basic resources (such as rice, mosquito nets, clean water, etc.) for the “mobile safe centers,” medical supplies, intake materials, and trainings. 

Your donation of $25 or more will go a long way in saving lives and building peace!

You can also help in another way: Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!

For more information, email us at contact@napiesv.org

About AF3IRM:

AF3IRM is an all-volunteer, transnational women’s organization that is engaged in three areas of advocacy: combating trafficking and militarism, and working for immigrant women’s rights.  We actively oppose violence against women in all its forms. 

About Balik sa Dagat Bangka Journey:

Balik sa Dagat Bangka Journey is a community-building project with a vision of empowerment through cross-cultural collaboration by helping build a Pilipino bangka (outrigger canoe), creating watercraft experiences for urban families, and revitalizing ancient seafaring traditions on the West Coast. Our goal is to create space where the community is able to safely experience the healing process from trauma, from violence including sexual violence.

About National Organization of API Ending Sexual Violence (NAPIESV):

NAPIESV is a national organization established by Asian and Pacific Islander anti-sexual assault advocates developing a cross-movement analysis, as well as working to build relationships and partnerships to address sexual violence in API communities.  We recognize the importance of understanding the connections between sexual violence and other forms of violence and oppression.  NAPIESV believe that to effectively build a movement to end sexual violence within API communities, we must include an extensive range of API communities and voices that can speak to those connections, oppressions and social conditions.

story:
It’s time to get the lead out!

CedarLight Grove, ADF is an experiment in Urban Druidry located in Baltimore, MD which has grown and flourished since its establishment in 1990 by our founder, Will Pierson. In 1996, CLG procured its own, permanent sanctuary in northern Baltimore City to provide a place of worship that serves the whole Pagan community. CLG continues to be an active member of that community, running charity events and fundraisers including (but not limited to!) cleaning up local neglected graveyards, cleaning up local streams, raising money for Child’s Play, collecting goods for natural disaster victims and the House of Ruth, even collecting money for the Orpheus Pagan Chamber Choir. We’ve even been featured in the New York Times!: If a Druid Rings a Doorbell.

Alas, Pagan sanctuaries require much painstaking love and care to keep them running! They do not run on prayers and faith alone (though sometimes we try with a lot of incense…that hasn’t worked yet…). This year alone we’ve taken on a huge project to remove lead from the building (more information on that below). So, we need some help from the community we bend over backwards to support! We’re running a fundraiser to help recoop the costs of several maintenance projects we’ve held this year and keep CedarLight Grove open to the public! AND you get a chance help plan our Winter Solstice ritual too! ;)

Winter Solstice/Saturnalia/Topsy Turvy Fun for You!

Every year for the Winter Solstice, we hold an all-night vigil in which we stay up all night with laughter and good cheer to make sure the sun rising again in the morning! This year for our main rite, we will be celebrating Saturnalia style with a Topsy Turvy rite meant to lift the spirit and petition the Kindred for “Joyful Prosperity for the Folk of the Gods”! BUT, we need help planning!

So this is where YOU come in! (Yes you, and you…also you waving your hand over there!) For our fundraiser, we’ve come up with several goals of things we would like to for our holiday! If we are able to collectively fundraise each of these goals, then that we means YOU have helped us decide on how we’re going to celebrate our Winter Solstice High Rite this year on Saturday, December 21st.

The decisions we need help with are as follows…

IF WE RAISE:

  • REACHED!!! $50 – Then we’ll dress up all the statues we have on the grounds (which is a lot!)
  • REACHED!!! $100 - Then we’ll open the gates with our children members leading us singing Day-o (The Banana boat song) 

  • REACHED!!! $150 - Then we’ll "gift" our newly voted in Witan members with jester hats when they're sworn in
  • REACHED!!! $200 – Then we’ll honor the Outsiders in pig latin.
  • REACHED!!! $250 – Then one of our members will do an invocation standing on her head.
  • REACHED!!! $300 – Then, for the final, traditional, praise offering of pig, our member Scott will perform Timon and Pumba's Hula song from The Lion King.  

  • REACHED!!! $400 – Then the Nature Spirits will be honored using the Chicken Dance.
  • REACHED!!! $500 – Then volunteers from our Women's group will perform "I'll Make a Man Out of You" (in drag) during revels 

  • $1000 - Then volunteers from our Men's group will perform "Men in Tights" (in tights) 

  • $1500 – Then a volunteer from the Women's Group will dress as Little John for the Men's performance.
  • $2000 – Then a volunteer from the Men's group will dress in drag for the Women's performance.
  • And the big one... $3000 – Then CLG’s membership will make and post their own Harlem Shake video. If you aren't familiar with this internet delight, here's a good example video: 

For each of these goals that we hit, we will either photograph, video record, or audio record us completing these tasks the night of. We’ll them post them here and on our Facebook page for you to see what madness your charity has wrought!

Additionally, for anyone who donates at least $100, they will receive a copy of CedarLight Grove's "Druidic Arts" calendar which includes a collection of photographs and original poetry by our very own artistic membership!

By the way, CedarLight Grove, ADF is a registered non-profit charity, so any donations you make are tax deductible!

The Impact

Owning any kind of building is fraught with perils and danger. Our membership valiantly battles against all odds to keep things at CLG running! The age of the CedarLight Center, where we hold all of our events, classes, and rites, requires frequent maintenance. The building still has lead paint in certain parts of it, and as mentioned above, we just recently under took a huge project to remove the lead paint from one of our apartments upstairs that we rent out. The project has been a long time coming! By removing the lead in that one part, we’ve helped make the building safer!

Just recently we also had to have a new toilet and sink installed in our bathrooms, and had a brand to new sump pump well dug out to save our Senior Druid and Building Manager from having to bail out a basement flooded knee deep with buckets in the middle of the night during a hurricane again! (Yes, they actually did that last year…)

That old phrase “blood, sweat, and tears” is hugely appropriate to the work that our Witan and membership put in to keep CedarLight Grove a part of the community, to run classes and workshops, to run a monthly Reiki share, and to host other Pagan groups. We have people who travel 2+ hours just to attend our rituals and some our high rites see around 40-50 people in attendance (which is a lot if you’ve seen the size of our parsonage!). We’ve succeeded in becoming an integral part of the community, which we couldn’t have done without the dedication of these people.

Any money you are able to donate will be an immense help to keep CedarLight Grove alive and thriving as we continue to serve the Kindred and the community the best that we are able. We love all of you, and hope that you will love us in return! Any little bit helps, even if it’s only a couple dollars!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t donate, no sweat! We know how the economy is right now. You can help us in other ways. Please share our campaign with your friends and family! Post about us on Facebook, Twitter, or wherever else you can think of! There are links on this very page you can use to save you some time.

And if you’re able, feel free to join us on Saturday, December 21st for our Winter Solstice Celebration! More details will be available soon on our website, http://www.cedarlightgrove.org as well as our Facebook page!

story: My husband and I have been blessed with a very bright and beautiful baby boy. However, we are once again faced with a very difficult decision .  Our son Cooper went through a tough surgery in December to correct a condition that he was born with. It was a very emotional time for my husband and I and we were told that we had to pay for the bulk of the surgery up front . We went and got out a loan to pay for it in hopes that it would correct the problem that our little boy was dealt. He recently had his 1st birthday and it was a wonderful celebration . Unfortunately, not long after this I noticed that the place where hehad the surgery did not look quite right. We got him to the specialist and he had to inform us that the  surgery had not healed the way it was suppose to. Even though it had  improved the situation, there was still a chance that our little boy would have to have some major accommodations to do something that most people take for granted. This would open him up for ridicule and be a huge blow to his self image. So we are now facing another surgery with more complications in hopes of giving our little boy a normal life. The money that is raised here will go to help us pay for Cooper's treatment, our stay in and travel  to Dallas, and for supplies/medication after the surgery.  Please help if you can. And we would like to thank everyone in advance.

story:
What is this project about?

Think about it, how many platforms are there that offer such a vast array of media, all catered to your mood? - None. Try doing a quick google search if you don't believe it.

The beauty of this idea stems from not only giving people a better way of relating to popular content, but also giving the world a chance at discovering a cure (hence the name). We do this by using the revenue generated from the app, and donating towards research efforts for a cure, every single month.

Why this appeals to you:

Our mission is to not only revolutionize how we see moods, but to create something we can all get behind. Tha Cure will be on the forefront of mood-based media solutions, as it will be aiming to be the first platform to define and fix a user's particular mood. We feel this will not only give our idea a greater chance of success, it will also ensure its sustainability.

Tha Cure is designed to incorporate an array of moods ranging anywhere from feeling rejected to ecstatic. This means that whatever mood you are in, or want to be in, we have you covered. Similar to social media, Tha Cure will enable its users to publish a wide variety of relative and popular content from across the globe. However, our platform will provide its users with a new way of relating to the vast world of media - with mood-targeted content. Our intent with this was to engineer a change for how we both discover and enjoy media on a day-to-day basis. We aim to do this by more deeply relating the most popular forms of media to what drives our very thoughts and actions, our emotions.

Tha Vision:

Ideally our hope is to grow Tha Cure into a nationally, if not globally recognized non-profit. As mentioned, we wanted to create something everyone could not only benefit from, but also be involved with. Building this app will open countless opportunities to make a positive impact on disease, ultimately allowing us to donate truly significant amounts to research for a cure.

Initially we will only be donating 10% of the proceeds to research organizations. As this will allow us to use the remaining revenue to grow the idea much faster, and conclusively ensure a lasting future for the concept. With mobile application profits capable of exceeding over $47,000 per DAY, just imagine the impact we could make in only one year! (That's over $16 MILLION dollars!). But let's not get sidetracked here with what could be... let's focus on what we have - a fun and innovative idea.

What we want/need:

In order to incorporate the app's necessary features, we need to hire a team of skilled developers that will help design, create, build, and market this idea. In accordance, we have chosen to use a top-notch app development company: (www.fueled.com)

Our thought process behind this is to ensure every nook and cranny of our vision is magnificently brought to life. We wanted to be able to work closely with our idea as it develops, and to be there to shape it into something timeless. So after speaking with countless local app development companies, we concluded that Fuelded by far surpassed this standard. They make it their priority to work with their clients, and carefully develop their projects into world class applications. (The kind of apps that are featured in the top 100 in the App Store).

Sadly, this comes at a price... a pretty steep one might we add. ($200,000)  Anyway, we have chosen to set a more reasonable goal that will allow us to still create our vision. Our plan is to outsource the development of this app to companies located overseas (this will allow us to build it much cheaper). The only issue with this is, typically it's a bit more difficult to direct the development of an idea this complex over phone calls and emails. Doable, but a little more challenging.

Either way, we are determined to make sure our vision is not only realized, but guaranteed to make a positive impact in accordance with our mission. Feel free to take a peek below to find out more on what we need and how you can help!

So why an $87,000 Funding Goal?

Building an app isn't cheap, especially one that requires complex functionality. Reaching our funding goal will provide us the means to develop Tha Cure into what we set out to create - a truly innovative platform that offers everyone the chance to better relate the vast media world to our complex emotions. Your help will enable us to successfully launch Tha Cure on a global scale, therefore establishing our mission, and ultimately invoking a change.

Initially, our goal is to launch Tha Cure solely on the iOS platform. This will allow us to see how well people take to it, and also give us the chance to adapt to their reactions. However, if we can reach our first stretch goal, we will be able to spread our cause to both Android and Iphone users. Yet most ideally, if we can reach our second goal of $240,000, we will be able to follow through with our original plan of hiring Fueled - Undoubtedly establishing Tha Cure as a world class application that will surely top the charts on the App Store.


App Details

Here are just a few features this app will have:

  • An innovative content discovery engine that will deliver the most relatable media according to your desired mood!
  • The most popular media outlets: Links, Pictures, Videos, Music, and Movies, all tailored to your specific mood.
  • Unique user profiles that can be linked to social media.
  • Over 50 different moods to choose from. (Both good & bad moods)
  • Be able to create your own posts, galleries, and playlists to share with the world.

         What do I get for contributing?

If our funding goal is met, we will not only be able to bring this incredible idea to millions of people, we will also pick 5 random individuals to be sent a completely free Sony SmartWatch2 as a thank you for helping us bring this vision to life! And... if our sweet perks weren't enough, we will be adding 10 more people to receive a free Sony SmartWatch2 with each stretch goal we make! ;)


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, so here are some other ways you help:

  • Please share our campaign with the tools at the top of this page, this really does make a difference :) 
  • Tell your friends or family about our mission, word of mouth goes a long way!
  • Like us on Facebook - your support means a lot!

 This seriously wouldn't be possible without you guys, we can't thank you enough...
story_txt:
What is this project about?

Think about it, how many platforms are there that offer such a vast array of media, all catered to your mood? - None. Try doing a quick google search if you don't believe it.
The beauty of this idea stems from not only giving people a better way of relating to popular content, but also giving the world a chance at discovering a cure (hence the name). We do this by using the revenue generated from the app, and donating towards research efforts for a cure, every single month. 


Why this appeals to you:

Our mission is to not only revolutionize how we see moods, but to create something we can all get behind. Tha Cure will be on the forefront of mood-based media solutions, as it will be aiming to be the first platform to define and fix a user's particular mood. We feel this will not only give our idea a greater chance of success, it will also ensure its sustainability. 
Tha Cure is designed to incorporate an array of moods ranging anywhere from feeling rejected to ecstatic. This means that whatever mood you are in, or want to be in, we have you covered. Similar to social media, Tha Cure will enable its users to publish a wide variety of relative and popular content from across the globe. However, our platform will provide its users with a new way of relating to the vast world of media - with mood-targeted content. Our intent with this was to engineer a change for how we both discover and enjoy media on a day-to-day basis. We aim to do this by more deeply relating the most popular forms of media to what drives our very thoughts and actions, our emotions.




Tha Vision:

Ideally our hope is to grow Tha Cure into a nationally, if not globally recognized non-profit. As mentioned, we wanted to create something everyone could not only benefit from, but also be involved with. Building this app will open countless opportunities to make a positive impact on disease, ultimately allowing us to donate truly significant amounts to research for a cure.
Initially we will only be donating 10% of the proceeds to research organizations. story:
We can do this together. 

Hi, I’m Arshad. I'm the creator of the Power 20 Method, and my company is tiny but my solutions to health are big. My competitors are huge pharmaceutical companies with deep-pocketed, well marketed diet brands. Meanwhile, I work in a shared workspace for health-tech companies called Blueprint Health in NYC, and so far I have avoided all outside funding. 

I’m building a new kind of health company - one that’s focused on prevention, not pill popping. 

It’s not easy, it’s not sexy, but it works.

The Power 20 Method is a reasonable response to an unreasonable world. No single supplement or specific routine can solve all our health woes. If we want to be healthy, we have to address every aspect of our lives: how we sleep, what we eat, how we socialize, how we move, and even how we see ourselves.

The Method is constantly being tested and improved on. 

We spent the past year testing the Power 20 Method. We've learned that the benefits go beyond weight loss to include:

  • Improved strength.
  • Better balance.
  • Better waist-to-hip ratio.
  • Improved alertness.
  • Better mood.
  • Fewer cravings.

Help me break through the noise. 

There’s a huge amount of misinformation out there about what makes us unhealthy and what is actually good for us. The Power 20 Method looks beyond fad diets, and relies on evidence we see in both labs and our own users. Though it's far easier to sell a pill than to improve a lifestyle, we've decided to take the harder path.

Your contribution will fund the printing of the guides and the design of the packaging.

Important parts of the project are already done. We've already launched the workout apps, have created all audio guides, and now we just need to fund the physical products.  

It works because it lowers blood sugar and breaks down triglycerides. 

The Power 20 Method and diet is designed to reduce the size of your fat cells very quickly. Fat cells get larger when they're filled with triglycerides. Triglycerides are three units of glycerol bound together. When they're bound together, they are too big to escape from inside the fat cell. Only when they are unbound, or broken down into fatty acids, are these small enough to pass through the fat cell walls to be used for energy. Breaking down triglycerides is the key to shrinking fat cells, which is in turn the key to revealing that six pack or toning up that butt. 


It works because it's truly holistic.

There are no short cuts when it comes to a healthy lifestyle. Different parts of your life are interrelated, which is why the Power 20 Method touches on so many aspects.

  • Diet. You'll get a comprehensive diet plan and green tea to have with breakfast. 
  • Exercise. You'll use the Power 20 workout apps, which are designed to improve your insulin response. 
  • Sleep. You'll get sleep hypnotherapy tracks that help you fall asleep faster and stay asleep through the night. 
  • Stress. You'll get guided meditation designed to help you adhere to the program and lower stress.
  • Social Support. You'll get the Social Support  as part of the Guide, so if you to the Power 20 Method with friends, you'll see better results. 

Doctors & health experts support this method. 

The reason we've received accolades from doctors and experts in diabetes is because we're offering a specific solution. When a doctor says to eat right and exercise, the Power 20 Method gives patients the precise instructions. For these reasons, we've been getting respect from the health and tech community.

Other products I've built are popular and effective.


The Power 20 Method is an extension of the very popular Power 20 Workout App. You can find the Power 20 app on Android and iOS devices. There are now over 100,000 users of the app, and we have multiple versions. 

I've spent my life looking for ways to improve life at work and at home.

I started a company called MetroNaps 10 years ago because I saw that people were suffering from sleep deprivation at work. I saw napping at work as a logical solution. Today you can find MetroNaps EnergyPods at great companies like Google. That's me in a Pod.

Support the Power 20 Method and I'll send you the guided meditation. 

This guide walks you through a 10-minute meditation that focuses on visualizing your day. You'll get this as part of most of the contributions. 

You'll also get the sleep aid. 

Sleep deprivation can seriously undermine any healthy regimen. That's why, with most contributions, you'll get the sleep aid sent to you as well.  It's a hypnotherapy track that's designed to quiet your mind so you can get to sleep.

At the $39 level, we'll send you the entire kit. 

I'm relying on you to decide whether we bring this product to market. 

  • Our biggest challenge is the cost of the physical goods. We're using the campaign to bring down the cost of printing and redesigning our packaging so the kits can be safely shipped worldwide.
  • No matter how much is raised, we can fulfill every order right now, but with sub-optimal packaging.
  • You should get your Power 20 Method package within a month of the campaign's end.

Some more info on the team.

Power 20 was created to help people who might not have access to gyms and trainers stay healthy. We don't capture user data in our apps. We don't sell the personal information of our customers. Instead, we're focused on giving people the best, most effective experience in terms of health. Our team consists of a cardiologist, a licensed hypnotherapist, a fitness trainer, and a designer. 

Sleep Advisor

Arshad Chowdhury co-founded MetroNaps, the company that builds napping chairs for the workplace. He brings his findings on sleep and his network of sleep experts to bear on the Power 20 Method's sleep guidelines. You can read about Arshad’s entrepreneurial efforts on his blog. He is from New York, NY.

Clinical Hypnotherapist

Kelly McLoughlin, CMS-CHt, FIBH. Kelly has over 8 years of experience helping people lose weight through hypnotherapy. It’s her voice you’ll hear on the sleep and meditation mp3 files. She practices in Ashland, OR.

Cardiologist

Dr. Muzibul G. Chowdhury, MD. Dr. Chowdhury advises the Power 20 Method on its combination of diet and exercise. He’s Arshad’s father, and has been involved in the creation of the Power 20 workout apps as well. He practices in Windsor, CT.

Designer

Joaquin Jutt designs the guides and workout apps that make the Power 20 Method. He focuses on usability and simplicity. Joaquin is based in New York, NY.

Contribute to help yourself and others. 

Many people can benefit from using the Power 20 Method, but people with obesity and Type 2 diabetes in their families will find it especially effective. The low-sugar diet, coupled with lowered stress and regular, high-intensity exercise, is a proven way to control the spiking blood sugar that leads to obesity and diabetes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute right now, there are many ways to help. 

  • Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter. 
  • Tell friends about it. 
  • Try the Power 20 workout apps. Search "Power 20" for iOS and Android devices. 

Thanks for taking the time to read through all this. We appreciate your support!

Music Attribution:

AudioLogic / CC BY 2.5

story:
Who we are

We are the OKC Outlaws, Oklahoma's only banked track roller derby team. The team was founded by a diverse group of women dedicated to maintaining a banked track roller derby league in Oklahoma.  Since the foundation of the Outlaws, we have been working hard, participating in local events and volunteering our time and services throughout the community.  The banked track that we use is well known for its appearance in Drew Barrymore's Whip It!  Unfortunately, the track has been in storage for the past few years and its original owners are looking to sell it.  That is where our fans come in!  We need your help to not only buy the track, but also to afford a warehouse big enough to house the track.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $27,000.  It would cost $15,000 to buy the track from its owners and $12,000 to pay six months rent upfront to a warehouse that could house our track and that we could host bouts in.

If we are not able to meet our goal, then any funds raised here will be combined with our continuing fundraiser efforts to eventually purchase the track and move into a new practice space.Our current best option for a warehouse costs nearly $2000 per month, during this campaign we will continue to pursue other options and hopefully lower our monthly costs. Backers can expect to see important updates as we progress in our search for our new home.

So what is in it for our amazing fans?!

  • $10 gets you a special 'thank you' on our facebook and twitter

  • $25 gets you an Outlaws Shirt and Save the Banked Track Sticker, and a special Thank You on our facebook and twitter

  • $50 gets you the New Recruit Skater Package; includes new girl training class ($60 value) and a special Thank You on our fb/twitter

    OR
    $50 can get you 2 OKC Outlaws shirts, Save The Banked Track sticker, 2 koozies, 2 tickets to 1 home bout (your choice), and a special Thank You on our facebook and twitter

  • $100 you can Sponsor A Skater (meaning you donation will help her pay her monthly team dues) and a special Thank You on our facebook and twitter
    OR
    $100 you get 2 OKC Outlaws shirts, 1 Save The Banked Track sticker, 2 koozies, 2 tickets to 1 home bout (your choice), and a special Thank You on our facebook and twitter

  • $200 gets you 2 Outlaws shirts, 2 Save The Banked Track stickers, 2 koozies, 4 tickets to your choice home bouts (Total of 4 tickets), and a special thank you on your facebook, twitter and website

  • $400 will get you everything mentioned prior plus your choice of Name and Numbers printed on the back of your Outlaws shirts, signed league picture with frame, and a special Thank You on our facebook, twitter and our website with your picture and own personal message

  • $500 will get you our Slingshot Sponsorship package which includes: 2 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 1 3’x1.5’ banner provided and hung by team at every home bout, Announcements over PA at home bouts and 1 proud sponsor sticker

  • $750 will get you our Derringer Sponsorship package, which includes: 2 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 1 Outlaws T-shirt, 2 proud sponsor stickers, 1 4’x 2.5’ banner provided and hung by team at every home bout and announcements over PA at home bouts
  • $1000 will get you our Six Shooter Sponsorship package which will include: 4 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 2 Outlaws T-shirts, 1 4’x 2.5’ banner provided and hung by team at every home bout, 2 proud sponsor stickers, 1 5”x 5” add in program at home bouts, announcements over PA at home bouts and booth space at all home bouts

  • $1500 will get you our Rifle Sponsorship package which includes: 6 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 3 Outlaws T-shirts, 1 6’x 2.5’ banner provided and hung by team at every home bout, 3 proud sponsor stickers, 1 half page ad in program at every home bout, Announcements over PA at home bouts, Appearance at 1 of your company’s events or fundraisers and Booth space at all home bouts

  • $2000 will get you our Double Barrel Shotgun Sponsorship package which includes: 6 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 4 Outlaws T-shirts, 4 proud sponsor stickers, 1 full page ad in program, Announcements over PA at home bouts, Appearance at 2 of your company’s events or fundraisers, Booth space at all home bouts, logo or company name on all Outlaws flyers and 1 6’x 2.5’ banner provided and hung by team at every home bout

  • $4000 will get you our Gatling Sponsorship package (limit 1) which will include: 10 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 4 Outlaws T-shirts, 4 proud sponsor stickers, 1 full page ad in program, Announcements over PA at home bouts, Appearance at 2 of your company’s events or fundraisers, Booth space at all home bouts, logo or company name on all Outlaws flyers and your company name and logo proudly and professionally painted in huge letters on the banked track.

The Impact

For many of our skaters, this has been a difficult journey full of heart break and excitement.  We love our track and we want to stay a banked track league, but in the past we have not been able to find an affordable warehouse that was big enough.  Now that the track is up for sell, we are worried that we could lose our chance at this dream. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you cannot afford to donate!  Help us spread the word by sharing this site.  The more people that know what we are doing, the better! 

Thank you for helping us out.  We really could not do it without the love and support of our fans!

To find out more about our league, check out these links:
http://www.okcbankedtrackrollerderby.com/
https://www.facebook.com/okcbankedtrackrollerderby
https://twitter.com/OutlawsDerby

$500 will get you our Slingshot Sponsorship package which includes: 2 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 1 3’x1.5’ banner provided and hung by team at every home bout, Announcements over PA at home bouts and 1 proud sponsor sticker

$750 will get you our Derringer Sponsorship package, which includes: 2 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 1 Outlaws T-shirt, 2 proud sponsor stickers, 1 4’x 2.5’ banner provided and hung by team at every home bout and announcements over PA at home bouts

$1000 will get you our Six Shooter Sponsorship package which will include: 4 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 2 Outlaws T-shirts, 1 4’x 2.5’ banner provided and hung by team at every home bout, 2 proud sponsor stickers, 1 5”x 5” add in program at home bouts, announcements over PA at home bouts and booth space at all home bouts

$1500 will get you our Rifle Sponsorship package which includes: 6 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 3 Outlaws T-shirts, 1 6’x 2.5’ banner provided and hung by team at every home bout, 3 proud sponsor stickers, 1 half page ad in program at every home bout, Announcements over PA at home bouts, Appearance at 1 of your company’s events or fundraisers and Booth space at all home bouts

$2000 will get you our Double Barrel Shotgun Sponsorship package which includes: 6 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 4 Outlaws T-shirts, 4 proud sponsor stickers, 1 full page ad in program, Announcements over PA at home bouts, Appearance at 2 of your company’s events or fundraisers, Booth space at all home bouts, logo or company name on all Outlaws flyers and 1 6’x 2.5’ banner provided and hung by team at every home bout


$4000 will get you our Gatling Sponsorship package (limit 1) which will include: 10 tickets to all home bouts, logo listed on Facebook page and website, 4 Outlaws T-shirts, 4 proud sponsor stickers, 1 full page ad in program, Announcements over PA at home bouts, Appearance at 2 of your company’s events or fundraisers, Booth space at all home bouts, logo or company name on all Outlaws flyers and your company name and logo proudly and professionally painted in huge letters
on the banked track.The ImpactFor many of our skaters, this has been a difficult journey full of heart break and excitement.  We love our track and we want to stay a banked track league, but in the past we have not been able to find an affordable warehouse that was big enough.  Now that the track is up for sell, we are worried that we could lose our chance at this dream.  Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand if you cannot afford to donate!  Help us spread the word by sharing this site.  The more people that know what we are doing, the better!  Thank you for helping us out.  We really could not do it without the love and support of our fans!To find out more about our league, check out these links:http://www.okcbankedtrackrollerderby.com/https://www.facebook.com/okcbankedtrackrollerderbyhttps://twitter.com/OutlawsDerby

story:
Juan Pablo Gómez Flórez is my cousin 3 years old and for that unexpected  life´s reasons he is figthing against Leukemia (LLA).

His parents Wilson and Marcela  have to assume many expenses and Marcela had to quit her job in order to take care of Juan Pablo

For that situation, they are going to lose their apartment here in Bogotá.

We know them very well and we can affirm their situation is tough and real.

We are united in a Support Network to get the Money they need (US$3500) to stop the Bank´s process.

We are asking your good will and support, that your heart wants to contribute with this family.

At the end of the Support Network,  we will send you all the collected media and what we did.

God bless you and all your loved ones for this help, you are giving to this family! 

PS: If you can not help with some money , you can help us sharing this campaign and doing some Echo on your friends and family!

story:
Missed Our Campaign?
Not to worry - you can still grab resin at our MadeSolid Store

High-Quality 3D Printing Resins at a Reasonable Cost

Frustrated with failed prints? Feel limited by slim color selection? Do you cringe at every expensive failed print? As fellow Makers, we feel your pain. This is why we have developed our own high quality resin with a more color options, Form1 compatibility, and all at a more reasonable price.

*Update* New Time Lapse of Eiffel Tower. Will get more pictures of tower up here soon


What's the Problem?

There have been recent releases of really great hardware and software that have advanced the printing power for Makers everywhere. But we haven't seen that same development in the world of materials. It's frustrating being limited by the colors and properties of resins and tons of time is wasted trying to get the right printer settings. The high costs per liter makes us cringe at every failed print.

We've had these issues with a number of different kinds of SLA printers. Talking with other members of the 3D printing community, we found they had the same frustrations we had.

Here's our Solution

Our team, specializing in chemistry, has worked tirelessly to developed the best materials for 3D Printers with these frustrations in mind.  Here's, in short, what makes our resin different:

  •  High Definition
  •  Form1 Printer Ready (no tweaking necessary)
  •  Low to No Odor
  •  Reasonable Pricing
  •  More Color Options (Black, White, Pink, and Blue available now)
  •  Easy to Clean (No More Isopropyl Alcohol)

Our formulas are beyond mere theory. We have sent out initial batches of our resin to be tested by Form1 users. Here's are some of their awesome results:

(Buddha printed by Raymond Delia at S.K. Studios - @stinkykitties)

(3DKitBash Test Prints by Juan Posada at HodgePodgeLabs - @jposada)

(Turbine Engine printed by Dylan Jackson at Expensive Habit Engineering - @TheRubberSideDo)


(Falcon design by Colin Freeman on our own printer)

More Resin Details

Does the resin work on printers besides the Form1?

Yes, the resin will work in other printers, such as the B9, Muve3D, and others. However, we still need to settle on the appropriate print settings for other laser and projector based printers. We have developed other general-purpose resins that we have as a reward as well, which are more suited for most laser and DLP systems.

Is there a risk to my printer using your resin?

MadeSolid resin does not make contact with any functional parts of your printer other than the vat and the build platform. It is therefore highly unlikely that the resin will damage any other portion of your printer. During our testing, as well as the testing of beta users, there have been no adverse results from printing with MadeSolid resin. 

Will it damage my vat?

There have been no adverse affects reported by any users of the resin damaging vats or build platforms. Our resin has a lower viscosity, so it is not as thick as resins you may be used to using. As a result, it is easier to clean, while creating less friction between your build platform and vat. However, all vats used in resin printing will need to be replaced according to the timeline provided to you by the printer manufacturer.

What colors are available?

Currently, Black, White, Blue, and Pink are available. We have printed in other colors, and those will be available soon. If you have a color that you would like to see, send an email to listening@madesolid.com. It's likely that we can make something happen if there is enough of a request.

How do I choose a color for my resin?

You can select a different color for each liter you buy. For example, if you buy a pack of 3, you can choose 2 White Liters and 1 Blue Liter or 1 Pink Lt.1 Black Lt. 1 White Lt. Just message us once you finish the checkout and let us know which combo of colors you want.

What is the shelf life of the resin?

All resin has a shelf life. We estimate that your resin will be good as new for 6-months, after which the quality of the resin may start to diminish. Regardless of the amount of time it has been on the shelf, we suggest shaking the bottle of resin before use.

Do you have estimated delivery dates for the resin?

We plan to ship 30 days from when the campaign finishes. Once we close the campaign it will take a little time to get the supplies, mix together the formula, and ship it.


(Darth Vader in his native black)


(White Taj Mahal, Ring, Flower, and Gear off the Form1 Printer)


(Various Prints off the Form1 Printer)


Who's theTeam?

We are makers, chemists, engineers, and entrepreneurs. We love designing, uploading our STL files, and coming out with amazing prints. The universe of 3D Printing can only go as far as the material lets it. Our vision is to extend the limits of what can be made by printing with superior materials.

How Far Along is Development?

The hard work of development a resin that works great is done. Now we need your help to get our resin into the hands of SLA printer users like you. The demands of scaling our operation takes quite a bit of capital to get things moving. This campaign will allow us to get enough of the raw materials and equipment to properly mix and package the resin and ship it out to you.

Rewards

For you lovely casual supporters, we are going to hook you up with different classes of MadeSolid swag ranging from shout-outs, stickers, t-shirts and 3D printed objects. We're offering two kinds of prints. The first is a colorful bunch of flowers in a vase (each item will be printed and the flowers themselves in our resin). The second is a fully functional desktop catapult. We will print and assemble it, then ship it to you. It'll be made from our own PET material and no rubber bands are required.


(Flowers, stems, and vase are all printed. Flowers will be in various resin colors)

(Catapult printed in our PET material on the amazing Type A Machines)


(Catapult in action. No robots were seriously injured)

For you Form1 users, we offer our F1 MadeSolid Resin. There are a variety of packages to choose from depending on how many liters you need. You may choose Blue, Black, White, or Pink for each bottle (For example, with a 3 pack you can have 2 Black and 1 White).

(MadeSolid Resin in 1 Liter and 500 ml Bottles)

For you Non-Form1 SLA Printer users, we offer a high quality resin that is compatible with B9Creators and Muve3D, among others. You may choose from Blue, Black, Magenta, and White.


Risks and challenges

We have already unlocked the key elements which will pave the way for expanding into different resin properties and colors. The challenge that lays in front of us is a simple one - startup costs. We need capital to buy the barrels and raw materials required to produce the resin.

The initial wave of recipes have already been crafted and we have been able to produce enough small quantity to test with a number of early adopters. We just need a little boost to scale our operation to supply you with high quality resin.
