story:
Exercise can be invigorating, personal, social, safe and fun. That is the core concept behind this project. But how will we accomplish this? Through a highly dynamic, educational, motivational and social website that does all the work for you so you can enjoy your health. Read on to get the details!

Who Am I?

Hello, my name is Eric Schmidt. I've had a serious love/hate relationship with exercise my entire adult life. I know how important it is, I know how much better I feel when I do it regularly, but I always get bored with it after a month or two and I stop.

The stopping needs to stop.

I started paying more attention to what my workout routine is like when I'm motivated and what is happening when my motivation stops. Then I talked to a number of friends and acquaintances and asked them the same questions I was asking myself.

Here's what I found to be the two key parts of a successful, long-term exercise 'program' for many people (including myself):

  • Diversity
  • Motivation

The Team

I found a group of amazingly talented individuals with varied, yet applicable, backgrounds to ensure this project is a great success.

What We Need & What You Get

There are four main sections to this project that need funding:

  • The main website
  • The mobile website
  • The apps for mobile devices, including tablets
  • The professional, educational and motivating how-to videos

Now, I'm sure you'd like to know what's so special about this website and why you should help in it's creation.

What is This Website and Why is it Special?

This is so much more than your typical health and fitness website, I could write a book about everything that will go into it and how helpful it will be. But there's not that much room so here's a breakdown of the key points. And if you have any questions about specific sections of the website and what is planned, please don't hesitate to ask, we'll be more than happy to go into more detail.

In a Nutshell

This cross-platform system is highly personalized, providing each user programs based on their own specific needs, abilities and goals!

Auto-Creation Tool

The website will have a very robust auto workout creation tool. This tool will build a workout for you based on your input, including:

  • Your gear
  • Your fitness level
  • Body parts you want to focus on
  • Workout style, such as plyometrics, bulking up, endurance, yoga, etc...

This workout creation tool will adjust the intensity of workouts and individual exercises it gives you based on the input you gave from previous workouts. This tool will be extremely powerful and highly dynamic, this leads to solving the first problem I listed above, 'diversity'. Not only will this tool give you a workout for the day, but it can also create long-term programs that include rest days/weeks, increases in difficulty, etc...

You will never have to think about what workout to do, nor will you get bored as workouts won't repeat, each and every workout will be unique, unless you don't want them to be, it's entirely up to you.

This creation tool is very powerful and like nothing out there.

Education

There will be hundreds of individual exercises in the database. Because of this, odds are at some point, you will find yourself needing to do exercises you've never seen before or are not too familiar with. This means there needs to be a robust education section on the site.

The education section will contain a wide variety of information, including 100's of step-by-step videos on how to do the exercises on the site. These videos will be professionally made and taught by highly-trained individuals so they'll be fun to watch and trustworthy.

User Profile

The profile section will contain everything about you that you want to put into the system and the ability to share or not share various parts of it with the community.

This is also where you can track of everything related to your exercise routines, or as much or as little as you want. You can track your physical traits, such as weight, blood pressure, etc... and you can track all workouts you've completed, weight/reps/sets/etc... you did for them, and you'll be able to create graphs with your entire history or just parts of it.

The Social Platform

Here, you will be able to engage with others to help solve the second problem listed above, 'motivation'.

Motivation is a huge problem for many people and finding people to work with towards similar goals or who like similar workouts can really help.

Not only will you be able to find others but you'll be able to build workouts and whole programs and share them with the community and the world. Maybe you create a fantastic workout program specifically designed for Spartan Races, you'll be able to build it and share it, even create and share your own workout videos.

Corners

There will be different sections of the website dedicated to different styles of exercise, such as:

  • Yoga
  • Dynamic workouts similar to the styles of Crossfit and P90X
  • Endurance running
  • Power lifting
  • And more!

Each style will have it's own area on the site where people can connect with others, create workout routines to keep or share, have workout routines created by the system specifically for them, share their success and much, much more.

Costs

Here is the funding needed to be sure we can pay for each of the sections:

The cost breakdown above will cover everything critical to this project. However, it's important to note that $20,000 probably won't allow us to make all the videos we want, nor will $25,000 let us deploy apps on all the mobile systems we'd like to, at least right away (we will still develop them eventually, however). All money above and beyond our goal will help improve the scope of the initial deployment and add more important educational videos.

What if, knock on wood, we don't reach our goal? Although this would certainly be terrible, we'll still be able to get either the website or the apps built, plus get started on the videos. Then we would work on financing the other aspect(s) of the project.

So, What do You Get for Contributing?

We came up with some fun and useful perks at a wide variety of donation levels.

For the individual

In addition to producer credit on some of our videos, the perks range from a magnet to gym gear such as a jacket or gym bag. All the products will have our awesome logo (still in development) and the statement that you're a 'Founding Partner'! Once the funding process is complete, no more 'Founding Partner' logos will be made.

For the business

If you're a business and would like to get some amazing niche-specific, health and fitness-related advertising, contributing to this project is a great way to do it. Not only will you get advertising credit on some of our videos via annotations (the higher the contribution, the more videos your business name will appear in), but you'll get targeted advertising credits on the website (again, the higher the contribution, the more credits). The advertising is CPM-based, i.e. pay-per-view, which means the more you donate, the more eye-balls you get your business in front of.

We have a solid marketing plan to get users to the site to make it grow quickly and rapidly, the more money we bring in, the more marketing strategies we can apply and the faster we can grow. We have great plans and very high expectations for this program. Feel free to contact us if you'd like some more information before donating.

Important Note: Advertising for adult and adult-related products, services and sites will not be accepted, nor will advertising for any site, product or service that promotes illegal activities. Please use common sense, if you're unsure whether or not you'll be allowed to advertise on the site, odds are you won't be.

Important Producer Credit Note:

We will place no more than 2 credits total per video, near the beginning of the video. If you have a specific video or style of video you want your credit placed in, we will be happy to accommodate. Because of the nature of advertising in the videos, we will place the credit in an annotation. You can see annotations in use on YouTube videos. They are the blocks of text or links that appear somewhere on the screen during a video (they are not the ads that slide up from the bottom of the video). Since embedded items in videos can't be changed once a video is uploaded, we will use annotations so we can make changes as needed.

Please don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions about the perks.

Referral Contest

We decided to add a referral contest, it's easy to take part and the more money raised by your referrals, the better loot you get!

There are two ways to take part:
  1. Sign in to Indiegogo (create an account if you don't have one already) then use the 'Share' links on our campaign page just below the intro video. If you look at the links that are created, there is a number at the end, the link with look something like https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/495191/emal/3552162 where '3552162' will be replaced with a number unique to you.
  2. After making a contribution, you'll get a share link like the one above that is unique to you. Simply share it on Facebook, Twitter, in an email, or anywhere you want.
We'll be able to use these unique links to determine any referrals you make!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everybody can contribute to the project and that's quite alright. The real key to our success will be getting the word out, so please, whether you contribute or not, share this campaign with your friends, family and the world. You will be helping get a fantastic service out to the world.

Thank you very much for your consideration and time, it is extremely appreciated.

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter

Stretch Funding

What if we go over our goal?

We have many plans for this site, the funding goal will give us the ability to develop the website and apps to a minimal level. However, the more contributed to this campaign, the more we will be able to add to the site and the apps at launch. Plus, we will be able to update the site and apps more quickly after launch based on user feedback.

In addition, we would use the stretch funds to help with initial marketing, ensuring the website gets seen and used by tens of thousands of people or more.

If you have any questions or concerns about how we will use the funds, please contact us through the comment form.

Thank you again for your time.

To your health!
Eric

You can track your physical traits, such as weight, blood pressure, etc... and you can track all workouts you've completed, weight/reps/sets/etc... you did for them, and you'll be able to create graphs with your entire history or just parts of it.
The Social Platform
Here, you will be able to engage with others to help solve the second problem listed above, 'motivation'.
Motivation is a huge problem for many people and finding people to work with towards similar goals or who like similar workouts can really help.
Not only will you be able to find others but you'll be able to build workouts and whole programs and share them with the community and the world. Maybe you create a fantastic workout program specifically designed for Spartan Races, you'll be able to build it and share it, even create and share your own workout videos.
Corners
There will be different sections of the website dedicated to different styles of exercise, such as:

Yoga
Dynamic workouts similar to the styles of Crossfit and P90X
Endurance running
Power lifting
And more!


Each style will have it's own area on the site where people can connect with others, create workout routines to keep or share, have workout routines created by the system specifically for them, share their success and much, much more.
Costs
Here is the funding needed to be sure we can pay for each of the sections:
The cost breakdown above will cover everything critical to this project. However, it's important to note that $20,000 probably won't allow us to make all the videos we want, nor will $25,000 let us deploy apps on all the mobile systems we'd like to, at least right away (we will still develop them eventually, however). All money above and beyond our goal will help improve the scope of the initial deployment and add more important educational videos.What if, knock on wood, we don't reach our goal? Although this would certainly be terrible, we'll still be able to get either the website or the apps built, plus get started on the videos. Then we would work on financing the other aspect(s) of the project.
So, What do You Get for Contributing?
We came up with some fun and useful perks at a wide variety of donation levels.
For the individual
In addition to producer credit on some of our videos, the perks range from a magnet to gym gear such as a jacket or gym bag. All the products will have our awesome logo (still in development) and the statement that you're a 'Founding Partner'! Once the funding process is complete, no more 'Founding Partner' logos will be made.
For the business
If you're a business and would like to get some amazing niche-specific, health and fitness-related advertising, contributing to this project is a great way to do it. Not only will you get advertising credit on some of our videos via annotations (the higher the contribution, the more videos your business name will appear in), but you'll get targeted advertising credits on the website (again, the higher the contribution, the more credits). The advertising is CPM-based, i.e. pay-per-view, which means the more you donate, the more eye-balls you get your business in front of.
We have a solid marketing plan to get users to the site to make it grow quickly and rapidly, the more money we bring in, the more marketing strategies we can apply and the faster we can grow. We have great plans and very high expectations for this program. Feel free to contact us if you'd like some more information before donating.
Important Note: Advertising for adult and adult-related products, services and sites will not be accepted, nor will advertising for any site, product or service that promotes illegal activities. Please use common sense, if you're unsure whether or not you'll be allowed to advertise on the site, odds are you won't be.
Important Producer Credit Note:
We will place no more than 2 credits total per video, near the beginning of the video. If you have a specific video or style of video you want your credit placed in, we will be happy to accommodate. Because of the nature of advertising in the videos, we will place the credit in an annotation. You can see annotations in use on YouTube videos. They are the blocks of text or links that appear somewhere on the screen during a video (they are not the ads that slide up from the bottom of the video). Since embedded items in videos can't be changed once a video is uploaded, we will use annotations so we can make changes as needed.
Please don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions about the perks.
Referral Contest
We decided to add a referral contest, it's easy to take part and the more money raised by your referrals, the better loot you get!

There are two ways to take part:
Sign in to Indiegogo (create an account if you don't have one already) then use the 'Share' links on our campaign page just below the intro video. If you look at the links that are created, there is a number at the end, the link with look something like https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/495191/emal/3552162 where '3552162' will be replaced with a number unique to you.
After making a contribution, you'll get a share link like the one above that is unique to you. Simply share it on Facebook, Twitter, in an email, or anywhere you want.
We'll be able to use these unique links to determine any referrals you make!
Other Ways You Can Help
We know not everybody can contribute to the project and that's quite alright. The real key to our success will be getting the word out, so please, whether you contribute or not, share this campaign with your friends, family and the world. You will be helping get a fantastic service out to the world.
Thank you very much for your consideration and time, it is extremely appreciated.
Follow us on Facebook and Twitter
Stretch Funding
What if we go over our goal?
We have many plans for this site, the funding goal will give us the ability to develop the website and apps to a minimal level. However, the more contributed to this campaign, the more we will be able to add to the site and the apps at launch. Plus, we will be able to update the site and apps more quickly after launch based on user feedback.
In addition, we would use the stretch funds to help with initial marketing, ensuring the website gets seen and used by tens of thousands of people or more.
If you have any questions or concerns about how we will use the funds, please contact us through the comment form.
Thank you again for your time.
To your health!Eric

story:
A Conversation with America

On August 24th I depart Palisades Beach State Park in Los Angeles to walk 8873 miles around the United States. I do this to challenge the discrimination against obese people and to empower myself and others to lose weight.

Last year 300,000 people died from obesity, even if the official death reason is not "obesity", there are many ways to die from being too big. Maybe one of the people who died was one of your loved ones, or maybe you struggle with your own weight. One thing is for sure, you know people, who like me, have struggled their entire lives with obesity, and it can be debilitating.
I am one of those people whose health is negatively impacted by obesity, and this walk is my own empowerment as well as an effort to help others.

Obesity was recently declared an official illness, and evidence shows it is a complex condition.

$800 covers one month expenses for me while on the road. Briefly, the expenses are: Telephone, Health Insurance, Food and Camping fee's. Gear, clothes and shoes is additional, although for now, I have that covered.

Once I have raised my budget for the walk I will start to fund raise for obesity related charities.

I have sold my belongings as a way to fund the first 1 or 2 months of walk, after that I will rely on your contributions. I will continue to walk as long as I have funds, if I run out then I will either stop and work for a brief time or go home.

This walk will be an exciting adventure - and not just for me. You are welcome to join me for any part of the walk, hook up in with me in cities and towns across the country, join me on facebook or even host me for a night.

You can choose to get involved at any level you want. Whether spreading the word about my amazing walk, joining my on facebook or supporting my campaign with donations.

story:
What is Pedal The Planet

I set out in March 2014 from Leitrim, Ireland to cycle 30,000km around the world to help raise awareness for Suicide Prevention. I have completed over 15,000km so far through twenty countries across Europe (Ireland -> Turkey), India (Mumbai -> Bangalore -> Kolkata), South East Asia (Bangkok -> Singapore) & Australia (Perth -> Melbourne)

The Impact

In 2012, worldwide over 800,000 people took their own lives. Every day we read about murders and road traffic deaths in the papers, but we fail to talk about one of the biggest killers around. Suicide!

Depression and suicidal thoughts are treatable. Help is available from a variety of sources. We need to let people know that these options exist and point them in the correct direction

Four years ago, I was able to turn the direction of my life around simply by asking for assistance from my friends, family & colleagues. The support was then, and has been since, absolutely astounding. 

How Can You Help

You can support the campaign by purchasing a reward from the list of offers here on the Pedal The Planet page. Purchasing the official Pedal The Planet Cycle Jersey from our technical cycling clothing partner Spin11, A Meal Ticket or Sponsor a Mile in each of the countries. Full details on each of these offers are along the right hand side of the page.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position financially to purchase any of the rewards, it's not the end of the world. There are two ways you can support this campaign

1. Follow or Like us on social media at Facebook, Twitter & Instagram

2. You can help simply by spreading the message using Facebook, Instagram & Twitter using the hashtag #PedalThePlanet and maybe with the power of a crowd we can help save lives.

3. Talk to your family, friends and loved ones, ask them how they are feeling and actually take a couple of minutes to actually listen to the response.

If one person chooses to embrace live rather than the alternative, this entire campaign will be worthwhile.

Thank you in advance to everyone who supports this campaign. You have no idea of the difference this might make to a single person, their family, friends and community.

story:
Owner and inventor of The Semenette®, Stephanie Berman has been working in the women's reproductive health industry for 11 years.  When it came time for her and her wife to try and start a family of their own she, realized that their options for trying at home were very limited to either using a turkey baster or a needless syringe.  EWWW.

THE DREADED TURKEY BASTER!

In their first attempt to conceive at home with a turkey baster, they quickly realized just how awful this "experience" was and that's when Stephanie became motivated to create something better for them.   After lots of brainstorming, prototyping and engineering, Stephanie had created The Semenette®.  The Semenette® is a unique, high quality ejaculating dildo that allows people to have intercourse and mimic an ejaculation.  From a functional standpoint, The Semenette® can also help:
  • Men with Erectile Dysfunction
  • Men with Disabilities
  • Transgender (FTM) Community
The best part of this new invention?  Because of The Semenette®, Stephanie and her wife were able to successfully conceive their daughter, Isabella.  You remember that hair club for men commercial from the 80's?  Well, Stephanie is also proud to say, "I'm not only the President, I'm also a client!"

Once The Semenette® was on the market, there were so many people the toy was helping not only from a functional perspective but from a pleasure perspective as well and we knew we were really onto something.  Some of the communities that also support and endorse The Semenette® are:

  • BDSM/Kink - (Think 50 Shades of Gray!)
  • Pegging
  • Swingers
  • Adult Performers
  • Single Women
  • Heterosexual Couples
  • Gay Men

                                             WHY WE NEED YOU!

This campaign is so important to us because we REALLY want to continue to provide you with the highest quality in pleasure toys possible.  Your contribution will allow us to make The Semenette® V2, so we can continue to meet the needs of each of our customers.  It's not easy being a start up business, let alone being a business woman in a heavily male dominated industry.  Your contribution empowers women, entrepreneurs and not only that, it helps us continue to spread sex positivity, love, fun and pleasure to EVERYONE around the world.

 As an innovator seeking to improve couples' sex lives from a functional AND fun standpoint, Stephanie and her team are always striving to provide customers with consistent improvements and options to meet their needs.  The desires of customers are always evolving and with your help we want to evolve our toys with them and bring you The Semenette V2! 

Here's what we currently have

Up to this point, we manufactured 500 units in 3 realistic colors, Vanilla, Cinnamon and Chocolate.  With your contribution, we will manufacture The Semenette® V2 in NEW non-realistic color options (tell us what color you want to see!), make different sizes of the toy, larger bulbs for squirting even more liquid, and use a softer silicone to enhance the comfort and feel of the toy. 

            WHAT WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL BE USED FOR?
We know everyone's money is valuable.  We want you to feel comfortable supporting us and our campaign.  Here's what we plan on doing with the funds raised:

Molds, tooling and custom parts aren't cheap!  Ever heard of modular rack tooling?  We hadn't either until we invented The Semenette®!  $35K of the money raised from this campaign will go directly to manufacturing costs of V2, this includes prototypes and inventory.  Your contribution will help us make The Semenette in new colors and new sizes.  Additionally, we have decided to lower our campaign goal and will work on raising the 15K for new packaging for The Semenette® V2 to accommodate for the new toy at a later time!  Despite us wanting to look good, what is most important to us is making the new toy at the highest quality possible! 

Here's a sneak peak at our new packaging!

With this funding we will produce V2 of The Semenette® and we will be able to continue to finalize a major distribution deal with  El Dorado, one of the leading adult sex toy distributors in the industry! 
Please give us your feedback on which color and/or size Semenette® you want to see next!  The options we are deciding between are Black, Blue, Purple and Pink.  We value your opinion so let us know!  

Some press coverage of The Semenette®!
            

                     

 
   


So what separates The Semenette® from other sex toys on the market? 

Well, we are:

  1. Made in the USA from 100% medical grade silicone
  2. Hypoallergenic
  3. Body Safe
  4. Phthalate Free
  5. Non Porous
  6. Never re-use the same tubing!

  

The Semenette® provides you with FUN and FUNCTION without compromising quality!

The Semenette® is currently available in our standard size which is:

Length: 6.25"

Width: 1.449" x 1.5"

Circumference: 3.25"

The Semenette® comes with the toy and the following replacement parts:

  • 3 tubes (made with medical grade silicone)
  • 3 Luer Lock Fittings (made from plastic -Nylon and Polypropylene)
  • 3 Tip Plugs (made from casted Urethane Polymer)
  • 1 Bulb (made from Platinum-Cure Silicone)

Need more tubes and parts?  No problem!  We've got you covered!  The Semenette® Refill Kit is sold separately and comes with 5 tubes, 5 luer locks, 5 tip plugs and 1 bulb!

The Semenette® also has a specially designed chamber located on the bottom of the base that allows you to tuck the tubing into the chamber so it lays nice and flat while wearing it in a harness. 

                                             
                                                 THE PERKS!!!
We are in love with all of our perks!  You couldn't ask for better products and compliments to The Semenette®!  Here's a closer look at some of our "perk" products...

  1. The Semenette® will fit in most harnesses but we love the Spare Parts Joque®! It's the Cadillac of harnesses and the perfect compliment to The Semenette®!

  2. The Joyboxx® is the world's only hygenic adult storage system that allows you to store your sex toys in a private, safe and sexy environment!  The Semenette® happens to fit perfectly in there as well!  Use the Joyboxx® to store your Semenette®!

  3. Megan Andelloux is not only an awesome member of our team, she is a certified sexpert!  Megan teaches sex education all over the country!
  4. UberLube® is a silicone based premium lubricant that is scentless, tasteless, non-staining and SAFE!  It makes for an incredibly enhanced experience in the bedroom and is also designed to do lots of wonderful things! 
  5. And many more!!!

We are sure you are wondering what kind of liquids can be used in The Semenette®?  Well, you can get creative!  Just make sure you are smart about what you can and cannot put inside your body!  Here's a start...

  • Lubricants (UberLube, Spunk Lube, etc...)
  • Homemade fake cum (find recipes online!)
  • Water
  • Alcohol (not for internal use)
  • Chocolate sauce (for those with fun fetishes but not for internal use!)
  • Just about any liquid you can think of that will squirt (just make sure if you are putting it inside your body it's safe!)

                                           Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand if you can't contribute at this time but in lieu of a financial investment, we ask that you please make some noise and spread the word about our campaign!  The more people that see this the better!  So please share it on all social media platforms!  

We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to check us out and consider contributing.  We hope to be able to continue on in this journey and keep bringing you the ultimate in pleasure products!  Thanks so much!

story:
Head Case is the only affordable three-part concussion management system designed to measure hits and help identify concussion symptoms.

Why We Created the Head Case Concussion Management System

Each year, 1 in 5 high school athletes sustains a concussion. Repeat concussions can cause memory loss, attention difficulties and long-term brain damage. There is currently no concussion management system on the market that measures and records impact data and provides tools to help diagnose a concussion. Due to this market gap, the health of young athletes is at risk. Concussions are a growing epidemic, but our affordable, three-part system can help protect young athletes from the risks of undetected, repeat concussions.

What is the Head Case Concussion Management System?

The Head Case Concussion Management System is an affordable, easy-to-use full circle program that measures head impacts, provides diagnostic tools to detect potential concussions and recommends the best treatment facilities available.

All head impacts, failed concussion symptom detection tests and diagnosed concussions are tracked over an athlete’s career to provide a lifelong head health record. This information helps to prevent traumatic brain injuries and long-term permanent brain damage due to repeated undetected concussions, through education and awareness.

The Three-Part System:

1. Head Case Impact Sensor

The impact sensor is a small device inserted into a helmet to monitor and record head impacts by measuring G-force through an accelerometer in the device.  The sensor can be used in multiple helmets. By reviewing the athlete’s normal impact history and comparing to national averages, the Head Case Impact Sensor can detect impacts of concern and alert coaches, trainers and parents.  

2. Head Case Mobile App

The Head Case Mobile App serves as a diagnostic tool that walks parents and coaches through a step-by-step field-side test to help detect symptoms of a potential concussion. If an athlete fails the concussion test, test results are automatically uploaded to the Head Case Website, and an alert is sent out to the designated emergency contacts. In the alert, information on local medical treatment facilities is immediately provided via the Head Case Mobile App.

3. Head Case Website

By signing in to the Head Case Website, athletes, parents and coaches can review an athlete's impact data on the Head Case Website along with analysis and reporting tools. Data can be compared to previous impact data as well as compared to team members and national averages. The Head Case Website is a comprehensive information portal and resource center for concussion education and concussion management.

Current Status

We've poured years of research and development into creating our three-part Head Case (also known as HeadCase) concussion management system, which includes the Head Case Impact Sensor, Head Case Mobile App and Head Case Website.

Why We Need Your Help

We need your help to bring the Head Case Concussion Management System to young athletes around the country. Head Case hopes to raise $50,000 or more funds to start production. Here's how we will use the funds:

$26,000 -- Production tooling, pilot production run, debugging
$6,000 -- Packaging production and design
$4,000 -- Finalization of website and mobile app
$12,000 -- Schools/municipalities pilot program
$2,000 -- Business, accounting and marketing expenses

We hope to sell the Head Case Concussion Management system in stores and an online by May 2014.

Thank you for your help!

www.headcasecompany.com

Head Case is the only affordable three-part concussion management system designed to measure hits and help identify concussion symptoms.Why We Created the Head Case Concussion Management System
Each year, 1 in 5 high school athletes sustains a concussion. Repeat  concussions can cause memory loss, attention difficulties and long-term brain damage. There is currently no concussion management system on the market that measures and records impact data and provides tools to help diagnose a concussion. Due to this market gap, the health of young athletes is at risk. Concussions are a growing  epidemic, but our affordable, three-part system can help protect young athletes from  the risks of undetected, repeat concussions.
What is the Head Case Concussion Management System?The Head Case Concussion Management System is an affordable, easy-to-use full circle program that measures head impacts, provides diagnostic tools to detect potential concussions and recommends the best treatment facilities available. 
All head impacts, failed concussion symptom detection tests and diagnosed concussions are tracked over an athlete’s career to provide a lifelong head health record. This information helps to prevent traumatic brain injuries and long-term permanent brain damage due to repeated undetected concussions, through education and awareness.



The Three-Part System:1. Head Case Impact Sensor
The impact sensor is a small device inserted into a helmet to monitor and record head impacts by measuring G-force through an accelerometer in the device.  The sensor can be used in multiple helmets.  By reviewing the athlete’s normal impact history and comparing to national averages, the Head Case Impact Sensor can detect impacts of concern and alert coaches, trainers and parents.   
2. Head Case Mobile App
The Head Case Mobile App serves as a diagnostic tool that walks parents and coaches through a step-by-step field-side test to help detect symptoms of a potential concussion. If an athlete fails the concussion test, test results are automatically uploaded to the Head Case Website, and an alert is sent out to the designated emergency contacts.  In the alert, information on local medical treatment facilities is immediately provided via the Head Case Mobile App.  
3. Head Case Website
By signing in to the Head Case Website, athletes, parents and coaches can review an athlete's impact data on the Head Case Website along with analysis and reporting tools.  Data can be compared to previous impact data as well as compared to team members and national averages. The Head Case Website is a comprehensive information portal and resource center for concussion education and concussion management. 
Current StatusWe've poured years of research and development into creating our three-part Head Case (also known as HeadCase) concussion management system, which includes the Head Case Impact Sensor, Head Case Mobile App and Head Case Website. 
Why We Need Your Help
We need your help to bring the Head Case Concussion Management System to young athletes around the country. Head Case hopes to raise $50,000 or more funds to start production. Here's how we will use the funds:
$26,000 -- Production tooling, pilot production run, debugging$6,000 -- Packaging production and design$4,000 -- Finalization of website and mobile app$12,000 -- Schools/municipalities pilot program$2,000 -- Business, accounting and marketing expenses
We hope to sell the Head Case Concussion Management system in stores and an online by May 2014. Thank you for your help!
www.headcasecompany.com

story:
Who are we?

We're a group of friends, scattered all over the world, who are unable to offer a dear friend of ours a couch and a shoulder to cry on in her time of need. We're all broke students, and most of us are oceans away - so we're turning to you! good people of the internet, to help Daphne out.

Why does she need help?

Daphne is a wonderful, talented twenty three year old who lives in Greece, with her adorable giant kitten Kida. Until now, she's been living in a small apartment and attending university but due to years of abuse by her family, she has been diagnosed with depression and is unable to continue her studies without aid. 

She can not afford to see any mental health professionals, though she desperately needs help. 

Right on the heels of this, her family has been pushing her to move in with them, which will be devastating for her mental health, and as such are refusing to help her keep her apartment while she searches for work. We have created this campaign in order to help support Daphne while she finds work in a destitute economy, and so that she can start receiving much needed treatment as soon as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

We've worked out the general cost of living in Greece, paying her bills and rent, buying food and feeding her cat at a minimum of 400-500euro a month. We're hoping to make enough to keep her apartment paid for for a few months, and hopefully have enough left over to see a local therapist or counselor. 

Your money will go directly to this - paying rent, utility bills, food costs, travel expenses and for medical help. All of this will help Daphne be in a better position to find work and apply for jobs, without the looming threat of losing her apartment or having her electricity shut off. 

We've got some great perks for those who donate! 

Other Ways You Can Help

The economy right now is tough for everyone, so if you can't donate you can help immensely by spreading the word! Indiegogo provides several easy ways of sharing online. There's a tumblr post with these details HERE, and if you're active on that site, please reblog!

Every little bit helps.

story:
A NON-INVASIVE BLOOD GLUCOSE MONITOR MEANS NO MORE FINGERPRICKS

WE WON THE AUCTION! THE IP IS OURS! CONTRIBUTIONS ARE STILL WELCOMED. NEW CONTRIBUTIONS WILL MAKE IT EASIER TO MAINTAIN THE PATENTS, AND IF WE GET A SIZABLE AMOUNT OF CONTRIBUTIONS, THE DEVELOPMENT MAY CONTINUE NOW! 

YOU MAY ASK, WHY DID I INSIST ON ACQUIRING THE PATENTS? IT'S BECAUSE I KNOW THAT THE TECHNOLOGY WORKS. I WOULD NOT HAVE SPENT ALL THAT MONEY ACQUIRING THE PATENTS WITHOUT THIS CERTAINTY. I KNOW THAT THE TECHNOLOGY WORKS, BECAUSE I ANALYZED THE DATA, AND THE RESULTS WERE GOOD IN SPITE OF A SERIOUS MECHANICAL FLAW IN THE PROTOTYPE DEVICE. WITH THE FLAW FIXED, THE RESULTS WILL BE BETTER.

THE PHYSICAL PATENT DOCUMENTS ARRIVED AT VALOA!


So much paper, you ask? It's all the correspondence with USPTO and foreign agencies.


WHAT HAPPENED

In April, 2015, Grove Instruments, Inc. of Worcester, Massachusetts, suddenly went bankrupt for reasons that remain unclear to this day. Grove was developing a non-invasive blood glucose monitor based on a near-infrared through-the-earlobe optical technique called the optical bridge. Almost 20 people lost their jobs, but that is not the worst: for decades, diabetes-sufferers have been pricking their fingers to get a blood sample for blood glucose measurement, and now the leading hope, and any hope, to get rid of those fingerpricks is suddenly in grave danger.

THE TECHNOLOGY

The technology has passed scientific scrutiny ten times, as it has gained ten SBIR (Small Business Innovative Research) grants from the NIH. Extensive clinical testing has been done over many years on over 300 diabetic persons, and the results were the best ever just before the bankruptcy. Here, I can only tell about things that have been made public in the patents. There are many facets to the technology, here is one: - Measuring blood glucose directly by absorption is impossible, and increasing the resolution of the Analog/Digital converter does not help. However, if the rate of change of the signal is used as the signal instead of the signal itself, the resulting superresolution makes it possible to measure blood glucose when the blood content of the tissue is modulated.

I WAS THERE

I, Hannu Harjunmaa, PhD, was one of the two founders of Grove Instruments and its Chief Scientist. The company was founded in 1990 under the name VivaScan Corporation, to commercialize my inventions. I am the lead inventor on most Grove patents (see list). I am pre-diabetic.



NEW START

I founded Valoa Technologies, Inc. in June, 2015, to commercialize my new inventions not involving blood glucose measurement. However, if Valoa is able to acquire the patents from the Grove estate, it will continue the development of the non-invasive blood glucose monitor. If someone else acquires the patents, there is no guarantee that the work will continue.

ARE WE ALONE?

Grove Instruments was not the only company developing a non-invasive blood glucose monitor. We are aware of companies in Israel and the UK and elsewhere having active development projects using different technologies. But, during the last 25 years that I have been in this business, numerous competitors have appeared and disappeared. Yet, someone will make it someday. 

WHAT HAPPENS NEXT

The Trustee of the bankruptcy estate has ordered an auction to be held on January 27, 2016. The assets to be sold are, most importantly, the IP, or the US and international patents. It is impossible to predict the amount of the winning bid. That is the reason this campaign is a Flexible Funding campaign. Valoa Technologies will go to the auction with whatever funds are raised in this campaign, plus a buffer whose size, for obvious reasons, cannot be disclosed here.

WHAT WE ARE TRYING TO DO

The goal of this campaign is to raise enough money to win the auction. Commercialization of a blood glucose monitor is NOT the immediate goal, although, if the campaign is a huge success, it might become possible, too. Only by acquiring the patents can we keep alive the dream of a non-invasive blood glucose monitor. There are many players in the field of blood glucose testing who will be severely hurt by the introduction of a non-invasive device. The companies that make test strips make billions of dollars each year on them (Global Data estimates the strip market size to be $10.9B in 2017). It is conceivable that a large company could participate in the auction, directly or indirectly, only to acquire and then shelve the patents.

WHAT IF WE ARE SUCCESSFUL

If we are hugely successful, the product development may continue immediately. It is more probable, though, that not enough funds are raised to both win the auction and continue development. If that happens, additional funding will be sought.

The world has at least 360 million diagnosed diabetics (and many more undiagnosed). If one percent of them donate to this project an average of $10, the money raised is $36M. That is enough to bring the non-invasive blood glucose monitor to market. 

DIABETES SUFFERERS OF THE WORLD: YOU WANT IT – YOU MAY NOW HAVE IT!  WITH ENOUGH SUPPORT, THIS PROJECT MAY GROW FROM A RESCUE MISSION TO A LIFE-CHANGER FOR ALL THOSE WHO NOW HAVE TO PRICK THEIR FINGERS.

WHAT IF WE ARE NOT SUCCESSFUL

Valoa Technologies has under development a device useful for persons with diabetes. It is a hand-held device that can be used to measure the sugar content of beverages, such as wines, in unopened glass bottles. If Valoa does not win the auction, the funds raised in this campaign will be used to commercialize this product, the Valoa Brix:

Click here to learn more about Valoa Brix

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Challenge #1 is the auction itself. There is no way to predict how high a bid is needed to win it. It could be small, like $10k, if nobody else is interested. If a big company is interested, it may drive the bid to millions of dollars. All we can say now is that more funds is better.

Beyond the auction, challenge #2 is the development of the device itself. Although its results are very promising, there is no guarantee that it will get FDA approval. Another risk is that someone else gets to the market first with a clearly superior product.

story:
No more excuses.

Just hours of heart pounding and sweaty workouts with the Dano home training mat.

Through years of research and development we have carefully selected the ideal material and coating which are all FDA approved.

Our promise is to provide you with the most comfortable and cushioned workout experience, with optimal noise reduction, firmness and be free of any hazardous substances.

This is the one training mat that won't let you down.

 

 

We understand that a simple yoga mat won't cut it when you're looking to train with
weights or just want to workout at home with zero disruptions. We've heard all the
feedback and observations to finally get this mat perfected for those that love to
simply train.

 

 

 


With 24mm of thick foam, our training mat guarantees quieter workouts at home even when using weights.

 

 

 

 


The slip resistant surface is made of EVA material that is also used in sport-shoes, known for firmness and durability.

 

 


Firm cushion provides stability and protects your joints through any workout or post training stretch.

 

 

 


Ultimate protection on any skin with materials tested and certified free of chemicals.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Simply fold the mat and slip it into the lightweight durable carry case for convenient storage and transportation.

 

 

 
"The right level of density is the key to a great workout mat. 
If the mat is too hard, there could be too much pressure on your joints,
and if it's too soft it gets hard to balance.
Dano's home training mat has the perfect amount of cushion
that helps you achieve the best performance."

 

 

"I love the sense of grip on this mat.
I can tell that the anti-slip pattern on the mat
helps me workout with more stability."
 

"The Dano training mat is suitable for high impact exercises
such as burpees and tuck jumps and my entire stretching routine
feels cushioned and comfortable.

Overall very satisfied with what is a simple,
yet versatile and ergonomic product."

"This mat is made for trainers!
It's really heavy duty solid and takes the edge off worrying
that you might crack the floors with weights.
I was most impressed with how grounded I felt working out
compared to other mats that are too soft and thin.
Never thought I could use weights at home
and have my daughter sleeping without any disruption."

 

 

 

 

 

Where It All Started

 

Before becoming the co-founder of Dano and a leading healthy lifestyle advocate, Jessie Jisoo Lee had struggled with weight gain and unsuccessful weight loss in a market that places so much pressure on unrealistic beauty standards for women.

Since having lost 20kg (and maintaining her weight for 6 years) Jisoo has transformed her own health and fitness tips into Dano's total weight loss solution business that’s designed to help Korean women develop a healthier body image and change the perception towards weight loss.

 

 

What we do

 

Habit shaping is at the core of our DNA. We believe having the right source of information, customised workout programs and healthy food products for sustainable weight loss are key towards balanced behaviours and lifestyle. At Dano, we strive to lead this journey and shape healthy routines through our diverse range of services.

story:
GIVE $5 FOR FATIMAH

 

HUMANITARIAN CRISIS IN WESTERN BURMA'S ARAKAN STATE

Between 100,000 - 200,000 in desperate need of food, medicine and shelter.

 

November 18 2012

Fatimah Khatu died today. Nobody cared. Fatimah was a beautiful little girl of only seven. Her mother carried her to our (Partners Relief & Development) end of the camp. She arrived where we were, just as Fatimah took her last breath.

Fatimah’s mother stood by Fatimah’s lifeless body and told us that her other daughter was in the same condition. She could not carry both girls. The sister was still in the tent fighting for life on her own. 

Fatimah died in the dirt. The dirt of a land not her own. Fatimah was not even a number. She was not a citizen of any country. She had no identification. She had no food. She died from dehydration with no medicine or medical care.

 

BACKGROUND

In May 2012, sectarian violence broke out in Arakan State, Western Burma between the Buddhist Rakhine people and the predominately Muslim Rohingya. Despite recent assertions from the Burma Government that the situation has returned to normalcy, violent confrontations continue to occur and thousands of people have been displaced. The UNHCR (United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees) has said that about 80,000 people have been displaced in and around the Sittwe and Maungdaw by the violence[1]. More recent reports and research from Partners staff on the ground in Arakan State in November 2012 suggest that the number is actually much higher. Some suggest that it may be as high as 200,000.

“The crowd of those needing care is growing every day and pressing in upon us. We need help. More teams need to come. More governments of the world need to speak loudly against what is happening here. More donations are necessary to provide any relief,” comment PRAD staff who are currently in Sittwe, Burma.

“We have been here for 11 days (written Nov 18) now and during this time we have seen only one other jeep from any relief organization. Some aid has been delivered but it is not enough. No other help, no other governmental or non-governmental organizations, no other indication that the world cares. Genocide is the only word I know that describes what we are seeing. Unnecessary deaths in a world unaware,” says PRAD team leader.

If more aid doesn’t arrive soon, there is going to be widespread deaths, especially among children.

[1]http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-19263926

 

WHAT WILL YOUR MONEY DO?

It will provide: Food, Shelter, Medicine and Sanitation needs

We currently have a medical team of six working at the camps, distributing and providing medical aid. 

You may wonder how can my money, which may seem like a drop in an ocean of needs, make a difference?  If it means saving even one child, then isn't it worth it?

THIS IS WHY WE HAVE COME. IT'S WHO WE ARE. WE CAN'T DO IT ALONE.
THEY NEED YOU!

 

Partners Relief & Development (PRAD) is a registered charity in six countries.The work of Partners has provided emergency relief and sustainable development for tens of thousands of displaced people in Burma since 1994. PRAD seeks free, full lives for the children of Burma and reconciled communities living in peace.

 

GIVE $5 FOR FATIMAH

story:
Why We're Running

In June, 2007 Pomona College graduate and former Pomona-Pitzer tennis player Erin Noble died tragically in a plane crash. Erin was an ebulliant and passionate teammate, friend, and member of our family who lived each day with vigor and appreciation for his opportunities. While each day without Erin is a tragedy, we are committed to challenging ourselves, reaching outside of our comfort zones, and seeking to become better people with each new day. Each fall, our team spends one Saturday morning conditioning on the beach off of Manhattan Beach Pier. This year, it seemed a fitting tribute to run in the Manhattan Beach 10k, as Erin loved running. Everyone will be wearing this year's team shirts that say, "Be Noble" reminding us to live life for the moment.

Please join us if you are able and willing! If not, we would still love your help. We are trying to raise enough money to cover the entry fees for everyone, as well as raise additional money for College Match.

What We Need

We are hoping to:

  • Raise enough money to cover the entry fees for each of the participants
  • Donate funds to College Match.

About College Match

College Match is a nationally-recognized organization that helps low-income and socioeconomically disadvantaged students attend college. College Match:

  • Focuses on students with strong academic records, those likely to be future leaders in their community and in the nation.

  • Provides intensive one-on-one services to low-income students. Individualized strategies are developed for each student based on the student’s strengths, weaknesses, and personal preferences. The model is the level of support that students in elite schools receive from their counselors and from their affluent parents. The College Match students receive the same level of support and assistance that affluent students receive so that they can participate effectively in the highly competitive college admissions process.

  • To learn more about College Match, please visit their website: http://www.collegematchla.org/index.htm
story_txt:
Why We're Running
In June, 2007 Pomona College graduate and former Pomona-Pitzer tennis player Erin Noble died tragically in a plane crash. Erin was an ebulliant and passionate teammate, friend, and member of our family who lived each day with vigor and appreciation for his opportunities. While each day without Erin is a tragedy, we are committed to challenging ourselves, reaching outside of our comfort zones, and seeking to become better people with each new day. Each fall, our team spends one Saturday morning conditioning on the beach off of Manhattan Beach Pier. This year, it seemed a fitting tribute to run in the Manhattan Beach 10k, as Erin loved running. Everyone will be wearing this year's team shirts that say, "Be Noble" reminding us to live life for the moment.
Please join us if you are able and willing! If not, we would still love your help. We are trying to raise enough money to cover the entry fees for everyone, as well as raise additional money for College Match.


What We Need
We are hoping to:

Raise enough money to cover the entry fees for each of the participants
Donate funds to College Match.



About College Match
College Match is a nationally-recognized organization that helps low-income and socioeconomically disadvantaged students attend college. College Match:

Focuses on students with strong academic records, those likely to be future leaders in their community and in the nation.

Provides intensive one-on-one services to low-income students. Individualized strategies are developed for each student based on the student’s strengths, weaknesses, and personal preferences. The model is the level of support that students in elite schools receive from their counselors and from their affluent parents. The College Match students receive the same level of support and assistance that affluent students receive so that they can participate effectively in the highly competitive college admissions process.

To learn more about College Match, please visit their website: http://www.collegematchla.org/index.htm

story:
Thank you for showing your support and stopping by my Campaign.

     The long term goal is to start a foundation to raise money towards finding a cure for Multiple Sclerosis.

     To do this, my plan is to have several fundraising events a year i.e... BBQ Cook-off, Casino Nights, Musical events, with all proceeds used to benefit the fight for a cure of Multiple Sclerosis.

     The first event is going to be called 'DerekEbikes4Us'. The scope of this event consists of my (Derek Evans, a Multiple Sclerosis patient) riding an electric bike approximately 4200 miles across country from Key West to Seattle beginning February 2013. I plan to film interviews with all of the people I meet along the way and post it on the web site, have a daily video blog and just raise as much awareness about the cause as possible.   

      This campaign is designed to obtain the funding to get the first fundraising event off the ground. I intend to attract people that feel as strongly about finding a cure for Multiple Sclerosis and spreading awareness as I do and ask them to donate and be a large part of this dream.

 

These are the items that are still needed to start the fundraising for the DerekEbikes4Us event.

  • Web Site construction
  • Web Site Hosting
  • Dedicated phone line
  • P.O. Box
  • A 501c3 attorney, (tax deductible status).

      The plan is to get started with everything the day the funds become available. The web site will be up within thirty days, which is also about as long as it will take for the attorney to attain the 501c3. The P.O. Box and phone will be acquired within the first week and all contact info will be given out on the Facebook and Twitter pages.

     Thank you for your support on behalf of all Multiple Sclerosis patients who struggle each day. Together, we can beat this!

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand there are Some people that just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

 

·         MAKE SURE TO LIKE AND SHARE THE LINK!!

·          Follow us on Twitter!

·         Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

story:
Summary:

About 3 months ago the City of Blanco, Texas suffered a tragic loss when the Blanco River flooded and destroyed many homes of the residents. Most of the government relief funds were sent to Wimberley Texas, leaving Blanco residents without a home or with major repairs and no funds. We are asking for your help to get these remaining families back on track to finish building their homes and get on with their lives. 
100% of the funds will go to relief efforts.


Your Impact:

Here is how your contributions will help:

  • Allow families to complete construction to their damaged homes.
  • Allow the city of Blanco to restore damaged roads/bridges.
  • Let families begin to live a normal life again.
  • Restore the city of Blanco.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this page on your Facebook or other social media sites.
  • Email to family/friends.
  • Help spread the word.

story:
Greetings, 

Your contribution to the Typhoon Soudelor relief effort in the Northern Mariana Islands has made a difference to disaster survivors who are still rebuilding their homes and lives. With your help, Karidat Social Services was able to deliver thousands of care packages containing food, water, hygiene supplies, and other relief items to individuals and families in need after the storm.

This holiday season, I want to express my deepest appreciation to you for your compassion and generosity. As our community continues steadily on the path to long-term recovery, know that we will always remember the immense kindness extended to us by our friends near and far.

May God bless you and our Northern Mariana Islands. 

Regards,

Gregorio Kilili Camacho Sablan

story:
Latest Updates:

Follow us on Twitter to get bite size health info: https://twitter.com/SipOfHealth

Like us on Facebook to encourage us to continue the good work: http://www.facebook.com/Sip.of.health

 

“Let food be the medicine and let medicine be the food.” - Hippocrates (father of medicine), 400 BC.

We all rely on our knowledge (or craving) to make the decisions on what we put in our mouth, and ultimately our decisions shape our body, mind and moods. There are many health problems that are directly related to the food we eat.

When we think of food, what come to our mind? Burger, Fries, Soda? Well we can’t blame ourselves. We are born in the world of fast food. Our choices of food are dictated by TV commercials.

Researches shows that many specific foods can serve as powerful natural drugs like cancer fighting, cholesterol reducers, antibiotics, antidepressants, energy boosters, antioxidant, blood pressure lowering, and the list goes on. Food can thus be used as a miracle medicine to prevent and treat many diseases.

I always wondered why this is not taught in our schools. This would be a wonderful knowledge we can give to our kids. As a parent, I always wondered how to make my kids run to eat the fruits or salads on the table as they would run to the sound of the door bell of the Pizza delivery. This book strives at making the art of enjoying fruits and veggies in our everyday life.

Most important asset we all have is our health, and yet we hardly know what our body needs to stay healthy, to fight diseases and to prevent failure of our organs. What we need is an owner’s manual for our body.

Due to my personal quest, I gathered lot of information about specific benefits of the natural foods by going through many books, research journals and health articles. Lot of this information can help us in taking care of our illness, keeping our body and mind healthy. This project is all about presenting the major benefits of the natural foods in a very simple format, which we and our kids will take interest to learn and adopt healthy eating habits.

My goal is to empower the readers with the right information on nature’s gift and motivate all of us to start living the quality of life we are meant to live.

After all, we are what we eat.

I am very passionate about this project. My sincere goal is to bring significant benefits to each and every one of us.

 

Here’s a quick overview of what you’ll be reading about.

We will go over various fruits, vegetables, nuts, herbs and list the kind of health benefits we will be getting from them. We will also show different ways to consume them to make it more adaptable in our daily life.

Will cover other natural foods like Yogurt, Honey, Vinegar, Wheat grass, etc and give information on how they help our body.

Do we know how Acidic and Alkaline foods affect our body? We will have a special chapter on this and go over the good, bad and ugly part of it.

We will also demystify Vitamins, Antioxidants, Detoxification, raw food diet and other topics that will have great impact on our body.

We will cover which foods will help us in Weight loss, Belly fat, prevent hair fall and make our skin beautiful and radiant.

We have a special chapter for food remedies. See which specific foods help in fighting Cancer, Anti-Bacterial, Anti-diabetic, Calming and Sedative, Immunity Stimulating, Memory enhancing, Skin Care/Acne/Pimples, Aging/Wrinkles, Sleep, Stress, Flu/Colds, Bones and whole lot more.

We will show how to create fun and easy recipes, salads, shakes and juices.

We will present the information in a fun way, with diagrams, charts, pictures, quiz, crossword and many more fun ways. We will not present any lengthy thesis. All our information will be presented in a simple and easy to understand format with short paragraphs.

Overall, by the time you go through the book, you will be surprised how much magic is there in the nature’s gift. You will be so much motivated to use this information to adopt a healthy living.

Have a SIP OF HEALTH every day of your life.

 

With your collaboration, we will be raise funds to reach our project budget of $20,000. Over on the right side of this page, you'll see list of perks, starting at $1. Just pick the one that seems right to you and click the link, and IndieGoGo will take you through the simple process of making a contribution. It's easy, and you can use any major credit card or your PayPal account. So choose a perk on the right and let's get started!

Summary of Perks for your contribution,

In addition to your financial contribution, please help spread the word!

Email your friends asking them to check out this IndieGogo page.

Share this IndieGogo page on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, Blogs or any other social media sites. All your support will make a huge difference to this project.

Your funds will help produce a professional-level book, Sip of Health, in electronic and physical format. Will cover the cost of hiring a certified Dietician-Nutritionist, editor, graphic artist, publishing and printing.

Most importantly, you'll be helping to create a valuable resource for all of us who are struggling to improve our health in easy and natural way. And that's priceless.

I desire to see this book become a bestseller, since that would reach and benefit the greatest number of people. Your support will be making an enormous contribution to yourself and countless others.

Any funds raised above and beyond the set goal, will help this project to have a greater impact than the book alone. It will allow us to take this concept to next level. Will help us to develop audio and video version of this project, develop a website and start a newsletter to spread the knowledge and benefit many more folks around the world. 

 

A giant thank you for taking the time to read, consider and contribute to our project. Please spread the word on your social media platforms or by word-of-mouth to friends and family.

Thank you for helping us make this book a reality.

story:
The World Race

I am about to embark on an 11 month missions trip to 11 countries with 60 other amazing individuals! On this trip we will work with local non profits with construction, staffing orphanages, teaching English, working towards abolishing the sex-slave industry, and so many more opportunites!

[ brittanylatray.theworldrace.org ]

Why Running?

Running is a passion of mine that I wanted to incorporate in some way with my fundraising for the World Race! It's not your typical fundraiser, but I'm not your typical individual :)

Why $2,000?

The World Race trip itself costs $15,500! This covers food, lodging, and travel for 11 months on the mission field. I am quickly approaching the half way point, but I need a boost to get me over that mark. $2,000 would exceed this mark and get me going towards that final financial deadline!

Spread the Word!!

Share this link and story and help get the word out!

 

God Bless!!

 

Countries

The Philippines

Thailand

Cambodia

Nepal

India

Rwanda

Uganda

Kenya

Nicaragua

Costa Rica

Honduras

story:
Doggies Helping Veterans

Doggies Helping Veterans is a group of volunteers (and their dogs), led by Emmie the Superdog and her fiancé Snick the Dog, raising money to support Active Heroes in their effort to build and begin operating the Active Heroes Retreat. Emmie is the spokesdog for Active Heroes, and Snickers is a registered therapy dog with Pet Partners International (formerly Delta Society). Doggies Helping Veterans hopes to raise $100,000 of the total $1,000,000 needed for Phase One. The money raised will be used specifically for a dog park and trails and, eventually, to start a pet therapy program.

Emmie and Snickers wanted to do something special to help fund the pet related programs at the Active Heroes Retreat. They thought that a doggie-only cross-country journey would be a unique and fun way to raise awareness and funds. Of course, dogs can't travel the country alone, so they convinced Snick's mom to coordinate a relay-type trip for some stuffed Shiba stand-ins.

What We Need To Get Started

The planning for the journey has begun and people are volunteering all over the country to host Snick & Emmie's stuffed Shiba stand-ins and take their photos in interesting and fun places. Before the journey can actually begin though, about $645.00* needs to be spent.

  • Two black and tan Kosen brand plush Shiba Inu dolls - $240.00
  • Travel bag or crate - $65.00
  • Gear (collars, tags, etc.) - $25.00
  • Map plugin for website - $15.00 (site development and hosting were donated by Snick's mom)
  • Brochure printing - $300.00 (brochure design to be donated, hopefully)

*The goal is set at $694.00 to cover IndieGoGo and PayPal's fees and still leave us with $645.00 for the project. We set this is an "all-or-nothing" campaign because IndieGoGo charges much less for those. If we don't raise the whole $694.00, we won't get anything and the journey won't happen. 

Also, please note that the $645.00 (after fees) raised here is going directly to buy supplies for the project. This money is not going to Active Heroes and is therefore not tax-deductible.

The Active Heroes Retreat

Active Heroes is building a peaceful and tranquil retreat where military families will engage in team building activities and challenge courses. The Active Heroes Retreat will change the quality of life for veterans in many ways. Active Heroes will soon select the land and begin construction of an office, classrooms, sectioned camping sites and log cabins to house the families. Each month, the land will be used to give other military organizations a fun filled adventure getaway while allowing veterans to camp for free. Active Heroes will then work with therapists and social workers to organize classroom sessions to help curb the suicide rate of 22 veterans a day.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can help spread the word about Emmie & Snick's journey. As their stuffed Shiba stand-ins travel the country, we hope to raise awareness and funds for the Active Heroes Retreat. 
  • You can volunteer to host the stuffed Shiba stand-ins in your town and take the photo for the travel journal on their website.

Please read all about the project and follow along with the journey on the Doggies Helping Veterans website.

story:
Asante

Asante is a group of dedicated students that wish to further Bonyo’s Kenya Mission through service at the Mama Pilista Memorial Clinic in the village of Masara, Kenya. Our team of six will enthusiastically be serving the villagers through medicine, dentistry, pharmacy and public health back grounds. We will be traveling to Masara to serve for seven weeks. We will work while we are there to have the biggest impact that we can to improve the total welfare of the villagers. Our team of six all come from the philosophy that medical care is a human right, not a privilege. Many Kenyans will go their entire lives without ever seeing a physician and we wish to make sure all of those in Masara receive first class medical care. 

Pictured above is one of our volunteers, William Wallace, and Dr. Bonyo during his first trip to The Clinic in 2011. 

What We Will Do With Funds

The purpose of this Indiegogo campaign is to bring in funds for our transportation to Ahero. The most expensive portion of this trip will be getting the six of us to Kenya. As of 3/5/2013 ticket prices broke down as such:

Pittsburgh to Kisumu $1763 X 6 = $10,578

Three tickets have been purchased.

Three tickets remain - our remaining need is $5,289

We have made this a short campaign because we want to avoid the rising cost of airline tickets the longer we wait to purchase them. 


We currently have three of the six plane tickets purchased! This is an awesome start but we still have a lot of work to do, and we need your help!!!! The longer it takes us to raise funds for plane tickets, the more it is going to cost us, meaning the less money we can give back to BKM later for pharmaceuticals. The faster we can bring in funds, the greater the good we can do!

 

Bonyo's Kenya Mission - 501(c)(3)

When Dr. Bonyo was a boy his sister died of pneumonia. Most of us are lucky enough to recognize this as a curable disease. This inspired Dr. Bonyo’s vow to one day become a physician, return to his village of Masara, Kenya, and provide proper medical care. Dr. Bonyo not only accomplished his oath of ensuring a public health system, but he also improved the quality of life by guaranteeing every child receives vaccinations, education through high school, and he even helped the villagers learn how to farm poultry.

BKM serves a part of Kenya that is ravaged by HIV, TB, malaria and other curable diseases. Greater than 30% of the population is affected by HIV, making these patients even more susceptible to infection. Treatments that we have readily available are unfortunately not so easily attained for most of the villagers in Masara.  BKM works hard to try to provide the best possible care to those affected by HIV, and gain access to modern treatments for them. HIV was once designated as a disease of “undesirables”. This stigma is the furthest from the truth; many believe that HIV only affects homosexuals and injection-drug users, but the truth is, HIV affects more women than men in sub-Saharan Africa, and Kenya has no significant IV-drug problem. HIV in Kenya is spread primarily through heterosexual couples and by mother to child transmission.  77% of new infections are between heterosexual couples and 20,000 infants are born with HIV infection in Kenya every year. Without AZT medication mothers with HIV will pass the infection to their children, propagating another generation of victims. Education is not enough. Proper medications must be available. Within the past month, BKM has secured government allotment of HIV medications to serve those scourged with HIV in Masara. 

The leading killer in Masara, Kenya continues to be malaria. Malaria is a treatable infection that is caused by a parasite that is transmitted by mosquito. DEET and other mosquito repellants are not readily available to those who are in Kenya. 25 million of 34 million Kenyans are at risk for malaria infection.  Malaria causes 20% of deaths among children in Kenya. BKM is working hard to provide mosquito nets to every family; however, the strain of malaria most common in Masara is a fairly resistant bug, requiring a stronger therapy of mefloquine, which is of course more expensive than previous treatment methods. Many other curable diseases take lives every day in Kenya. Through the Mama Pilista Memorial Clinic, BKM now has nurses and volunteer physicians living in the clinic 24/7.

The purpose of out seven week trip to Kenya is to provide world class care to the people of Masara through any means. Dr. Bonyo has been building BKM from the group up since 1996, and though a lot has been done a lot still remains to be finished. An investment in this mission is an investment in furthering BKM’s reach. BKM is not just dedicated to providing health care to Masara; it is dedicated to passionately improve the total welfare of every single villager.

The Team

We all have different backgrounds, but one thing holds true throughout the group: we all believe medicine is a human right. We are all in this mission to bring first class medical care to Masara and to further BKM’s vision

Our team from top left to bottom right: 

William Wallace - Medical

Patrick Gorby - Public Health

Garrett Hack - Medical

Laura Bevington - Pharmacy

Samantha Pecnik - Dentistry

Olivia Hartman - Public Health

We take BKM's vision very seriously, but we are also seriously good at having fun. 

What you can do:

Today take a step back and be thankful for all that you have. Every day millions of Kenyans go without a source of consistent food, clean water and medical care. Many Kenyans will go their entire life without ever seeing a physician. Bonyo's Kenya Mission seeks to bring an end to this one Kenyan at a time. Asante, is a group of dedicated individuals who will be traveling to Ahero, Kenya for two months working in the clinic and serving the community. Any monetary donations will go directly into funding our trip. Any funds raised above our goal will go to purchasing pharmaceuticals and medical supplies for The Clinic. Can’t give a monetary donation? Please share our page using the Indiegogo tools above!!! Bonyo's Kenya Mission is a 501(c)(3) and all donations will receive a letter stating there donation for tax purposes.
story_txt:
Asante
Asante is a group of dedicated students that wish to further Bonyo’s Kenya Mission through service at the Mama Pilista Memorial Clinic in the village of Masara, Kenya. Our team of six will enthusiastically be serving the villagers through medicine, dentistry, pharmacy and public health back grounds. We will be traveling to Masara to serve for seven weeks. We will work while we are there to have the biggest impact that we can to improve the total welfare of the villagers. Our team of six all come from the philosophy that medical care is a human right, not a privilege. Many Kenyans will go their entire lives without ever seeing a physician and we wish to make sure all of those in Masara receive first class medical care. 

Pictured above is one of our volunteers, William Wallace, and Dr. Bonyo during his first trip to The Clinic in 2011. 
What We Will Do With Funds
The purpose of this Indiegogo campaign is to bring in funds for our transportation to Ahero. The most expensive portion of this trip will be getting the six of us to Kenya. As of 3/5/2013 ticket prices broke down as such:
Pittsburgh to Kisumu $1763 X 6 = $10,578
Three tickets have been purchased.
Three tickets remain - our remaining need is $5,289
We have made this a short campaign because we want to avoid the rising cost of airline tickets the longer we wait to purchase them. 
We currently have three of the six plane tickets purchased! This is an awesome start but we still have a lot of work to do, and we need your help!!!! The longer it takes us to raise funds for plane tickets, the more it is going to cost us, meaning the less money we can give back to BKM later for pharmaceuticals. The faster we can bring in funds, the greater the good we can do!

Patrick Gorby - Public Health

Laura Bevington - Pharmacy
Samantha Pecnik - Dentistry

We take BKM's vision very seriously, but we are also seriously good at having fun.

story:
Project Baby Benefit is a non profit organization dedicated to improving conditions at Hospital Evangélico de Ponta Grossa.

Hospital Evangélico de Ponta Grossa is an underfunded maternity hospital in the city of Ponta Grossa, state of Paraná, Brazil. Although Brazil's healthcare system, SUS (Sistema Único de Saúde), claims to offer complete and free healthcare, the reality is different. Unfortunately, expecting mothers often face many challenges such as hospitals in smaller cities closing due to a shortage of finances and doctors and lack of an Intensive Care Unit at many hospitals. 

Approximately half of the mothers who have babies at Hospital Evangélico (120 mothers per month) do not have the adequate financial situation to provide all the necessary items and care for the baby.

Project Baby Benefit's goal is to fundraise as much as possible to purchase essential items for the hospital, babies, and mothers. These items will be purchased in Ponta Grossa from local vendors and range from basic hygiene products to medical equipment. Our goal is to provide a kit for babies and mothers including diapers, clothes, and soap along with additional support to the hospital by donating wheelchairs, pediatric stethoscopes, and thermometers.

Our site is currently under construction; however, for more information feel free to visit our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/projectbabybenefit.

story: We are a bunch of kids who have written scripts and we are actually learning our moves from guys who know who to do them safely, and Internet videos. We want to put on live events and public access television tapings, but we need money to build a ring, make and buy potential accessories and belts, and put on successful shows.  So we really need money, and please help us reach our goal.
