story:
I have experienced first hand, in my life, and in the lives of my siblings, the harmful affects of traumatic births and how they imprint our orientation to life and relationships. Early experiences of moderate child abuse and neglect also colored my orientation to life. 

Despite this, I helped raise my siblings, put myself through college and a master’s degree, survived two date-rapes, domestic violence, divorce, and a traumatic brain injury, among other challenges. These beginnings led me to seek out psychotherapy which in turn opened the pathway to massage therapy, Biodynamic Craniosacral Therapy and integrative wellness. 

The Perinatal Trauma Resolution approach has given me, as an adult, experiences which have repaired and continue to repair an easily activated nervous system. By continuing training in this system I will be able to bring advanced skills to support resourcing, re-patterning and repair for babies, children, adults and families. 

My intention, through this Indiegogo Campaign, is to expand my support of others in overcoming obstacles and rebuilding health and well-being.

The advanced trainings with Myrna Martin, are designed to provide the skills required to support babies, children and adults to heal from early adverse imprinting in the prenatal and early years. The advanced curriculum includes four day trainings on each of the following topics:

  • Couples Therapy from an Attachment Perspective
  • Prematurity
  • In-depth work with Infants
  • Group dynamics in Process Workshops with Adults
  • Adoption
  • Family Dynamics and Attachment Therapy with Preschoolers and Older Children
  • Sand and Art Play Therapy for Children and Adults in PPN.

Two days of each training will include the latest clinical, theoretical and research material related to the topic based in: 

  • Neuroscience
  • Embryology
  • Attachment Theory
  • Obstetrics and Gynecology
  • Somatic Therapy
  • Consciousness Studies
  • Psychotherapy

One day will be an opportunity for each participant to do a piece of their own personal  pre and perinatal work, with support. The fourth day will be in depth case consultation and integration.  Participants and teaching assistants will have an opportunity to bring material for the case consultations.

Practitioners must know the journey from within themselves and in relationship to others to be able to provide the facilitation to babies, children, parents and other adults for their journey. The skills of quiet presence, compassion, empathy, tracking the autonomic nervous system, self-regulation, somatic and verbal communication, and contact between each other, and bridging connection between others in the family or group.

This work comes from the perspective that all behaviors and human conditions are expressions of inherent health. We constantly ask the questions: Where is the health in the system? Where is the resource? about an individual, group or family. All of us come to this planet with a tremendous capacity to survive and adapt from the point of preconception, conception, implantation, discovery, birth and into our life.

This ability to adapt to the environment we find ourselves in leads to the particular survival skills we each developed as creative responses to early adverse, stressful or traumatic experiences. They can be held in our bodies as sensations, behaviors, feelings, beliefs, images, postures, macro and micro movement patterns, craniosacral patterns. These capacities helped us survive and get to this point in our lives, but they are often not the most useful ways to be fully in our present life. 

Through this training I will be able to deepen my capacity to work together with clients (babies, children, families and adults), supporting them in learning new ways of being with others and themselves, and to re-pattern these response templates from early adverse imprinting, while being very respectful of the compensation patterns (adaptive survival mechanisms), and support these skills when they are needed. It is only from this place that we can effectively increase the options for our lives. We then come closer to our authentic self, our true nature, and truly appreciate the health in our systems. 


What Are Some Known Causes Of Early Trauma?

Most of us have experienced some level of stress or trauma in our early life. Some was medically necessary. The long-term impact is in proportion to the severity and length of the trauma as well as the level the trauma interferes with the child connecting with its parents. Any experience is less traumatic if accompanied by loving support and connection. Some known causes of early trauma are: 

  • Stressful or abusive relationship between parents during pregnancy or after birth
  • Maternal stress, fear or depression during pregnancy or infancy
  • Child was not wanted for some part of pregnancy
  • Unwelcoming or fearful feelings at discovery of pregnancy
  • Considered or attempted abortion
  • Biochemical stresses during pregnancy from nicotine, alcohol, pesticides, etc.
  • Twin lost during pregnancy including early pregnancy or during birth
  • Chemical induction of labor
  • Fetal monitors that are screwed into fetus’ skull
  • Premature birth
  • NICU experience with all accompanying medical interventions
  • Unusually long or unusually fast labor
  • Being stuck during labor
  • Cord tightly wrapped around the neck
  • Near death experience or deprivation of oxygen
  • Medical interventions such as C-section, forceps, vacuum extraction
  • Anesthesia which breaks the contact between mom and baby
  • Separation from the mother after birth or for extended periods during infancy
  • Painful medical interventions such as heal sticks, spinal taps, etc.
  • Maternal postpartum depression or strong anxiety
  • Being given up for adoption
  • Death in the family
  • Unresolved traumatic history in parents or ancestors, such as early abuse, loss of a parent, traumatic birth, or being given up for adoption
  • Hospitalization or surgery as an infant, including circumcision
  • Any particularly painful accident, injury or illness


What are Some Of The Signs Babies Exhibit After Experiencing Trauma?

  • Glossed-over eyes
  • Cross-eyes or divergent eyes
  • Total or partial inability to orient when confronted by new surroundings
  • Too little tone or too much tension in their muscles
  • Startle response to sound or movement
  • Jerky arms, legs and head
  • Involuntary shaking or tremors
  • Constant, weak, or “absent” crying
  • High-pitched crying sounds
  • Inconsolable crying and crying without apparent cause
  • Hypersensitivity to near or direct touch
  • Desire to not be held
  • Falling asleep when over-stimulated
  • Inability to grasp
  • Nursing/feeding difficulties arching
  • Splaying hands
  • Excessive hiccups
  • Frequent gagging
  • Avoidance of eye-contact


What Are Some Of The Signs Older Children 
Exhibit After Experiencing Trauma?

  • Hyperactivity
  • Coordination and balance problems
  • Gait problems
  • Toilet training challenges
  • Speech delays
  • Learning disabilities
  • Tantrums
  • Inappropriate aggression/timidity
  • Depression
  • Nightmares
  • Response out of proportion to stimulus
  • Inability to make eye contact
  • Inability to ask for help
  • Rage toward parent(s) or others
  • Hypersensitivity
  • Health challenges like asthma and seizures
  • Harmful behavior towards siblings
  • Tactile defensiveness (desire to not be touched)


What Are Common Signs In Adults Of Early Trauma?

All of us have experienced early stress or trauma to one level or another. Unresolved early trauma can significantly interfere with our current daily life. As more recent traumatic events occur, they begin to layer on top of our earliest imprinting. In fact, our ability to recover from traumatic events as older children and adults is dependent on our resilience or lack of it due to our earliest traumatic imprinting. Teens and adults can manifest any of the signs listed under children plus:

  • Difficulty in forming and maintaining a healthy primary relationship with a partner
  • Aggression manifested as acting out, destructive or criminal behavior
  • Excessive timidity in everyday life
  • Inappropriate flight or fight response to non-threatening circumstances
  • Difficulty mobilizing effectively in the face of real aggression or danger
  • Difficulty in setting healthy limits and boundaries, saying ‘no’ when appropriate
  • Merging inappropriately with others to one’s own detriment
  • Difficulty in responding empathetically to others
  • Confusion, difficulty making decisions
  • Self-destructive behaviors such as drug and alcohol abuse, physical mutilation, over or under eating
  • Excessive risk taking, dangerous driving, disregarding the safety of others
  • Forced sex or having unprotected sex when children are not wanted
  • Failing to take responsibility for one’s actions, blaming others
  • Difficulty setting appropriate goals and working toward them
  • Difficulty in foreseeing the consequences of one’s actions.
  • Consistent difficulty with some aspect of a task: intention, preparation, action, follow through or integration.
  • Difficulty holding a job or establishing oneself in a satisfying career
  • Inability to successfully establish oneself in the world as an independent adult
  • Difficulties in parenting, abusive or neglectful behavior towards children
  • Difficulty in establishing an effective support system of family, friends, teachers, mentors, and/or professionals


About Angela

Angela Ferri is an herbalist, biodynamic craniosacral and massage therapist, practitioner of The Arvigo Techniques of Maya Abdominal Therapy (ATMAT), and perinatal educator. Her approach arises out of her work as a somatic therapist, and ATMAT practitioner. She is passionate about empowering birth, women and families through facilitating mind-body integration.

Angela is the product of a traumatic birth herself, and is the eldest child of a mother with Traumatic Brain Injuries. She is also a member of the club of women whom have both lost children and have never borne them. She holds an MA in Fine Arts, designed publications professionally for over eleven years, then found her way to the healing arts through training in somatic therapies. She is a Registered Craniosacral Therapist in the Biodynamic Craniosacral method, and former instructor of the Arvigo Techniques of Maya Abdominal Therapy. Her work combines somatic therapies with pre and perinatal psychology to help give families with babies and small children the best possible start.

Angela also combines herbal and nature studies with her somatic therapy, through eclectic, indigenous perspectives. She is nationally certified as a massage therapist with education and experience in many modalities, and is continuing her study of pre and perinatal psychology.

Specific training for working with babies includes:

  • Biodynamic Craniosacral Therapy certification, with Roger Gilchrist (2010-2012, 400 hours)
  • Prenatal, Birth, Attachment Professional Training with Myrna Martin (2013-2014, 300 hours)
  • Supporting the Newborn Family: Healing Approaches with Parents and their Newborn Babies, with midwife, Mary Jackson (2014, 6 hours)
  • Womb Surround Process workshops with Myrna Martin (multiple 5 day sessions)

I have had a successful healing arts practice in the DC area since 1992. To read more about the services I offer visit www.bodyandsoulhealingarts.com. 


The Broad Reach of Your Contribution: 

Part of well-being is feeling resourced. A person who feels well-resourced is able to contribute to the betterment of our world. By purchasing any of my offerings you will be contributing three-fold; 

  1. by helping me support others on their healing path; 
  2. by helping others achieve greater well being; and 
  3. by supporting your own healing journey. 

And of course all of this intentional resourcing will help create resilience for all of us, our well-being rippling outward touching all within our communities.


What I need from you, and what I'm offering:

Thank you for helping make my dream a reality, I'm offering some perks for you to enjoy. I find that my supporters love to help spread the word about my services to people who think might benefit from them. I'll also put your name as a contributor to funding my training on my website for a minimum of one year - probably much longer.

I am offering your choice of the following list of services to support your resourcing. Please see my website to peruse the consultation and bodywork services I offer.

  • For $5 you will get a very sincere thank you from me. 
  • For $10 you will receive a thank you video from me. I will thank you by name in a video while I am sitting someplace resourcing, outdoors. There will be one video thanking everyone who donates at this level. The video will be posted on my website (where it will remain for at least one year), social media, and she will also send you a copy.
  • For $25 you will receive a 15 minute phone or video consultation with me around a specific health issue you would like support with.
  • For $45 you will receive a half hour phone or video consultation with me to explore a particular health issue you would like support with.
  • For $90, you will receive an hour phone or video consultation with me. You'll fill out a health intake form that you'll share with me, and which we will discuss, with my sharing with you herbs, supplements, and other health practices that will support your achieving improved well-being.
  • For $90, you will receive an hour bodywork session with me. 
  • For $135, you will receive an hour and a half phone or video consultation with me. You'll fill out a health intake form that you'll share with me, and which we will discuss, with my sharing with you herbs, supplements, and other health practices that will support your achieving improved well-being. This length of time allows for more in-depth exploration of underlying factors contributing to your challenges, and also allows for more useful, often sometimes surprising discoveries.
  • For $135, you will receive an hour and a half bodywork session with me.
  • For $405, you will receive a four hour Maya Abdominal Therapy session. Please see my website for a detailed explanation of this work.

All of these services are at reduced fees from my usual rates, and can be redeemed during the months of July through mid-September of 2014, and January and February of 2015. Bodywork sessions are offered at my Cabin John office.

Of course, donations are also welcome, through Paypal or other arrangement.

If I don't reach my financial goal of $5400, I will still be able to take some of the trainings listed below, and/or a process workshop, which is also a prerequisite for me working with adults in groups. 

  • Couples Therapy from an Attachment Perspective
  • Prematurity
  • In-depth work with Infants
  •  Group dynamics in Process Workshops with Adults
  • Adoption
  • Family Dynamics and Attachment Therapy with Preschoolers and Older Children
  • Sand and Art Play Therapy for Children and Adults in PPN.

The fee for each of the trainings is $650, plus lodging. Also included in my total is a five-day process workshop with a fee of $800, which is also a prerequisite for working with adults in group settings.


The Impact

Through this training I will be able to deepen my capacity to work together with clients (babies, children, families and adults), supporting them in learning new ways of being with others and themselves, and to re-pattern these response templates from early adverse imprinting. It is only from this place that we can effectively increase the options for our lives. We then come closer to our authentic self, our true nature, and truly appreciate the health in our systems. 

The resourcing of babies, children, families and adults will help shift the consciousness of our world toward more functional behaviors in our communities. This can only be good for our planet and our communities.

I've launched one other crowd-funding campaign in the past. It was successful in that it brought me a contributor who paid for one of the $800 foundation modules; a prerequisite for attending these advanced trainings. I am eternally grateful to her. 

I am truly grateful for your attention and interest, and hope you can find a way to support my dream. Thank you!


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Please share this campaign with your community. Talk with your friends about it. You may even know someone who might benefit from this work, and not know it. 
  • You can use Indiegogo's share tools to spread the word through Facebook, Twitter and your own email list.

Thank you so much for your time and consideration! 

Warmly, Angela

It is only from this place that we can effectively increase the options for our lives. We then come closer to our authentic self, our true nature, and truly appreciate the health in our systems. What Are Some Known Causes Of Early Trauma?
Most of us have experienced some level of stress or trauma in our early life. Some was medically necessary. The long-term impact is in proportion to the severity and length of the trauma as well as the level the trauma interferes with the child connecting with its parents. Any experience is less traumatic if accompanied by loving support and connection. Some known causes of early trauma are: 


Stressful or abusive relationship between parents during pregnancy or after birth
Maternal stress, fear or depression during pregnancy or infancy
Child was not wanted for some part of pregnancy
Unwelcoming or fearful feelings at discovery of pregnancy
Considered or attempted abortion
Biochemical stresses during pregnancy from nicotine, alcohol, pesticides, etc.
Twin lost during pregnancy including early pregnancy or during birth
Chemical induction of labor
Fetal monitors that are screwed into fetus’ skull
Premature birth
NICU experience with all accompanying medical interventions
Unusually long or unusually fast labor
Being stuck during labor
Cord tightly wrapped around the neck
Near death experience or deprivation of oxygen
Medical interventions such as C-section, forceps, vacuum extraction
Anesthesia which breaks the contact between mom and baby
Separation from the mother after birth or for extended periods during infancy
Painful medical interventions such as heal sticks, spinal taps, etc.
Maternal postpartum depression or strong anxiety
Being given up for adoption
Death in the family
Unresolved traumatic history in parents or ancestors, such as early abuse, loss of a parent, traumatic birth, or being given up for adoption
Hospitalization or surgery as an infant, including circumcision
Any particularly painful accident, injury or illness

What are Some Of The Signs Babies Exhibit After Experiencing Trauma?

Glossed-over eyes
Cross-eyes or divergent eyes
Total or partial inability to orient when confronted by new surroundings
Too little tone or too much tension in their muscles
Startle response to sound or movement
Jerky arms, legs and head
Involuntary shaking or tremors
Constant, weak, or “absent” crying
High-pitched crying sounds
Inconsolable crying and crying without apparent cause
Hypersensitivity to near or direct touch
Desire to not be held
Falling asleep when over-stimulated
Inability to grasp
Nursing/feeding difficulties arching
Splaying hands
Excessive hiccups
Frequent gagging

Avoidance of eye-contact



What Are Some Of The Signs Older Children Exhibit After Experiencing Trauma?

Hyperactivity
Coordination and balance problems
Gait problems
Toilet training challenges
Speech delays
Learning disabilities
Tantrums
Inappropriate aggression/timidity
Depression
Nightmares
Response out of proportion to stimulus
Inability to make eye contact
Inability to ask for help
Rage toward parent(s) or others
Hypersensitivity
Health challenges like asthma and seizures
Harmful behavior towards siblings
Tactile defensiveness (desire to not be touched)



What Are Common Signs In Adults Of Early Trauma?
All of us have experienced early stress or trauma to one level or another. Unresolved early trauma can significantly interfere with our current daily life. As more recent traumatic events occur, they begin to layer on top of our earliest imprinting. In fact, our ability to recover from traumatic events as older children and adults is dependent on our resilience or lack of it due to our earliest traumatic imprinting. Teens and adults can manifest any of the signs listed under children plus:

Difficulty in forming and maintaining a healthy primary relationship with a partner
Aggression manifested as acting out, destructive or criminal behavior
Excessive timidity in everyday life
Inappropriate flight or fight response to non-threatening circumstances
Difficulty mobilizing effectively in the face of real aggression or danger
Difficulty in setting healthy limits and boundaries, saying ‘no’ when appropriate
Merging inappropriately with others to one’s own detriment
Difficulty in responding empathetically to others
Confusion, difficulty making decisions
Self-destructive behaviors such as drug and alcohol abuse, physical mutilation, over or under eating
Excessive risk taking, dangerous driving, disregarding the safety of others
Forced sex or having unprotected sex when children are not wanted
Failing to take responsibility for one’s actions, blaming others
Difficulty setting appropriate goals and working toward them
Difficulty in foreseeing the consequences of one’s actions.
Consistent difficulty with some aspect of a task: intention, preparation, action, follow through or integration.
Difficulty holding a job or establishing oneself in a satisfying career
Inability to successfully establish oneself in the world as an independent adult
Difficulties in parenting, abusive or neglectful behavior towards children

Difficulty in establishing an effective support system of family, friends, teachers, mentors, and/or professionals


About Angela

Angela Ferri is an herbalist, biodynamic craniosacral and massage therapist, practitioner of The Arvigo Techniques of Maya Abdominal Therapy (ATMAT), and perinatal educator. Her approach arises out of her work as a somatic therapist, and ATMAT practitioner. She is passionate about empowering birth, women and families through facilitating mind-body integration.Angela is the product of a traumatic birth herself, and is the eldest child of a mother with Traumatic Brain Injuries. She is also a member of the club of women whom have both lost children and have never borne them. She holds an MA in Fine Arts, designed publications professionally for over eleven years, then found her way to the healing arts through training in somatic therapies. She is a Registered Craniosacral Therapist in the Biodynamic Craniosacral method, and former instructor of the Arvigo Techniques of Maya Abdominal Therapy. Her work combines somatic therapies with pre and perinatal psychology to help give families with babies and small children the best possible start.Angela also combines herbal and nature studies with her somatic therapy, through eclectic, indigenous perspectives. She is nationally certified as a massage therapist with education and experience in many modalities, and is continuing her study of pre and perinatal psychology.Specific training for working with babies includes:

Biodynamic Craniosacral Therapy certification, with Roger Gilchrist (2010-2012, 400 hours)

Prenatal, Birth, Attachment Professional Training with Myrna Martin (2013-2014, 300 hours)
Supporting the Newborn Family: Healing Approaches with Parents and their Newborn Babies, with midwife, Mary Jackson (2014, 6 hours)
Womb Surround Process workshops with Myrna Martin (multiple 5 day sessions)
